finding: As a top finding associated with sex differences in hearing loss, rs13399656 was mapped to SPTBN1 and linked with estrogen signaling pathways.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs10196237 was associated with impulsivity, showcasing its previously novel relevance to educational attainment.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: Significant association for rs12713405 was reported, marking its potential influence on impulsivity-related behaviors.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The SNP rs16831319 concerns the COL5A2 gene, which encodes a type V collagen critical in connective tissue structure. Its interplay with HEM pathology was underscored, particularly in relation to connective tissue disorders associated with the disease.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: The rs1518395 variant in the 2p16.1 region demonstrated significant associations with multiple psychiatric disorders, including schizophrenia and major depressive disorder. It was primarily associated with the default mode network in resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2947349 variant, also located at 2p16.1, was implicated in epilepsy and showed strong association with the default mode network during resting fMRI, indicating its relevance in neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2678897 variant located at 2p16.1 was associated with psychological traits including neuroticism and subjective well-being, predominantly affecting the default mode network and reflecting its role in emotional and mental health.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel ALL risk variant on 2q22.1, with an odds ratio of 1.28 (95% CI: 1.15-1.41) and a significant association with ALL (<P<sub>ALL</sub>=2.5×10<sup>−6</sup>). It acted as an eQTL for MCM6 and CXCR4, suggesting its role in regulating pathways related to DNA replication and immune cell migration.
title: Genetic Determinants of Blood Cell Traits Influence Susceptibility to Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs201254634 was identified as a splicing variant, c.514+2T>A, in the PRKRA gene. This variant had not previously been reported in the literature for dystonia, but it was present in dbSNP. The PRKRA gene itself is associated with DYT-PRKRA (DYT16), a form of dystonia, where pathogenic variants have been shown to affect the gene's function. This connection to dystonia signifies the potential importance of analyzing genetic variants, such as rs201254634, in understanding the genetic underpinnings of parkinsonism disorders in individuals presenting with SWEDD.
title: Dystonia-Parkinsonism Gene Variants in Individuals with Parkinsonism and Brain Scans without Evidence for Dopaminergic Deficit (SWEDD)

finding: The SNP rs7594852 was identified as having a fetal-only effect related to gestational duration, specifically tied to preterm delivery. Its findings were robust, reflecting a significant impact on this phenotype independently of the parental allele. This SNP was the lone existing fetal genetic variant of interest in the context of gestational duration.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: The variant rs4364036 was implicated as a sentinel variant associated with short-term varenicline effectiveness, indicating potential genetic influences in smoking cessation during early treatment phases.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: This SNP was linked to a higher risk of developing Alzheimer's Disease, with an Odds ratio of 5.7 in carriers, indicating its importance in the context of memory decline and AD pathology.
title: Rare genetic coding variants associated with age-related episodic memory decline implicate distinct memory pathologies in the hippocampus

finding: This variant was identified as being enriched in African/African American populations and was associated with a lower odds ratio for type 2 diabetes (T2D), demonstrating an association in a known T2D-associated region near GCKR.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: This rare variant demonstrated a strong protective effect against T2D, particularly in African ancestry groups, with a remarkably low odds ratio indicating significant risk reduction.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The SNP rs1427407, a functional enhancer variant in the BCL11A gene, had a posterior probability of causality of 1.0, highlighting its significant role in regulating fetal hemoglobin levels.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: Similar to rs1427407, the SNP rs7606173, also a functional enhancer variant in BCL11A, was associated with a posterior probability of causality of 1.0, signifying its crucial involvement in fetal hemoglobin modulation.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: The SNP rs3923113, associated with the GRB14 gene, demonstrated significant associations in the liability GWAS for type 2 diabetes and was not detected in the binary approach. This assertion was consistent with previous genetic studies on the trait.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs147918541 was identified as intronic to the long non-coding RNA gene LINC00298, with a meta-analysis P-value of 2.44x10-4, indicating a significant association with AD.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: The SNP rs4148325 was associated with disorders of bilirubin excretion, which was reported at a p-value of 5e-62 in the GWAS Catalog. This association was considered an original finding as it related to the phenotype's underlying biological mechanisms.
title: The Michigan Genomics Initiative: a biobank linking genotypes and electronic clinical records in Michigan Medicine patients

finding: The SNP rs887829 in the UGT1A1 gene demonstrated a recessive effect on total bilirubin levels. This SNP was strongly linked to variation in bilirubin levels and known associations with Gilbert’s syndrome, a genetic disorder characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance.
title: Improved prediction of blood biomarkers using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs266058 showed a strong association with ADHD in the GWAS catalog and was linked to the volume of grey matter in the left amygdala (p < 2 × 10^-24). Additionally, it was correlated to the isthmus cingulate cortex in ENIGMA3 (p < 2 × 10^-4), highlighting the importance of these regions in emotional self-regulation in ADHD.
title: A Multimodal Foundation Model for Discovering Genetic Associations with Brain Imaging Phenotypes

finding: The GG genotype and G allele of the D543N polymorphism (rs17235409) were found to be significantly associated with increased susceptibility to tuberculosis, with a prevalence of 84% in the case group compared to 72% in the control group (P=0.0405). Additionally, the G allele frequency was 90% in the cases versus 81.5% in the controls (P=0.015). Conversely, the A allele was significantly less common in TB patients, suggesting a role in resistance.
title: Relationship between common polymorphisms of NRAMP1 gene and pulmonary tuberculosis in Lorestan LUR population

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was identified in the GCKR region on chromosome 2 with a significant association to triglyceride levels, displaying a p-value of 5.67 × 10^-11 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 35.7%. This finding was critical in the study as it fulfilled the genome-wide significance threshold.
title: Two-phase sample selection strategies for design and analysis in post-genome wide association fine-mapping studies

finding: The SNP rs143080277 was in complete linkage disequilibrium (LD, R²=0.99) with a 5.5 Kb deletion located 8 Kb upstream of the NCK2 gene, indicating its potential contribution to Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The SNP rs139643391 was in high LD (R²=0.94) with a 5.2 Kb deletion in an intron of the NBEAL1 gene, contributing to associations with AD.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The rs887829 variant was significantly associated with UGT1A3 gene expression levels in the liver, with a normalized effect size of 0.46 (P = 3.8 x 10^-14). This association supports the relevance of this locus in bilirubin metabolism.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: The rs560887 variant was identified at the G6PC2 locus, which is linked to blood glucose concentration. MultiSuSiE fine-mapped rs560887 as a significant variant with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) greater than 0.5. This variant was previously validated in experimental assays and was shown to impact G6PC2 splicing. It was successfully fine-mapped using the Eur94k dataset and not found in the Afr47k or Eur47k datasets due to various factors related to linkage disequilibrium.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The rs492594 variant was found at the G6PC2 locus and related to blood glucose concentration. MultiSuSiE identified it despite failures in being fine-mapped in the Afr47k, Eur47k, and Eur94k cohorts. The variant is known to impact G6PC2 protein abundance and G6Pase activity. It exhibited weak linkage with rs560887 in single-variant analyses, which complicated its fine-mapping.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The rs6545389 SNP was reported as a novel genome-wide significant finding associated with self-reported moderate physical activity (PA) with a p-value of 3.5×10²⁻⁸.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The CC genotype at rs1990760 in IFIH1 was significantly associated with an increased risk of developing invasive pulmonary aspergillosis (IPA) in hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) recipients. This increased risk occurred when the variant was carried by the recipient in a recessive genetic model, establishing a link between this SNP and the inflammatory response in patients.
title: MAVS expression in alveolar macrophages is essential for host resistance against Aspergillus fumigatus

finding: The variant rs6712151 in the INHBB gene was reported as a novel PCOS signal. Its association with reproductive hormone pathways highlighted the genetic factors influencing hormonal balances pertinent to the features of PCOS.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs13004711 at the FSHR locus replicated earlier associations seen in Han Chinese, marking it as a significant finding in the context of PCOS in a majority European-ancestry study. This expanded understanding of genetic links to reproductive hormone signaling in PCOS.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs17034876, located in the EPAS1 gene region, was significantly associated with pregnancy loss and birth weight. In a genome-wide association study (GWAS) using the UK Biobank, the SNP showed a staggering p-value of 7.1E-28 which indicated a strong statistical connection to pregnancy complications. Furthermore, replication was supported by another GWAS focused on birth weight, which reported a p-value of 3.1E-47 for the same locus. This suggested a critical role for genetic variants in the EPAS1 region in influencing both pregnancy outcomes and birth weight, potentially through dysregulation of transcriptional mechanisms affecting trophoblast cell lineage development.
title: Active remodeling of the chromatin landscape directs extravillous trophoblast cell lineage development

finding: Associated with the FLL IIb phenotype, this SNP was identified as an exonic variant in the AHSA2P gene, suggesting its involvement in lipid disorder genetics.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: Identified as a key contributor to type IIb and type IV phenotypes, this variant is located ~500kb upstream of IRS1, previously linked to increased type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: This lead CAD risk variant was found in close proximity to rs2943641 and is indicative of its connection to CAD risk through mechanisms associated with lipid profiles.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The SNP rs2011425 demonstrated a significant association with ANC with a beta coefficient of 0.45 (p=0.026). This result indicated that each minor allele was associated with an increase in ANC of 450 cells/mm3. The findings were part of a broader analysis considering the metabolic ratio between clozapine and norclozapine in relation to neutrophil counts.
title: Clozapine metabolism is associated with Absolute Neutrophil Count in individuals with treatment-resistant schizophrenia

finding: The variant rs58235267, located in OTX1 at 2p15, was associated with PSA levels with a genome-wide significance level of P = 4.9 x 10^-13. It was among the 82 novel PSA-associated variants discovered in a meta-analysis of 95,768 men, potentially influencing PSA variation.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs79625619 in THADA at 2p21 showed a significant association with PSA (P = 1.7 x 10^-13). This finding was part of the discovery of 82 novel variants that contributed to understanding genetic determinants of PSA levels.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs11899863 associated with THADA exhibited a strong association with PSA variation (P = 1.7 x 10^-13), contributing to the identified variants governing PSA screening metrics.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs10193919 in LDAH at 2p24.21 displayed strong significance (P = 1.5 x 10^-15), contributing to the understanding of heritable variations in PSA levels.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs7566405 variant was detected in cross-ancestry analyses and associated with overall CH, showing an OR of 0.94 [0.93-0.96] and a P-value of 1.03 x 10^-8, contributing to an expanded understanding of risk loci.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The rs2280334 variant at the MEIS1 locus revealed an increased risk of DNMT3A-CH, with an OR of 1.08 [1.05-1.10] and a P-value of 2.30 x 10^-8, establishing its importance in CH risk stratification.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The BP allele of rs6748341 was associated with decreased expression of CUL3 in the brain cortex (P = 4.91×10−6). This SNP was highlighted as the most significant BP SNP.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP is in very high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs6748341 (LD R2 = 0.99) and was noted to be genome-wide significant for association with schizophrenia (SCZ).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The BP allele of rs11681451 was also linked to decreased expression of CUL3, analyzed across multiple brain regions with significant p-values: Cortex (P = 1.81×10−6), Hippocampus (P = 1.95×10−5), and Caudate (P = 2.33×10−5).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The BP allele of rs55775495 was associated with increased expression of SF3B1 in the central nervous system (P = 2.68×10−15) and other nervous system regions, indicating its role in splicing pathways.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP was in very high LD (R2 = 0.88) with rs55775495 and was found to be genome-wide significant for association with SCZ while showing nearly identical expression results for SF3B1.
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs17022452, located near the gene GAPDHP25, was identified in the context of its interaction with rs3822019 in relation to Parkinson's Disease. Individuals homozygous for rs17022452_GG also showed a strong association with the disease, with 75% of such individuals classified as cases. This finding emphasized the importance of gene-gene interaction involving this SNP and its relevance to the risk factors for Parkinson's Disease.
title: Interaction-based feature selection algorithm outperforms polygenic risk score in predicting Parkinson’s Disease status

finding: Associated with the gene GTF3C2, this SNP was noted as one of the significant causal variants contributing to the addiction risk.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Mapped to the gene ZNF512, this SNP was identified as a significant contributor to the genetic risk associated with substance use disorders in the studied population.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was linked to RP11-89K21.1 and considered part of the significant findings related to addiction risk, emphasizing its potential role in genetic susceptibility.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Associated with SIX3, this SNP was recognized in the context of the genetic landscape influencing addiction liability.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was linked to CTD-2026C7.1 and demonstrated significance in contributing to the genetic risk for substance-related disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP was mapped to the VRK gene, indicating its potential role in the genetic architecture of addiction-related traits.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Mapped to GCKR, this SNP had significant implications in the metabolic pathways relevant to alcohol consumption.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with cervical ectropion with a p-value of 5.1 × 10−16 and was part of the region also associated with cervicitis, indicating a significant role in cervical pathology.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was associated with both cervicitis and cervical dysplasia with a p-value of 3.9 × 10−10, suggesting it serves as a critical signal for both conditions.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was associated with cervical dysplasia with a p-value of 3.2 × 10−9 near DAPL1, suggesting a role in early epithelial differentiation and potential suppression of cell proliferation.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Found in the intron of PAX8 and associated with cervical cancer at a p-value of 9.4 × 10−15, indicating its significant role in cervical biology.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP overlapped with regulatory elements and was significant in the cervical cancer context, supporting its role in the pathology.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs538479553, related to the gene FAM98A, was found to interact with long sleep duration (LTST) for systolic blood pressure (SBP), showing a P-value of 3.3×10^-9, highlighting its importance in blood pressure regulation.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs141117715, related to KCNJ3, showed considerable interaction with STST for PP in Hispanic analysis with a P-value of 1.7×10^-8, adding to the genetic basis of hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs12471304 within the ACMSD gene, integral to the kynurenine pathway, was associated with verbal and non-verbal phenotypes in ASD, emphasizing its relevance to neuroprotective mechanisms linked to ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The rs1990760 SNP in the IFIH1 gene was found to have significant effects on systemic inflammation and outcomes in critically ill COVID-19 patients. This finding related to the genetic predisposition to inflammatory responses, indicating that the allelic variations in this SNP could influence the regulation mechanisms of inflammation and potentially the response to glucocorticoid treatment in severe cases.
title: Glucocorticoid-driven gene expression in circulating monocytes and neutrophils in health and severe inflammation

finding: The rs6733839 variant located near the BIN1 gene was significantly associated with longevity.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs876461 variant near the PRKD3 gene was associated with longevity, linking cardiovascular traits.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs13420463 variant was associated with systolic blood pressure and linked to longevity.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: This SNP demonstrated strong evidence of association with the delayed recall memory phenotype, showing a P value of 8.78E-08, which was very close to the genome-wide significance threshold. The finding pointed to the EHBP1 gene, which encodes a protein implicated in GLUT4 transport.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease brain imaging biomarkers and neuropsychological phenotypes in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs9282858 was noted for its significant association with estradiol levels, where the minor allele was correlated with higher estradiol levels. It had a strong linkage disequilibrium with another significant SNP, which is a missense variant predicted to be deleterious.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The rs6739323-A variant was associated with lower abundance of secreted LTBP1 protein and decreased LTBP1 mRNA expression in human smooth muscle cells (SMCs). This SNP was linked to increased SMC calcification and was prioritized through colocalization analyses as the causal variant affecting LTBP1 expression at the 2p22.3 locus. Additionally, LTBP1 expression was significantly lower in unstable and advanced atherosclerotic lesions.
title: Secreted protein profiling of human aortic smooth muscle cells identifies vascular disease associations

finding: The lead SNP rs7346 was identified as a synonymous variant in INPP5D, which was in tight linkage disequilibrium with rs9247 (missense variant p.His1157Tyr). While rs7346 itself did not demonstrate a clear deleterious prediction, the associated p.His1157Tyr substitution was located within a crucial region affecting the protein's function and may alter binding energy, suggesting a role in negative regulation of FcαR signaling.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The missense variant rs9247 (p.His1157Tyr) in INPP5D was suggested to potentially modify SHIP-1 binding affinity, influencing its role as a negative regulator of FcαR signaling, essential in myeloid cell functions.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: This SNP was one of seven shared between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, contributing to understanding how various thyroid traits interrelate.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This lead variant for hypothyroidism exhibited a higher effect allele frequency in EstBB and FinnGen cohorts, suggesting its significance in specific European populations.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Similar to rs546039326, this SNP showed an increased effect allele frequency in EstBB and FinnGen, highlighting population-specific genetic variations.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Associated with reproductive health traits, this SNP connected thyroid function with the sex hormones in the context of reproductive health.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP displayed associations with reproductive health traits, underscoring the intertwining of thyroid and reproductive health genetics.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: rs34601365, located near APOB and TDRD15, demonstrated a significant interaction with age concerning ApoB levels, with a P-interaction of 8.4e-09. This variant's influence diminished with aging, emphasizing age-dependent genetic effects on ApoB.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs72928925 at the BMPR2/2q33.1 locus was identified as significantly associated with endometriosis and was an original finding. It served as an eQTL for the gene BMPR2 in blood and oesophagus muscularis, which is implicated in pathways related to cell proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis, suggesting a shared genetic basis with conditions like osteoarthritis and multiple sclerosis.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The SNP rs72928605, also located at the BMPR2/2q33.1 locus, was found to be associated with osteoarthritis. It was an original finding and acted as an eQTL for BMPR2, relating to the same enriched TGF-beta signalling pathway implicated in multiple conditions linked to endometriosis.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The SNP rs10196189, located in the gene GALNT13, was associated with sprint ability in a cross-ancestry, genome-wide analysis of elite athletes. This finding was replicated in two independent cohorts of elite European athletes where it reached genome-wide significance (P < 5E-08), providing strong evidence for its role in athletic performance.
title: Multi-phase, multi-ethnic GWAS uncovers putative loci in predisposition to human sprint performance, health and disease

finding: The SNP rs113303758, also in the GALNT13 gene, was reported as having a strong association with elite sprint performance. In meta-analysis, it demonstrated significant combined effects from multiple cohorts with a P-value of 2.75E-07, indicating its importance in genetics related to athletic ability.
title: Multi-phase, multi-ethnic GWAS uncovers putative loci in predisposition to human sprint performance, health and disease

finding: The rs35611688 variant was located near the ACVR2A gene, which encodes a receptor for activin A, implicating it in atherogenesis.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs1260326, mapped to the gene GCKR, was the top variant in the 'Reduced inflammation' cluster, carrying a cluster weight of 5.7. This variant showed a higher frequency in the African population (AFR), suggesting its relevance in reduced inflammation traits within that demographic.
title: A clustering approach to improve our understanding of the genetic and phenotypic complexity of chronic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs60149603 was identified as the strongest signal in the genome-wide association study (GWAS) related to retinal age gap (RAG), with a p-value of 1.4e-95. It was located on chromosome 2 and was associated with processes related to retinal aging.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: The SNP rs4143008, found on chromosome 8, also had a high CADD score indicating potential deleterious effects. It was one of the sentinel SNPs linked to a variety of biological processes involved in retinal aging.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: The analysis indicated that the non-coding SNP rs3792112 was involved in the disruption of autophagy signalling, which was linked to Crohn's disease (CD) pathogenesis. This SNP was shown to propagate towards the gene ATG16L1 as well as two additional autophagy-related proteins, CLTC1 and CLTC, highlighting its role in the pathogenic processes of CD.
title: Decoding Non-coding SNPs: Systems Genomics Modelling Dissects the Heterogeneity of IBD

finding: Similar to rs3792112, the non-coding SNP rs3828309 also contributed to the disruption of autophagy signalling in Crohn's disease. It was implicated in the same pathway, propagating towards ATG16L1 and other associated proteins, thus suggesting a significant role in CD pathogenesis.
title: Decoding Non-coding SNPs: Systems Genomics Modelling Dissects the Heterogeneity of IBD

finding: The variant rs12466997, associated with UGT1 family members A3-A10, showed an association with total bilirubin levels. The trans-ancestry beta was -0.107 with a p-value of 3.54×10^-91, and significant heterogeneity was noted (p=1.5×10^-109). In the African ancestry, the beta was -0.554, indicating a strong effect.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: SNP rs4953016 in DYNC2LI1 was identified as significantly associated with LDL cholesterol levels in a manner consistent with cross-ancestry heterogeneity, reinforcing the critical role of this variant in lipid metabolism.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2382817 was linked to Inflammatory Bowel Disorder. Its initial credible set included 68 variants, which was narrowed down to 5 variants after utilizing the FDR threshold of 0.10, demonstrating the model's capability to refine the list of significant variants associated with this phenotype.
title: TSABL: Trait Specific Annotation Based Locus Predictor

finding: The SNP rs62124869, which mapped to the non-coding RNA gene LINC01830 on chromosome 2, was associated with rare amino acid variation in the EBV BBRF1 gene, indicating potential host-pathogen genomic interactions.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The SNP rs7559150, a causal eQTL for the gene PPIL3, was found to have significant allele frequency differences between European (EUR) and Yoruba (YRI) populations. Specifically, the T allele that increases expression had a much higher frequency in EUR (0.736) compared to YRI (0.259), correlating with higher expression levels of PPIL3 in EUR. This finding illustrated the strong impact of allele frequency differences on differential gene expression across populations.
title: Allele frequency differences of causal variants have a major impact on low cross-ancestry portability of PRS

finding: The SNP rs7571971 exhibited an odds ratio of 0.80 (95%CI=0.68–0.95; p=9.06·10^-03), supporting its role in PSP susceptibility in line with previous studies.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs62164740 located at chromosome 2p12 was identified as a novel association with a p-value of 6.27E-07 for orofacial clefts (OFCs) in a large ethnic cohort. It displayed the strongest association in the combined sample.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Non-syndromic Orofacial Clefts in a Multiethnic Sample of Families and Controls Identifies Novel Regions

finding: The rs419598 CC genotype was associated with lower inflammatory biomarker levels and reduced mortality in men hospitalized with SARS-CoV-2. Specifically, male carriers of this genotype exhibited a significant decrease in cytokines such as IL-1 beta, IL-2, and IL-6, leading to a mortality rate of 5.5% compared to 18.4% for CT/TT carriers in the age group of 55-74. This finding indicated that the IL1RN rs419598 polymorphism may play a role in modulating the severity of acute SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Interleukin-1 receptor antagonist gene (IL1RN) variants modulate the cytokine release syndrome and mortality of SARS-CoV-2

finding: This SNP was the top SNP in the case-control ncAD GWAS (p-value=7.94×10⁻⁹, Z=-5.77) and was also significant in the Braak stage GWAS, illustrating its association with AD neuropathology on chromosome 2q14 near the BIN1 gene.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: This SNP was the top SNP in the Braak stage GWAS, presenting a significant association (p-value=3×10⁻⁸, Z=5.54), further underscoring the role of the locus on chromosome 2 near BIN1 in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: This SNP was significant in the female-specific Braak stage GWAS, showing a strong association (top SNP; p-value=8.5×10⁻⁸, Z=-6.08), emphasizing its role in AD pathology among women.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: The SNP rs6436688 was identified in the COL4A3 gene region, associated with severe DKD. It maintained a nominal significance level of p=1.8×10^-7, indicating a potential role in the pathogenesis of kidney disease.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis and omics integration identifies novel genes associated with diabetic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs55703767 was also found to be associated with severe DKD, highlighted by its association with the COL4A3 gene region. Its significance was better understood in conjunction with other associations within the gene.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis and omics integration identifies novel genes associated with diabetic kidney disease

finding: The alternate allele of the missense variant rs6755571 in the UGT1A4 gene was associated with a five-fold reduction in the risk of neonatal jaundice (OR = 0.2, p-value = 2.7 × 10-55, frequency = 6.4%). This finding suggested a significant protective effect against jaundice.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The intronic variant rs17868338 was identified as a lead variant in the UGT1A gene region, showing high linkage disequilibrium with rs6755571. Its association with neonatal jaundice was replicated in a meta-analysis, indicating its relevance to the condition.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The lead SNP rs17868336 in the UGT1A gene region was associated with maternal genome effects on neonatal jaundice, in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs6755571, highlighting the parental contributions to the jaundice risk.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: In the paternal genome analysis, rs149247216 was the lead SNP in the UGT1A gene region, showing strong LD with neonatal missense variant rs6755571, implicating it in jaundice risk via paternal alleles.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: Identified in the ACVR1C gene, the SNP rs56188432 was associated with WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub> in a genome-wide context, adding evidence of its role in fat distribution regulation.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: SNP rs2176040 demonstrated a causal effect estimate from the analysis concerning the relationship between BMI and glucose levels, yielding a causal effect estimate of 0.025 (se: 0.0139, p-value: 0.003). This result suggested a potentially significant role of this SNP in the relationship but also highlighted its possible status as an invalid instrumental variable, as indicated by conflicting results obtained from the standard two-stage least squares method, which indicated a biased result.
title: On Mendelian Randomization Mixed-Scale Treatment Effect Robust Identification (MR MiSTERI) and Estimation for Causal Inference

finding: The SNP rs6544040, located in an intronic region of VIT, was significantly associated with hypothalamus volume. Females showed a stronger association (β = 0.07) compared to males (β = 0.002), indicating a significant sex difference with a P-value of 1.31 × 10⁻⁵.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: This SNP was associated with susceptibility to chickenpox infections, being significantly linked at a genome-wide level (p = 3 x 10^-7). This association suggested the role of non-coding variants in the intron of C2orf69 in immune response.
title: Loss of C2orf69 defines a fatal auto-inflammatory mitochondriopathy in Humans and Zebrafish

finding: This SNP demonstrated a strong association with schizophrenia, having genome-wide significance (p = 2 x 10^-13). It highlighted the involvement of C2orf69 in neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Loss of C2orf69 defines a fatal auto-inflammatory mitochondriopathy in Humans and Zebrafish

finding: This SNP was previously reported by the Coffee and Caffeine Genetics Consortium (CCGC) as associated with coffee consumption, indicating its established link to habitual consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: Reported by CCGC, this SNP (LOC105373352-TMEM18) is associated with coffee consumption habits, suggesting its role in metabolic processes.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: Found in the APOB gene, this SNP was reported as the main driver of the association between fatty acid levels and postprandial glucose in South Asians, losing significance when removed from analyses.
title: Metabolic Drivers of Dysglycemia in Pregnancy: Ethnic-Specific GWAS of 146 Metabolites and 1-Sample Mendelian Randomisation Analyses in a UK Multi-Ethnic Birth Cohort

finding: The UGT1A4 rs3732218 genetic variant was linked to the glucuronidation of Anastrozole, which affected its elimination from the body. This finding indicated that variability in this SNP could influence both the efficacy of Anastrozole and the incidence of side effects in breast cancer patients, highlighting the importance of genetic testing for optimizing personalized treatment plans.
title: Pharmacogenomics in Tailoring First-Line Therapy for Breast Cancer: PharmGKB Database Insights

finding: The SNP rs2861694 located within the ETAA1 locus was positively associated with both endometriosis and GPM (gastro-oesophageal reflux disease and peptic ulcer disease) phenotypes. This association was underscored by its inclusion in a cross-trait meta-analysis that identified significant genetic loci related to these conditions.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: SNP rs560887 at the G6PC2 locus showed a highly significant association in the two degree of freedom analyses (p-value = 4.37 × 10−20), but had relatively modest p-values in maternal and fetal meta-analyses that did not reach significance. This SNP, associated with fasting glucose levels, displayed marked differences in statistical significance depending on the analytical method used.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs6742078 showed associations with disorders of porphyrin and bilirubin metabolism, associating with uridine 5’-diphospho-glucuronosyltransferases. The findings indicated novel recessive mechanisms affecting bilirubin clearance, expanding knowledge on UGT1A6's role beyond previously reported effects of UGT1A1.
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: The SNP rs17710829, located at locus 2q14.1, was part of a significant interaction with the intronic LINGO2 variant rs9298897. This interaction was uncovered in the context of Parkinson's Disease progression, indicating the importance of this genetic variant in understanding the complexity of PD.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs77559646 was identified as a causal variant of prostate cancer, disrupting ANO7 mRNA splicing and protein expression. This finding is significant as it relates directly to the pathophysiological mechanisms underlying the disease.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The rs11125830 variant was significantly associated with recurrent miscarriage (P=1.2e-08) and was located near the BCL11A gene, crucial for brain development, suggesting its implication in miscarriage through developmental pathways.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The study found that the T allele of rs5742909 was more prevalent among rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and osteoarthritis (OA) patients compared to controls, suggesting a significant association with disease onset.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The G allele at rs231775 was found to be more prevalent among patients, leading to a mutation that changed threonine to alanine. This polymorphism was significantly associated with the onset of both RA and OA.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The study demonstrated that allele G was more common in patients compared to controls, indicating a significant association of the rs4553808 polymorphism with the onset of RA and OA.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: At the rs733618 polymorphic site, the C allele was replaced by T allele, which was more prevalent among patients. This variant showed a significant risk for RA development.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The rs3087243 polymorphism showed a higher prevalence of allele G among patients compared to controls, contributing to the significant risk factor in the onset of RA and OA.
title: Genetic Susceptibility Of Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte-Associated Antigen 4 Gene Polymorphism In The Onset Of Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs6431690 was identified as having significant association with recurrent major depression (MD) as part of the study's findings. It was noted that this locus on chromosome 2 demonstrated statistical significance even after applying a stringent Bonferroni correction, indicating its robust association with this specific subtype of MD.
title: Genetic heterogeneity and subtypes of major depression

finding: The SNP rs6734238 was associated with elevated circulating IL-6 levels and identified as causal specifically in relationships with AAA, LDL-C, total cholesterol, and triglycerides.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs1260326 in the gene GCKR was documented as a genetic variant significant for liver disease risk, positioning it within the metabolic interactions governed by glucagon.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: This locus associated with chronic dry cough met the Bonferroni threshold and was linked to SRBD1, indicating a significant genetic connection in chronic cough pathways.
title: Genomics of chronic cough unravels neurological pathways

finding: The SNP, rs184204326, located on the gene FBXO11, was associated with suicidal behaviors (SB) with a p-value of 1.48E-07, particularly driven by SB. This variant was notable as the only common variant significantly linked to both Alcohol Use Disorders (AUD) and SB, showing significant expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) associations in multiple brain tissues.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: The rs1990760 TT variant of the IFIH1 gene was associated with an age-dependent protection against the surge in MDA5 autoimmunity during the COVID-19 pandemic. The study showed that patients with the TT genotype displayed lower levels of IFIH1 induction and a blunted type 1 interferon response; this was relevant as higher IFIH1 induction correlated with poor outcomes in MDA5+ dermatomyositis (DM). The TT variant also contributed to better survival rates among patients, particularly affecting those who lacked this variant, where factors like younger age or absence of severe disease increased IFIH1 levels.
title: MDA5-autoimmunity and Interstitial Pneumonitis Contemporaneous with the COVID-19 Pandemic (MIP-C)

finding: The SNP rs62154092 was identified as the most significant variant associated with coronary artery aneurysms (CAA), with a p-value of 6.32E-08. It was located in an intergenic region closest to the ACTR3BP2 gene.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The variant rs893344 showed nominal evidence of association with PIK3CA mutations in the B-CAUSE study, specifically for activating mutations.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The rs535484207 variant in the RANBP2 gene was highly associated with lymphoid neoplasms and also showed high odds (256.01) for individuals carrying it who also had a prostate cancer diagnosis.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: Located in an intronic region of <ICA1L> at 2q33.2, this variant (p = 4.6e-10) was shown to affect gene expression and splicing across various tissues. The gene <CARF>, notably associated with stress-induced and oncogenic senescence, gained attention as a putative mechanism for variant effects on brain aging.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs3931848 was identified as part of a multivariate GWAS concerning a non-SU externalizing factor, suggesting that it contributed to genetic variance in externalizing traits relevant to polysubstance use (PSU). Connected genes included CAMKMT.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The SNP rs11682175 was also identified within the multivariate GWAS framework for the non-SU externalizing factor, contributing to genetic liability for polysubstance use (PSU). This SNP was associated with the gene VRK2.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: SNP rs7560837 was included in the genetic risk loci for the non-SU externalizing factor, indicating its role in the architecture of genetic risk related to PSU. This SNP mapped to the gene ADH1B.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The common non-coding variant rs1484116 in the TTN gene was associated with reduced cardiac function and worse long-term mortality in heart failure (HF) patients. Its effect size was significantly higher in Japanese populations compared to Europeans, and it stratified individuals who developed HF into those with a high mortality rate.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs72824565, which mapped to the CTNNA2 gene, was associated with a 3-week shorter gestational duration. This result was consistent with other variants nearby in CTNNA2 that showed similar associations, suggesting that this gene may influence lower GA through effects on fetal neurodevelopment.
title: Genetic association study of Preterm birth and Gestational age in a population-based case-control study in Peru

finding: The SNP rs13000026 was identified as a novel risk locus located at locus 2q24.3, lying intronic to the gene COBLL1. It demonstrated strong associations (P-value ≤ 3.2×10⁻⁴) with endometriosis risk and high-grade serous ovarian cancer risk, achieving genome-wide significance in a combined analysis (P-value < 5×10⁻⁸). A high probability (≥ 0.76) of a single causal signal linking this variant with both diseases was also indicated.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: This regulatory coding SNP in IFIH1 was defined as associated with lupus susceptibility, functioning as a trans-eQTL targeting several immune response genes.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: In the two-sample Mendelian randomization, rs6756297 was associated with lower fasting glucose levels with an inverse-variance weighted coefficient of -2.04, indicating that this SNP represented a beneficial effect of zinc supplementation on glycemic control in type-2 diabetes patients.
title: Triangulating evidence for the causal impact of single-dose zinc supplement on glycemic control for type-2 diabetes

finding: Identified in the GWAS by Song et al. (2021) and ILAE (2018), this lead SNP was associated with epilepsy and appeared in more than one study, likely due to sample overlap.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The SNP rs1250258, located within the FN1 gene region, was replicated for HF risk with a nominal P-value of 4.08×10^-2.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: SNP rs4245791 was linked to the ABCG8 gene, exhibiting robust association with HF in multi-trait analysis.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The rs147001633 SNP in DNMT3A showed a p-value of 3.7 × 10^-5, indicating its involvement in longevity and reduced lifespan.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The rs377023736 SNP located in SF3B1 was significantly associated with reduced lifespan, with a notable p-value of 8.5 × 10^-8.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: Rs58857776 was also associated with long non-coding RNAs and had a replication p-value of 0.003. It was previously associated with BMI, as well as insomnia and naps, indicating a potential link between this SNP and sleep-related phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study of obstructive sleep apnea in the Million Veteran Program uncovers genetic heterogeneity by sex

finding: The SNP rs3087243, located in the CTLA4 gene, displayed a moderate protective effect against thyroid disorders with a case RAF of 0.8125 and control RAF of 0.8333, resulting in an OR of 0.867. Furthermore, it had a moderate negative correlation of -0.43 with TSH levels, suggesting its potential preventative role against hypothyroidism while being implicated in autoimmune thyroid diseases.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The SNP rs231779, also in the CTLA4 gene, was associated with an increased risk for thyroid disorders, evidenced by a higher RAF in cases (0.78125) compared to controls (0.6944) and an OR of 1.571. This finding indicates that carriers of the 'T' allele face an increased risk of developing Graves' disease and hypothyroidism.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The SNP rs6705977, associated with the NAT8 gene, was positively found to correlate with fifteen N-acetylated molecules, indicating its significance in metabolite genetic associations.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs192756070, a missense variant in SLC23A3, demonstrated a very high frequency in the METSIM cohort and was linked to 19 different metabolites, implicating it as a potential causal variant due to its significant association.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs77684493, closely associated with pyroglutamylglutamine levels, was found in perfect linkage disequilibrium with the missense variant rs2255991, further supporting its critical role in this metabolic pathway.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The rs6544713 variant in ABCG8 was found to be associated with lower campesterol levels and higher gallstone risk, indicating a potential causal link.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs77225800 in AOX1 was correlated with 7-methylguanine levels, showing its potential role in purine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs116654420 linked to HADHA/HADHB was associated with 3-hydroxylaurate, implicating its role in fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs199546957 associated with KYNU was positively correlated with xanthurenate, suggesting its role in tryptophan metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs7603766 in ST3GAL5 was positively found to associate with lactosyl-N-behenoyl-sphingosine, indicating its role in glycosphingolipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs887829 (c.-364C>T; UGT1A1*80) was previously associated with indirect hyperbilirubinemia, commonly linked to Gilbert syndrome. This polymorphism related to UGT1A1 metabolism was significant in the study, with poor metabolizers (carriers of two decreased function alleles) at a higher risk of developing jaundice, which could lead to medication non-adherence. The findings emphasized the need for personalized dosage guidelines based on UGT1A1 genotyping when administering atazanavir.
title: Exploration of interethnic variation and repurposed drug efficacy in the treatment of SARS-CoV-2 Infection (COVID-19)

finding: The intronic variant rs76952347 in the LYPD6 gene exhibited a strong association with functional chest pain, underlining its significance in the genetic landscape of this disorder.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The lead SNP rs117888248 was identified within a DPP4-DT gene haplotype on chromosome 2, and the presence of this Neanderthal-related haplotype in heterozygous form was reported to double the occurrence of severe COVID-19, while homozygous presence quadrupled the risk.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: Similar to rs117888248, the SNP rs118098838 from the haplotype within the DPP4-DT gene was also associated with increased severity of COVID-19, with findings indicating a significant doubling of severe cases in heterozygous carriers and a quadrupling in homozygous carriers.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The rs11125529 SNP, associated with the ACYP2 gene, was linked to an increased risk of developing coronary heart disease. In the context of the study, it was part of findings suggesting a causal relationship between shorter telomere length (TL) and various cardiac measurements.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs116763937 SNP at 2p13.3 was significantly associated with endometriosis, showing a p-value of 4.07E-08. This locus had previously been recognized in the AFR meta-analysis, highlighting its relevance across different population studies.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs115117372 in KCNF1 was identified with a significant association to endometriosis, yielding a p-value of 1.97E-08. This SNP was also noted in the EUR meta-analysis, indicating its continued importance in endometriosis research.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: rs144109344 was significantly associated with neutrophil count, evidenced by a Beta coefficient of -0.12 and P-value of 3.10e-10, mirroring results from other studies demonstrating its effect in African populations.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1260326 near GCKR was significantly associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, while also displaying connections to lipid metabolism pathways impacting cardiovascular health.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: This SNP was identified as associated with thyroid function, linked to thyroid adenoma, indicating its relevance in TSH levels.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: Associated with cancer traits, this SNP adds to the understanding of the genetic components influencing these conditions.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs3820897 was associated with lower levels of the anti-inflammatory protein ALPL, the T allele previously linked to higher inflammatory protein levels.
title: Genome and epigenome wide studies of plasma protein biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease implicate TBCA and TREM2 in disease risk

finding: For the rs3821236 SNP at the STAT4 locus, significant interactions were revealed exclusively in CD4+ T cells, correlating with a TAD specific for this cell type. There was a notable increase in STAT4 expression within CD4+ T cells compared to CD14+ monocytes (log2FC = 7.05, FDR = 1 × 10^-304).
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs6741951 was initially associated with daytime-sleepiness, showing a significant adverse effect on adult-BMI after removing an outlier in the analysis (beta=0.48 SD, 95% CI=0.13, 0.82). It also indicated increased effects on hip circumference (HC) (beta=0.55 SD, 95% CI=0.12, 0.97) and waist circumference (WC) (beta=0.51 SD, 95% CI=0.14, 0.88). These results highlighted the potential bidirectional relationship between daytime-sleepiness and adiposity traits such as adult-BMI, WC, and HC.
title: Establishing causal relationships between sleep and adiposity traits using Mendelian randomisation

finding: The SNP rs113017476 was linked to a negative effect on schizophrenia, with an odds ratio (OR) in the inverse variance weighted (IVW) Wald analysis of 0.60 (95% CIs=0.88 to 0.41, p=0.010). This SNP is mapped to the SRD5A2 gene, which plays a role in processing androgens.
title: The role of sex hormones in severe mental illness: a genetic exploration

finding: The SNP rs17020490 at the PRKD3 locus was independently replicated and confirmed to contribute to AD susceptibility in the Latin population.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The rs4663105 SNP in BIN1 was significantly associated with AD, showing a genome-wide significant p-value (p=3.2x10^-9) in pooled samples analysis and adjusting for APOE haplotypes did not alter the association.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The SNP rs780093 in the GCKR locus was found to be associated with hs-CRP levels, yielding a notable P-value of 1.85e-13. This indicated a connection between GCKR genetic variation and inflammation as measured by hs-CRP.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The rs797045038 variant in the DCAF17 gene was identified as a founder variant in the Qatari population, being the sole pathogenic variant causing Woodhouse-Sakati syndrome (WSS) found in the population at a MAF of 0.007. It was linked to decreased insulin levels and a high carrier frequency of approximately 2.5% in Qatar, which is the highest reported globally.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: An inverse association was found between higher genetically-predicted expression of CXCR4 and the risk of CHD (P=9.52×10^-7), indicating that the CHD-increasing allele was associated with higher neutrophil and lower lymphocyte percentages.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: SNP rs73919910 was the lead SNP at a novel locus near RP11-182I10, also found in the Latin American and African cohorts, and exhibited a higher frequency in these populations compared to Europeans. It was associated with a protective effect against PD indicated by a beta of -0.54.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10199082 was found to be the strongest association with accelerated abdominal aging, which is a phenotype related to the heritable aspect of aging as defined by a heritability estimate of 26.3% +/- 1.9%. This SNP is located in the PNPT1 gene, which is involved in mitochondrial RNA metabolic function and has been associated with diseases such as mitochondrial disorders, hearing loss, and Leigh syndrome. The association with pulse pressure further highlights its relevance in health outcomes.
title: Using deep learning to predict age from liver and pancreas magnetic resonance images allows the identification of genetic and non-genetic factors associated with abdominal aging

finding: The SNP rs1597916, an intronic variant within the CPO gene, was significantly associated with GDM risk, demonstrating an odds ratio (OR) of 1.65 and a p-value of 1.98×10^-8.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: The variant rs698805, intronic to CAMKMT, was identified in the male l-MSSS analysis with a beta of -1.5395 (p=4.35×10^-8), being one of the significant associations with severity.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The rs744373 SNP in the BIN1 gene was originally found to be associated with increased tau-PET levels and impaired memory function, indicating its role in Alzheimer's disease pathology. Further studies confirmed that this SNP was linked to faster Aβ-associated tau accumulation and cognitive decline, suggesting significant involvement in the progression of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Towards cascading genetic risk in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This intronic variant in COBLL1 showed significant association with GFATadjBMI (P = 3.0 x 10^-23) but not with VAT or ASAT adjustments.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: Another variant in COBLL1 significantly associated with GFATadjBMI (P = 1.5 x 10^-12), underscoring its relevance to fat distribution.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This variant also in COBLL1 showed significant association with GFATadjBMI (P = 2.8 x 10^-9).
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This missense variant in ACVR1C significantly reduced the VAT/GFAT ratio (beta = -0.18; P = 1.9 x 10^-8), linking sequence variation to reduced diabetes risk.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: Another missense variant in ACVR1C was nominally associated with a reduced VAT/GFAT ratio.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with GFATadjBMI (Z-score = 9.1; P = 6.2 x 10^-20), underscoring the impact of IRS1 expression on fat depot expansion and insulin response.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The study identified rs13396472 as part of a locus linked to the gene <italic>BCL2L11</italic>. This SNP displayed a strong allelic imbalance (FDR 1.86E-96) with an associated 40% reduction in chromatin accessibility linked to the protective (ALT) allele. It was shown to be a strong caQTL for overlapping ATAC-seq peaks.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: Finally, the SNP rs13401811 displayed a significant reduction in chromatin accessibility associated with protective allele correlations, influencing the activity of <italic>BCL2L11</italic> through chromatin looping dynamics critical for autoimmune responses.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs1260326 in GCKR was associated with several PUFA traits and identified as a significant locus in previous PUFA GWAS analyses.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The rs359268 SNP at 2p16.1 was linked to the mode of anisotropy (MO) of the cingulum, indicating genetic overlaps with hypersomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Located at 2q14.1, the variant rs62158170 was a significant brain eQTL, influencing the somatomotor network in relation to resting fMRI traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs12713372 variant found in the 2p16.1 region showed significant overlaps with the frontoparietal and posterior-multimodal networks in resting fMRI.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs17396357 located at 2p16.3 influenced several networks, emphasizing its role as an eQTL in relation to sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Identified in the right cerebellar vermis, rs55772859 genetic overlaps were associated with various aspects of sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Found at 2p11.2, rs11681299 exhibited relevant genetic correlations with brain segments influencing sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs3834129, associated with the CASP8 gene, was linked to colorectal cancer susceptibility. It was indicated in the context of a broader study and meta-analysis, showing relevance to the predisposition of patients suffering from colorectal cancer.
title: Prevalence of cancer susceptibility variants in patients with multiple Lynch syndrome related cancers

finding: The SNP rs1260326 in the GCKR gene presented a genome-wide significant association (p=4.53×10−08) and was notable for its prior associations with alcohol-related traits, including alkaloid consumption patterns.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs6752675 located on chromosome 2 nearest to AC092568.1 had a genome-wide significant association (p=2.57×10−08) in the cross-ancestry analysis, contributing to the body of knowledge concerning genetic loci involved in MaxAlc.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs1260326, which is located in GCKR, was identified as a significant risk variant for problematic alcohol use (PAU) in the cross-ancestry meta-analysis. It was noted to be part of the 110 unique variants associated with PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs472140 was associated with ADH1B and identified as a significant variant for PAU in the analyses conducted, contributing to the pool of 110 genetic variants.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The rs13026575 SNP was identified in a female-specific analysis as having shared colocalization evidence with hearing difficulty (HD) and the brain imaging-derived phenotype of left primary visual cortex volume (IDP 0419). It was also associated with the transcriptomic regulation of the gene SPTBN1, which encodes beta-II spectrin and plays a role in neural development and function. The presence of this variant suggested potential mechanisms linking brain structure and a predisposition to HD.
title: Sex differences in the pleiotropy of hearing difficulty with imaging-derived phenotypes: a brain-wide investigation

finding: The rs2232326 variant at the G6PC2 locus demonstrated significant experimental evidence, indicating deleterious effects linked to gluconeogenesis. It associated strongly with RG measurements, highlighting its importance in glycaemic control.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: The SNP rs138726309 was one of three rare coding variants at G6PC2 identified as having predicted deleterious effects and was associated with RG measurements, which linked genetic variation to glucose metabolism.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: The SNP rs2232323 was also identified at the G6PC2 locus, characterized by its predicted deleterious effect and significant association with RG, reflecting its role in glycaemic traits.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: The SNP rs11556165 in ATRAID was significantly associated with the combined response to multiple drugs, suggesting it plays a role in drug efficacy in AML treatment.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: This intergenic SNP acted as a cis-eQTL for SANBR, a known negative regulator of class switch recombination, relevant to antibody production.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The SNP rs1469513 was positively associated with obesity, and the strength of this association was influenced by dietary fat intake among Koreans. This finding indicates that the genetic variant's impact on obesity could vary depending on nutritional factors, suggesting a complex interaction between genetics and diet in obesity susceptibility.
title: Weight loss in patients with COVID-19 and Influenza in comorbidity with NCDs: a pilot prospective clinical trial

finding: The rs6760240 variant, mapped to the ZSWIM2 gene, was associated with triglycerides (TG) under short total sleep time (STST), indicating its possible role in lipid alteration due to sleep variability.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: Identified in the ZNF804A gene, the rs190975828 variant showed association with LDL-c under long total sleep time (LTST), suggesting its involvement in lipid metabolism in relation to sleep behavior.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances
