finding: The rs34771893 variant, found in the SLC8A1 gene, was associated with TG levels modified by short total sleep time (STST), underscoring its relevance in lipid metabolism affected by sleep health.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The common missense variant in the glucokinase regulatory protein (GCKR) gene, identified as rs1260326 (GCKR:p.Leu446Pro), was significantly associated with 51 out of 56 selected metabolites, indicating its strong pleiotropic effects across multiple metabolic traits.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: This SNP was identified as a shared genetic signal across multiple fatty acid traits, indicating its involvement in the genetics of PUFA metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was associated with novel loci relevant to fatty acid traits, marking it as a potential causal variant.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was identified as part of the multi-ancestry GWAS analysis, marking it as novel and replicating in two or more populations within the study.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This novel SNP was linked to the gene INPP5D, implicated in hay fever and other epithelial barrier disorders like inflammatory bowel disease.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP, located intergenically between NEU4 and PDCD1, exhibited associations in European, Latino, and Japanese populations relevant to the study.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was identified as having significant effects on multiple immune-related genes and exhibited strong eQTL effects, underscoring its importance in immune cell regulation.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The SNP rs7587026 was located in the SCN1A gene, which encodes a voltage-gated sodium channel. This SNP was specifically associated with mesial temporal lobe epilepsy with hippocampal sclerosis (MTLEHS) and febrile seizures, highlighting the gene's role in the genetic complexity underlying various forms of epilepsy.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The c.2133G>C (p.Leu711Phe) variant in the SCN9A gene was found to be present in 3% of the tested pediatric patients diagnosed with epilepsy. This variant was predicted to be probably damaging according to PolyPhen-2, suggesting that it potentially altered the function of the sodium channel Nav.17, which could lead to signal disruptions associated with epilepsy.
title: Previously defined variants of uncertain significance may play an important role in epilepsy and interactions between certain variants may become pathogenic

finding: The D19H variant of ABCG8 (rs11887534) demonstrated a highly significant result (P < 4.94 x 10^-324) and was identified as the lead SNP by other GWAS studies. It included ten variants with independent and significant association with gallstones within ABCG8, ABCG5, and DYNC2LI1.
title: Genome-wide Analysis Identifies Novel Gallstone-susceptibility Loci Including Genes Regulating Gastrointestinal Motility

finding: The SNP rs4274624, located at locus 2q32.2 in the STAT4 gene, demonstrated a highly significant association with Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in both European (EU) and Chinese (Chi) populations, with a P-value of 9.7×10^-66.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: The rs12992672 variant had associations with heart failure risk factors such as BMI, HDL-C, type-2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), AF, and smoking, indicating its significant role in heart failure.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The rs3820888 variant was associated with six left ventricular (LV) cardiac-MRI traits as well as AF, all showing directionally concordant results with the heart failure findings.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs1375493 was identified as an eQTL for the inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)-associated ITGA4 locus. This finding demonstrated a strong regulatory signal and recapitulated the monocyte-specificity of the eQTL. It was found using the SAIGE-QTL method, which effectively mapped eQTLs in single-cell RNA sequencing contexts.
title: Efficient and accurate mixed model association tool for single-cell eQTL analysis

finding: The study discussed the effects of IFIH1 rs1990760 variants on systemic inflammation and outcomes in critically ill COVID-19 patients. It was identified that these genetic variants influence the host's inflammatory response to SARS-CoV-2 infection, ultimately correlating with the severity of disease and patient outcomes. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic factors in understanding individual variations in disease response and potential therapeutic interventions in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Transcriptomic clustering of critically ill COVID-19 patients

finding: The variant rs887829, located in the core promoter region of the UGT1A1 gene, was associated with a significant influence on bilirubin levels as shown in previous GWAS studies involving multiple populations, highlighting its role in serum total bilirubin variance.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: chr2:233755940:ATC:A was significantly associated with phecode 573.5 "Jaundice (not of newborn)" in HL, indicating its role in bilirubin levels, and thus highlighting the variant's importance within the UGT1A gene locus.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: SNP rs1123573 at 2p16.1 was significantly associated with endometrial cancer (EC) and COVID-19 hospitalization phenotypes, with a P-value of 3.29×10−85.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The variant rs13003835, located within the BAZ2B gene, was associated with an increased risk of COVID-19 hospitalization (Odds Ratio [OR]=1.20, 95% Confidence Interval [CI]=1.12-1.27, p=3.66×10^-8). This was the first time this association was reported in a GWAS for COVID-19.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs554982961 was associated with ACP1, a gene previously shown to play a role in cardiac hypertrophy and fibrosis, marking its relevance in myocardial interstitial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs7574806, situated downstream of the SERTAD2 gene on chromosome 2, was found to be significantly associated with problems in AUBs, indicated by a P-value of 4.49 × 10^-53. This finding was part of the heterogeneity analyses that identified specific SNP effects related to the 'Problems' phenotype.
title: Genetic Heterogeneity Across Dimensions of Alcohol Use Behaviors

finding: The rs1374749 locus, associated with <italic>EPAS1</italic>, was confirmed as a risk factor for HAPC, particularly indicating lower hemoglobin levels in Tibetans (P = 5.14E-9, OR = 1.85).
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs1123573 was located at locus 2p16.1 within the BCL11A gene and successfully replicated as an associated marker for IPF (specific replication details not provided in the text). BCL11A's role included regulation of lymphocyte development, hinting at shared pathways with immune response in IPF.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs72842919 was identified through endophenotype T2:14 and previously found associated with late-onset Alzheimer’s disease. The locus was significantly linked to traits such as cortical thickness and white matter microstructure, marking it as a notable finding in relation to brain measurement and neurodegenerative conditions.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs12470661 was replicated with significance in the context of 19 variants at 18 novel loci during the pleiotropy analysis of blood pressure (BP) variants between UKB-ICBP and MVP, suggesting a strong involvement in BP traits.
title: Genome-wide pleiotropy analysis identifies novel blood pressure variants and improves its polygenic risk scores

finding: The SNP rs17713879 was identified as an eQTL affecting the expression of the SH3YL1 and ACP1 genes in 34 tissues and also functioned as a sQTL, influencing the splicing of these genes in 50 tissues, highlighting its significance in BP regulation.
title: Genome-wide pleiotropy analysis identifies novel blood pressure variants and improves its polygenic risk scores

finding: SNP rs12478520 was documented as an eQTL affecting multiple genes, such as C2orf72, HTR2B, ARMC9, and PSMD1, emphasizing its relevance in the context of blood pressure and associated gene regulation.
title: Genome-wide pleiotropy analysis identifies novel blood pressure variants and improves its polygenic risk scores

finding: The rs10931513 was identified as a genome-wide significant variant for HDL in the upstream category, thus representing a positive original finding relating to its potential impact on HDL levels.
title: Multi-omics Integration Identifies Genes Influencing Traits Associated with Cardiovascular Risks: The Long Life Family Study

finding: The rs10177406 variant was also identified as genome-wide significant for HDL, supporting its role as a positive original finding concerning HDL traits.
title: Multi-omics Integration Identifies Genes Influencing Traits Associated with Cardiovascular Risks: The Long Life Family Study

finding: The SNP rs78426839 tagged multiple genes including TUBA4B and PTPRN, and it appeared to be associated with hoarding symptoms. This SNP showed suggestive evidence of association with educational attainment and was referenced in the context of other psychiatric traits.
title: Meta-Analysis of Genome-Wide Association Studies of Hoarding Symptoms in 27 537 Individuals

finding: The SNP rs7567224 was linked to the gene CNTNAP5 and indicated suggestive associations with hoarding symptoms. It contributed to the understanding of genetic factors linked to psychiatric conditions.
title: Meta-Analysis of Genome-Wide Association Studies of Hoarding Symptoms in 27 537 Individuals

finding: The SNP rs4264571 was identified as part of the genetic variance in the <italic>MERTK</italic> locus linked to Alzheimer’s disease specifically in females, but not in males. This finding was based on LocusZoom plots generated from genome-wide association study (GWAS) data that showed strong linkage disequilibrium (r2 > 0.8) in females. Additionally, tissue-specific gene-level associations indicated significant correlations of <italic>MERTK</italic> with Alzheimer’s disease in female brain sub-tissues, highlighting the genetic risk factors that exhibit sex-specific patterns in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Single-cell transcriptomic atlas of Alzheimer’s disease middle temporal gyrus reveals region, cell type and sex specificity of gene expression with novel genetic risk for MERTK in female

finding: With high frequency in the Indian population, rs55790676 was correlated with decreased expression of ADAM17, suggesting an increased susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs1524668 variant, associated with diminished ADAM17 expression, was noted for high allele frequency in Indians, indicating a potential role in COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs1990760 variant in IFIH1 was found to link with autoimmune protection against viral infection, with T allele frequency showing potential protective implications for COVID-19 in Indians.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The intronic variant rs2270360 in IGFBP2 was identified with increased severity in COVID-19, exhibiting high risk allele frequencies within the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The variant rs71040457 located near DES/SPEG genes was noted for its association with increased COVID-19 mortality risk, with distinct frequency characteristics among populations.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs113892140 polymorphism was associated with increased mortality risk in COVID-19 and displayed a high frequency in the Indian population relative to Europeans.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: SNP REL rs842634 was associated with increased IL-12 production in dendritic cells after LPS and TBWCL stimulations, indicating its role in enhancing the immune response.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: Although not directly associated with increased IL-12 production, SNP REL rs842618 was linked in linkage disequilibrium with rs842634 and was associated with increased risk for TB meningitis among Vietnamese individuals.
title: CNBP, REL, and BHLHE40 variants are associated with IL-12 and IL-10 responses and tuberculosis risk

finding: The analysis indicated that the SNP rs11887534 appeared to disrupt the association between cholecystectomy and gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). While the MR analysis suggested a significant risk of GERD following cholecystectomy, removing this particular SNP from the analysis resulted in consistent but non-significant outcomes. Therefore, the findings highlighted the potential influence of rs11887534 on the observed association, suggesting that conclusions drawn about the susceptibility to GERD post-cholecystectomy should be approached with caution.
title: Associations of cholecystectomy with the risk of gastroesophageal reflux disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs7601684 was identified upstream of the RAB6C gene and was genome-wide significant, showing a connection to Raynaud's syndrome, further emphasizing vascular regulatory pathways associated with the syndrome.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNP rs7559925 represented an intron variant for the ACVR2A gene and demonstrated associations with immunological traits such as lymphocyte counts, suggesting an interplay between immune responses and Raynaud's syndrome.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The rs62641680 variant was associated with mtDNA-CN and mapped to a synonymous variant in the gene DGUOK, which is responsible for rare mtDNA depletion disorders.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The rs74874677 variant was linked to mtDNA-CN and identified as a non-synonymous variant in the DGUOK gene, contributing to the understanding of mtDNA depletion disorders.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The variant rs1047891 in CPS1 was associated with increased selenium levels and linked to endocrine/metabolic, genitourinary, and digestive biomarkers.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: SNP rs12464825 robustly emerged from the multivariate analysis, despite showing weaker effects distributed across several cerebellar features with sometimes opposite effect directions. Discovery sample p-values were less than 1e-56.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in recent human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs55730955 was identified in the CD28 molecule gene and was associated with pSSNS in the same GWAS, presenting a significant p-value of 4.27 x 10^-10. However, this SNP did not show overlap with any open chromatin regions, indicating its role in pSSNS might be independent of the chromatin state in immune or kidney cells.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was associated with the GCKR gene and identified as one of the shared loci contributing to the pleiotropic relationship between serum urate and estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR).
title: Local genetic covariance between serum urate and kidney function obtained from local Bayesian regressions

finding: The SNP rs17050272 was linked to the LINC01101 gene and recognized as a significant variant contributing to both serum urate levels and eGFR, with implications for understanding their genetic connections.
title: Local genetic covariance between serum urate and kidney function obtained from local Bayesian regressions

finding: The lead SNP at the BCL11A locus, rs6706648, was associated with HbF levels, showing a significant effect with a beta of -0.39 and a P-value of 4.96 x 10^-34.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: SNP rs1427407 was identified as a putative functional variant within the BCL11A locus and is influential on HbF levels, contributing to the effect of the haplotypes defined at this locus.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: SNP rs7565301 was found to tag a haplotype at the BCL11A locus associated with increased HbF levels, demonstrating a significant effect on HbF.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: SNP rs7606173 was highlighted as part of several haplotypes at BCL11A associated with increased HbF levels, contributing to the trait variance.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: SNP rs6738440 was included in the analysis at the BCL11A locus and contributed to defining haplotypes that influence HbF levels.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs12712135 was identified as a strict V2G cis-pQTL for IL1RL1 in a cohort from Kyoto University Nagahama focusing on East Asian ancestry. It was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) including Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC) in the largest East Asian ancestry GWAS that involved 14,393 cases of IBD. Evidence from two-sample Mendelian randomization (MR) and colocalization analyses supported its causal role in IBD, CD, and UC.
title: Multi-ancestry proteome-phenome-wide Mendelian randomization offers a comprehensive protein-disease atlas and potential therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs1420101 served as a strict V2G cis-pQTL for IL1RL1 in African ancestry studies. Its causal effect was estimated for inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and ulcerative colitis (UC) using outcome GWAS data from the Million Veteran Program, involving 1,285 cases of IBD and 857 cases of UC. The analysis utilized the Wald ratio to derive MR effect estimates, reinforcing the link between IL1RL1 and these diseases in the African ancestry.
title: Multi-ancestry proteome-phenome-wide Mendelian randomization offers a comprehensive protein-disease atlas and potential therapeutic targets

finding: The intronic variant rs1662979:G>T in CIB4 was associated with increased risk of hospitalization (OR = 1.05, P = 5.6 × 10^-9), indicating its significant role in the context of COVID-19.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs4591370 was previously reported to be significantly associated with circulating LDL-cholesterol concentrations, with a p-value of 8.2 × 10^-9, indicating its relevance in cholesterol metabolism.
title: Enhancing genotype-phenotype association with optimized machine learning and biological enrichment methods

finding: The SNP rs4665972 had a posterior probability of 0.541 in a Bayesian statistical fine-mapping analysis, indicating its potential role as a causal variant within a significant locus for OPLL.
title: Genetic insights into ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament of the spine

finding: The E627* variant (rs35744605) was found to be protective against psoriasis and hypothyroidism. Despite being a rare variant with an allele frequency of only 0.7%, its association was significant.
title: MDA5 variants trade antiviral activity for protection from autoimmune disease

finding: The I923V variant (rs35667974) was identified as protective for type 1 diabetes (T1D) and associated with increased risk for IBD, psoriasis, and hypothyroidism.
title: MDA5 variants trade antiviral activity for protection from autoimmune disease

finding: The T946A variant (rs1990760) was confirmed as common and protective against T1D, and also shown to have associations with psoriasis and IBD.
title: MDA5 variants trade antiviral activity for protection from autoimmune disease

finding: The SNP rs10174949 was identified in locus 2p25.1, located in the intron of the gene LINC00299. It was associated with atopic dermatitis, impacting asthma, hay fever, and eczema, particularly in European and UK populations.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs1260326 at the GCKR locus was identified as highly pleiotropic, associated with 20 traits, indicating its involvement in multiple disease mechanisms.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs145164937 was identified as an independent genome-wide significant signal associated with beta-sitosterol, with a P-value of 5.54×10^-14. This missense variant led to an amino acid change and had not been previously reported in the GWAS catalog. The C allele was linked to increased beta-sitosterol levels, indicating reduced ABCG5 transporter function.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs4299376 was significantly associated with beta-sitosterol levels in the Qatari population with a P-value of 1.00×10^-12. This variant, previously documented in a large European cohort, was validated in this study, reaffirming its role in influencing beta-sitosterol trait.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs7598542 was identified as an independent signal linked to campesterol levels, showing a genome-wide significant association with a P-value of 4.15×10^-8. It was positioned within the ABCG5/8 locus, contributing to the understanding of sterol metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: The SNP rs4148221 was identified as significant for beta-sitosterol levels and was located within the ABCG8 gene, further corroborating the identified effects of ABCG variants on sterol metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: Identified as associated with beta-sitosterol levels, rs150144845 was also significant after meta-analysis. It highlights additional evidence for the ABCG5 locus's role in sitosterolemia.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study and Meta-Analysis of Phytosterols Identifies a Novel Locus for Serum Levels of Campesterol

finding: pgBoost linked rs1427407 to BCL11A, which is fine-mapped for red blood cell count with a PIP of 0.99. This SNP lies in an experimentally validated intronic enhancer of BCL11A, known for its role in fetal-to-adult hemoglobin switching in erythroid cells. The link also scored in the top 5% of SCENT links but was outside the top 5% predicted by other methods.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: SNP rs4953149 was one of the variants that remained after accounting for heterogeneity within the genome-wide association analysis. It was linked to the common liability to addiction, although specific details about its function were not elaborated.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The rs13025959 variant in the MYO7B gene was associated with reduced improvement in general psychopathological symptoms after antipsychotic treatment in African patients with schizophrenia.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: A frameshift variant rs11368509 in the UPP2 gene was identified to be associated with improved treatment outcomes to antipsychotic medications in patients with first-episode schizophrenia from Xhosa populations in South Africa.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs2304429 variant in DNMT3A gene was linked to an improved antipsychotic treatment response in South African schizophrenia patients when compared to the 'TC' allele.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: This SNP tagged the lncRNAs LINC01865 and LINC01874, contributing to the identification of novel loci associated with low polygenic risk score for type 1 diabetes (T1D).
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Tagging the gene LOC730100, this SNP was among the novel loci identified for low T1D PRS cases.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: This SNP was associated with the genes B3GNT2 and TMEM17, revealing an association with low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: RS77418738 was tagged to FAM136A and TGFA, which were identified as significant loci in the context of low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Tagging GCC2 and EDAR, this SNP was positively associated with low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs9973741 was significantly associated with IL-1β response to monosodium urate crystal stimulation, linking it to inflammation in gout.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: SNP rs7594951 demonstrated a significant association with increased expression of the XDH gene in the prostate, crucial for urate production.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: SNP rs4669524 was employed as a locus SNP to evaluate immune-priming candidate genes in connection with gout.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The SNP rs7570232 demonstrated association with BMI in the GWAS with a notable p-value of 6.6E-09 and a beta value of -0.08, suggesting a negative correlation, thus being a factor in lower BMI.
title: Improved Type 2 Diabetes Risk Stratification in the Qatar Biobank Cohort by Ensemble Learning Classifier Incorporating Multi-Trait, Population-Specific, Polygenic Risk Scores

finding: The SNP rs59330234 was found in an intron of <italic>CCDC85A</italic> and reached a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.02E-8, implicating this gene for the first time in the context of Parkinson's Disease. This locus was identified as a potentially novel PD locus that had not been previously observed in European PD studies, indicating that it may contribute to the genetic risk of PD specifically within South Asian populations.
title: The genetic drivers of juvenile, young, and early-onset Parkinson’s Disease in India

finding: The missense variant rs200560853, located in the ITGA6 gene, was associated with a large effect size for cataract susceptibility in a Puerto Rican population. This variant demonstrated a statistically significant p-value of 2.9×10^-12 and an odds ratio (OR) of 12.7, indicating a strong genetic risk factor for cataracts. Furthermore, it was linked to an average 13.7 years earlier onset of the disease and a 4.3-fold increase in the rate of cataract events in this cohort. The minor allele frequency (MAF) of the variant was reported to be 0.089% within the Puerto Rican population, while being extremely rare in other parts of the world. This finding highlighted the need for including underrepresented populations in genomic research to enhance the understanding of cataract genetics.
title: GWAS of cataract in Puerto Ricans identifies a novel large-effect variant in ITGA6

finding: The rs145201970 variant was significantly associated with prostate cancer (PrCa) risk, with a p-value of 2.57×10^-4 in the combined datasets. This variant is located in the ERCC3 gene, which is essential for DNA repair, and carries a missense mutation (p.R283C) that potentially disrupts protein function.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals new disease risk-associated gene variants

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Association with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD was noted for this SNP.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs143080277 was associated with late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) and was located in the same linkage disequilibrium (LD) block as a 5,505bp deletion at chr2:105731359, which is upstream of NCK2, a gene that is highly expressed in amyloid-responsive microglial cells.
title: A Specialized Reference Panel with Structural Variants Integration for Improving Genotype Imputation in Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias (ADRD)

finding: The SNP rs2715199, located on chromosome 2 at position 87,896,956 (hg38), exhibited sex-specific effects on orofacial cleft risk in a study of 354 Filipino ancestry trios. It demonstrated a significant interaction effect with a p-value of 5.2 x 10^-6, which was the strongest association across different populations. The results indicated that the effect size in Filipino trios was 3.24, while in the European, Central/South American, and Asian trios, the effects were comparatively lower. The overarching analysis across populations yielded an interaction parameter estimate of 1.78 (p = 5.7 x 10^-8), and after genomic-control correction, this SNP achieved genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.1 x 10^-8.
title: Custom Biomedical FAIR Data Analysis in the Cloud Using CAVATICA

finding: SNP rs4338920 was associated with the gene LRP1B on chromosome 2, identified in the analysis as a weak known genetic association with rheumatoid arthritis, derived from data pertaining to non-European populations.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The SNP rs34263553 was associated with the ETAA1 gene, which is involved in DNA damage response. This SNP exhibited a high PPLD score of 0.87 and was demonstrated to physically interact with the promoter of ETAA1, influencing its expression, particularly in T cells.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The study identified the autosomal recessive variant c.636G>C (p.[Gln212His]) in the ARMC9 gene (rs201590882) in an East Asian case. This variant was classified as a variant of uncertain significance (VUS) and had an increased frequency (gnomAD frequency of 0.003 in East Asians), suggesting a potential link to the genetic disorders being investigated.
title: Diagnostic Yield of Exome Sequencing in a Diverse Pediatric and Prenatal Population is not Associated with Genetic Ancestry

finding: The study indicated that SNP rs4251961 in the IL1RN promoter correlated with IL-1 receptor antagonist concentrations during human infections. It was also found to be differentially regulated by the transcription factor GATA-1. This finding was particularly significant as it provided insight into the regulatory mechanisms affecting IL-1Ra levels in the context of immune response.
title: Alterations in secondary structure and binding affinity from mutations in the interleukin-1 receptor antagonist

finding: The SNP rs72958644, located in a region that included the gene ADAM23, showed a significant association with early neurological instability in stroke patients, indicating that the minor allele correlated with a more positive change in the NIHSS, particularly driven by Non-Hispanic White populations.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: SNP rs58763243, located in a region comprising long non-coding RNAs and microRNAs, was significant with negative beta values across all populations, suggesting that the minor allele was associated with lower ΔNIHSS, indicating less deterioration in neurological function.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The locus tagged by rs13403787 was associated with higher ΔNIHSS scores in all cohorts, indicating that the minor allele may predict worse outcomes in early neurological stability following ischemic stroke.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The SNP rs12328675 showed a positive causal association with circulating leptin and was part of a substantial cluster that indicated a positive effect on reproductive disorders, aligning with metabolic traits related to obesity.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: In patient F001, mutations at rs1427407 in the BCL11A gene correlated with elevated levels of Hb F. This elevation in Hb F was significant after 3 months of treatment, despite a later slight decrease and subsequent stabilization. The increase in Hb F was linked to the patient's overall total hemoglobin.
title: Gene therapy using optimized LentiHBBT87Q vector in two patients with transfusion dependent β-thalassemia

finding: Patient F001 also had mutations at rs4671393 in the BCL11A gene. A correlation existed between this SNP and >10% Hb F expression in pediatric patients, contributing to the rise in Hb F levels observed after treatment. This variation did not appear to affect the HbA T87Q expression.
title: Gene therapy using optimized LentiHBBT87Q vector in two patients with transfusion dependent β-thalassemia

finding: Similar to the others, mutations at rs766432 in the BCL11A gene were found in patient F001. These mutations contributed to the observed elevated Hb F levels post-treatment. Like rs1427407 and rs4671393, the impact on HbA T87Q expression was found to be negligible.
title: Gene therapy using optimized LentiHBBT87Q vector in two patients with transfusion dependent β-thalassemia

finding: The SNP rs7607879, located within the ARHGAP15 gene on chromosome 2q22, was identified as significantly associated with colon diverticula in a genome-wide association study (GWAS). This finding indicated a genetic susceptibility locus that might contribute to the risk of diverticular disease and its link to cancer, supporting the hypothesis that ARHGAP15 could play a role in the disease process.
title: Rho GTPase Activating Protein 15 (ARHGAP15) increases cancer risk in patients with diverticular disease

finding: The variant rs12463674, a damaging missense variant (CADD=22.2, NP_001254479.2:p.Ile26225Thr), was identified as part of the top 95% credible set of variants influencing hand grip strength (HGS) within the TTN locus. This finding was derived from an assessment of both rare and common variants impacting muscle strength, and rs12463674 was proposed as a causal variant associated with HGS due to its high linkage disequilibrium with the sentinel SNP rs36051007 (r2=0.97).
title: Rare genetic variants impact muscle strength

finding: The SNP rs36051007 was highlighted as a sentinel variant within the TTN locus related to muscle strength, particularly hand grip strength (HGS). Statistical fine-mapping revealed it was in high linkage disequilibrium with the damaging missense variant rs12463674 (r2=0.97), which proposed rs12463674 as the causal variant for HGS. The analysis indicated that common and rare genetic variations should be considered together for better clinical interpretation of variants.
title: Rare genetic variants impact muscle strength

finding: The rs886815 variant was designated as a genome-wide significant risk locus in FTLD-TDP A.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs6739095 T minor allele was associated with significantly worse global deficit score (GDS) and higher rates of neurocognitive (NCI) impairment (all p<0.05). In the cohort analyzed, 41.7% of participants had at least one T risk allele.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The rs1913671 C minor allele correlated with poorer performance in GDS and was linked to an increased frequency of neurocognitive impairment (NCI) (all p<0.05). The allele was present in 41.4% of the cohort.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The rs11684404 C minor allele was linked to worse GDS and more NCI in a dose-dependent manner, with a majority of impairments observed in the homozygous CC individuals compared to TT homozygotes. Statistical significance was maintained with a p-value of 0.0016.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: Homozygosity for the rs1805165 G minor allele was associated with worse GDS and NCI (p<0.001). Approximately 30.9% of participants had at least one G allele, showing its impact on neurocognitive performance.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The rs867529 G minor allele was associated with significant impairments in GDS and NCI (p<0.001), with 30.9% of participants carrying at least one risk allele. It influenced performance specifically in verbal fluency domain.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: The minor A allele of rs13045 was independently associated with worse GDS and NCI outcomes (all p<0.001). Its significance remained after adjustment for other covariates, highlighting its role in executive functioning and learning impairments.
title: Genetic variations in EIF2AK3 are associated with neurocognitive impairment in people living with HIV

finding: This SNP was indicated as a tag SNP with potential implications for reading ability, given its predicted damaging effects, marking it as an important finding.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs1515108, located at the IRS1 locus, was identified as a well-established association with adiponectin levels demonstrating statistical significance even when accounting for heterogeneity in effect sizes.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs1260326, located in the gene GCKR, was identified as a shared causal variant with a high posterior probability (PP = 0.99) between omega-6% levels and alcohol consumption. The T allele of this SNP was associated with lower levels of omega-6% (β = -0.11, P = 7.0 × 10^-159) and reduced alcohol consumption as indicated by various AUDIT measures.
title: Shared genetic basis informs the roles of polyunsaturated fatty acids in brain disorders

finding: At the TET3 locus, the SNP rs34555419 was found within a highly conserved region, demonstrating significant enrichment in GERP, LINSIGHT, phastCons, and phyloP metrics, signaling its regulatory significance.
title: Genetic effects on the timing of parturition and links to fetal birth weight

finding: This SNP demonstrated an association with the expression of the gene DDX55, but only in males, marking it as a male-specific effect. Additionally, it was related to a reduced risk of MS (p=3.98×10^-8, OR=0.90), suggesting a potential protective role of DDX55 expression in the pathology of multiple sclerosis.
title: Biological sex affects functional variation across the human genome

finding: The lead variant rs77509633 was identified at 2q32.3, which is an intergenic variant near the gene SLC39A10 (also known as ZIP10). This finding was novel and linked to psoriasis, with previous studies not associating this locus with the disease. ZIP10 has been implicated in aberrant expression in atopic dermatitis and has a role in humoral immunity.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: The SNP rs777158731 in the RAPGEF4 gene was considered rare, with an ExAC_SAS score of 0.0001. It was classified as deleterious by three out of five prediction tools, and its differential expression was noted in the BD cell lines compared to the control, linking it to the dysfunctional cellular migration phenotype.
title: Dysregulation in EGF/ERBB signaling pathway may explain abnormalities in cellular migration in bipolar disorder in patient-derived neural precursors

finding: The variant rs111770298 was linked to reduced metformin response, evidenced by an increase in fasting glucose among G allele carriers, with a significant differential change of 0.43 mmol/L (p=9.4×10−7) after drug treatment.
title: Genome-wide association analysis identifies ancestry-specific genetic variation associated with medication response in the Study to Understand the Genetics of the Acute Response to Metformin and Glipizide in Humans (SUGAR-MGH)

finding: The rs72844599 variant downstream of THSD7B on chromosome 2q22.1 indicated a risk for VT recurrence with a HR of 1.98 (95% CI: 1.55-2.52, P=3.83x10^-8). The finding related to THSD7B's role as an inhibitor of angiogenesis and its connection with pediatric VT cases.
title: Genomic Landscape of Thrombosis Recurrence Risk Across Venous Thromboembolism Subtypes

finding: The BIN1 rs744373 SNP was found to be associated with faster beta-amyloid associated tau accumulation and cognitive decline, indicating its significance in dementia progression in Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Polygenic effect on accelerated tau pathology accumulation in Alzheimer’s disease: implications for patient selection in clinical trials

finding: Instrumented maternal glutamine via rs7587672, an eQTL for GLS, yielded an imprecise inverse effect on offspring birthweight.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: This SNP was associated with multiple amino acids, providing insights into their genetic associations.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: Five embryos, including the one with the TLE4 missense mutation, shared a haplotype with the stop-gain mutation rs750755379 in the FMNL2 gene. This stop-gain mutation leads to a truncated protein that severely affects function, implicating its potential role in the miscarriage context.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: The stop-gain mutation rs750755379 and the missense substitution rs866373641 were found in a haplotype present in multiple embryos. The missense mutation is predicted to be damaging and, in conjunction with the other mutations in FMNL2, has raised concerns about its contribution to miscarriage.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: Embryo FE165 harbored the deleterious missense mutation rs189416564 in phase with the other mutations found in FMNL2. Its predicted high damage score suggests a significant impact on the gene’s function and relevance to miscarriage susceptibility.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: The SNP rs10209244, located downstream of the RBMS1 gene, was identified as an array-wide significant association with TS. Its random effects p-value was reported at 6.16e-8. The data supported the SNP's relationship to the regulation of the RBMS1 gene, which has been implicated in various biological pathways relevant to TS, reinforcing the potential involvement of steroid regulatory pathways in the disorder.
title: Genome-wide Association Study identifies two novel loci for Gilles de la Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4849879 was associated with a lower risk of breast hypertrophy but a higher risk of breast cancer, representing a conflicting phenotypic effect.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: This SNP (rs4343432) was associated with a higher risk of breast cancer while showing a lower risk of Crohn's disease, indicating a balancing selection effect.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The rs1047891 SNP in CPS1 was associated with multiple traits, including glycine in plasma and eGFR, representing a significant original finding in the study.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The SNP rs80182096, part of the TTN gene, was linked to cardiac contractility, influencing mitral valve annular size through ventricular performance.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The novel locus rs4673661 within the ERBB4 gene was significantly associated with systolic mitral valve annular diameter.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: This SNP was in strong linkage with rs10485012 characterized as a promoter of FKBP7 in fibroblasts and associated with the mitral valve annular diameter.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The SNP rs72777026 indicated the hub gene ADAM17 in astrocytes as a priority, suggesting its potential involvement in Alzheimer's mechanisms.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: For rs4663105, the gene BIN1 was prioritized in different cell types, pointing to its potential significance in Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The T allele was associated with decreased treatment failure/recurrence but had notable prior associations with increased hepatotoxicity.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: The SNP rs1356334 was significantly correlated with mean corpuscular volume, as evidenced by a p-value of 2 × 10^-36, indicating a strong influence on blood cell characteristics.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1517006 showed a significant association with red cell distribution width, with a p-value of 1 × 10^-26, suggesting its relevance in hematological parameters.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs114266592 was associated with platelet count, supported by a p-value of 2 × 10^-15, indicating its potential role in hematological function.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1260326 located in GCKR, important for glucose metabolism and hepatic lipogenesis, showcased associations with triglyceride levels and NAFLD risk, reinforcing its metabolic relevance.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The novel locus rs149682241 identified near ASNSD1 and SLC40A1 was associated with hepatic iron content and hemochromatosis, underscoring its significance in iron metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs982371659 in APOB linked to liver fat through associations to various lipid traits, establishing its significance for hepatic metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs34290285 was linked to PDCD1, an immune-inhibitory receptor, with a posterior inclusion probability of 0.99. PDCD1 was linked to eczema, although it had not been previously established as an eczema gene.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: The SNP rs138478634, a low-frequency variant in the CYP26B1 gene, was proved to be involved in the development of esophageal squamous cell cancer (ESCC), highlighting its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: For the EXOC6B gene, individuals carrying the rs61619102 CC genotype exhibited a notable association between increased levels of CD34+CD133+ endothelial progenitor cells and a reduced risk of AD, indicated by a HR of 0.49 (95% CI: 0.31-0.75, p<0.001). This finding was consistent in the context of vascular pathologies, revealing a potential pathway for therapeutic intervention.
title: Circulating Endothelial Progenitor Cells Reduce the Risk of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant rs149630102-T in MSH2 was associated with altered survival outcomes specifically for glioblastoma patients treated with temozolomide, producing an interaction p-value of 0.0017, showing a median survival of 13.2 months for carriers of the T allele versus 17.6 months for A/A genotype carriers.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The intron variant rs12615967-G in MSH2 was associated with poor prognosis, where carriers had a median survival of 11.3 years compared to 17.9 years for A/A genotype carriers.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs62139913-A SNP in MSH6 was suggestively associated with improved overall survival times (HR=0.26), with median survival of 6.5 years for A allele carriers compared to 1.8 years for G/G genotype.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: Polymorphism rs6739909-G in MSH2 was associated with decreased survival for temozolomide treated individuals, showing a median survival of 11.3 years for T allele carriers compared to 20.4 years for T/T genotype carriers.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The SNP rs6733839 was found to be associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) through genome-wide association studies, contributing to the genetic architecture of AD.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs4663105 was significantly associated with AD, exhibiting a positive effect with a beta of 0.239 and a P-value of 1.51E-13, marking it as one of the most important SNPs in the BIN1 locus implicated in AD.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs7561528 was identified as being associated with AD in previous studies, contributing to the overall risk through its presence in the noncoding regions of the BIN1 gene.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs744373 was associated with AD through genetic studies, enhancing the understanding of how the BIN1 locus contributes to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs11680911 was highlighted for its association with AD risk in previous GWAS, indicating its contribution to the genetic basis of the disease.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The SNP rs35103166 was associated with AD in prior studies, reflecting its relevance in contributing to Alzheimer's susceptibility.
title: Complex genetic interactions affect susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease risk in the BIN1 and MS4A6A loci

finding: The rs6733839 SNP located in the BIN1 gene was identified with significant association (P=1.02e-08) with AD in the meta-analysis, reinforcing its relevance in amyloid pathology.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: The variant rs530551407 was identified as a contributing factor within a locus on chromosome 2 that spans the genes NR4A2 and GPD2. It was part of a group of four variants that drove the rare variant test statistic through a regulatory mechanism associated with type 2 diabetes.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: At the NR4A2/GPD2 locus, rs200945165 significantly contributed to the rare variant test statistic with a contribution of 19.24%. It was predicted to be a non-coding deleterious variant and had the highest CADD score, suggesting its importance in the gene regulatory context related to T2D.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: rs200622604 was also identified at the NR4A2/GPD2 locus and was associated with regulatory mechanisms linked to type 2 diabetes. It contributed to the aggregation of variants that demonstrated significant associations with T2D.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: As part of the regulatory element at the NR4A2/GPD2 locus, rs559881272 contributed to the identification of a significant association with T2D, highlighting its para-functional relevance in transcriptional regulation.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: In the Samoan Study, carriers of rs929186279 had an earlier onset of type 2 diabetes, indicating its potential role as a risk determinant in that ancestral context.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The rs13427957 SNP at chr.2q11.2 correlated positively with IgA levels (Beta=0.04, P=6.19×10^-10) and was associated with IL1R1, essential for immune responses.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: Identified in the TNNT gene, rs9808377 was indicated in association with cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP was located in the TNNT gene and was implicated in known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Found within the TNNT gene, rs2042996 was also associated with cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP was linked to the TNNT gene and identified in the context of cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: SNP rs1001238 was found in the TNNT gene, associated with known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Identified in TNNT, rs2042995 was noted for its association with cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with the TNNT gene in studies of cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Located in TNNT, rs13390491 also showed an association with cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Found within the TNNT gene, rs16866465 was associated with known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP was identified within TNNT and was associated with known cardiomyopathies.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The variant at 2q33.1 (rs17590956) was detected in previous studies within East Asian populations and was identified through the multi-trait analyses as relating to schizophrenia and depression.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs13020212 was associated with the gene PTTG1, which was part of a simplified classification that correlated with lower aggressive pathological features and improved overall survival (OS) and disease-free survival (DFS) in RPLS patients. The classification demonstrated high accuracy in predicting clinical outcomes with implications on treatment decisions.
title: Molecular Feature-Based Classification of Retroperitoneal Liposarcoma: A Prospective Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs6755439 was identified as significant for dry eye disease (DED) in the context of hot spring residency, part of the broader gene-environment interaction studies. It contributed to the population's genetic predisposition to DED.
title: Hot Spring Residency and Disease Association: a Crossover Gene-Environment Interaction (GxE) Study in Taiwan

finding: Showed strong associations with respiratory disorders in the African American population.
title: Impact of natural selection on global patterns of genetic variation, and association with clinical phenotypes, at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: Identified with nominal associations with respiratory diseases indicating its potential role in disease susceptibility.
title: Impact of natural selection on global patterns of genetic variation, and association with clinical phenotypes, at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: Associated significantly with colon cancer indicating its relevance in that specific clinical context.
title: Impact of natural selection on global patterns of genetic variation, and association with clinical phenotypes, at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The ADCY3 variant rs11676272 was noted for its significant association with BMI, peaking at one year, supporting its role in childhood obesity.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The cis-eQTL variant rs2276683 was identified in relation to the long noncoding RNA MAP3K2-DT. It was considered as the lead cis-eQTL variant associated with this lncRNA.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: The SNP rs780094 on the GCKR gene was found to have a significant positive association with prealbumin and vitamin A levels (PP4 = 99.5%), indicating its potential role in pregnancy-related biomarker fluctuations.
title: Genetic analysis of 104 pregnancy phenotypes in 39,194 Chinese women

finding: The SNP rs1050785 was identified as a <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for COL6A3, which was strongly associated with increased odds of coronary artery disease (CAD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.32 (95% CI: 1.16–1.50, P = 1.75 × 10^-5). This finding suggested that higher levels of COL6A3, influenced by this SNP, may elevate the risk of CAD.
title: COL6A3-derived endotrophin mediates the effect of obesity on coronary artery disease: an integrative proteogenomics analysis

finding: The SNP rs11677932 was also found to serve as a <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for the C-terminal target of COL6A3. A phenome-wide association analysis associated the A-allele of rs11677932 with decreased plasma levels of COL6A3-derived endotrophin (β = -0.07, P = 1.5 × 10^-14) and a reduced risk of coronary atherosclerosis (β = -0.05, P = 1.0 × 10^-5). This indicated that the genetic variation at this locus may have significant implications on cardiovascular health.
title: COL6A3-derived endotrophin mediates the effect of obesity on coronary artery disease: an integrative proteogenomics analysis

finding: The rs6727102 SNP was identified as a significant cis-regulatory variant affecting the expression of the DPP4 gene. The alternative allele associated with this SNP was found to decrease DPP4 expression by 3.3-fold. This finding was contextualized within the scope of its relevance to MERS receptor functionality, which highlights its potential impact on respiratory infections.
title: Genetic and non-genetic factors affecting the expression of COVID-19 relevant genes in the large airway epithelium

finding: SNP rs529979470 showed that 18% of cases with the AD risk-increasing genotypes were classified as severe, suggesting a potential link between this SNP and the severity of AD.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The SNP rs2675972 was associated with isoform ENST00000373566 of GIGYF2. It showed a positive effect on the isoform while having a negative effect on schizophrenia risk, illustrating inconsistencies between isoform-level associations and overall gene associations.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: For rs1663078846, the C allele was linked to increased risk of IPF in females (OR 1.69) but decreased risk in males (OR 0.76). This intergenic variant was newly identified and had not been previously associated with IPF.
title: Genome-wide SNP-sex interaction analysis of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The rs2113389 SNP was significantly associated with higher tau levels and cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease (AD). It explained 4.3% of the variation in cortical tau deposition, and individuals carrying the minor T allele demonstrated greater tau deposition across various measures compared to non-carriers.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP rs744373 in the BIN1 gene was associated with greater tau levels, indicating its role as a genetic predictor of tau pathology.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP rs918804, identified in the same region as rs2113389, reached genome-wide significance. It was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2113389 and demonstrated similar associations in cognitive and tau measures.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: SNP rs1478361 was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2113389 and was previously associated with cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels, suggesting a consistent role in tau pathology.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The variant rs12692550 was prioritized as the most probable causal variant for the locus around rs1003835 in the BAZ2B region, showing evidence of colocalization with gene expression data.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: This SNP was associated with vitamin B5 levels at the TCF23-SLC5A6 locus, illustrating its relevance in vitamin biosynthesis.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: SNP rs1260333 was identified at the GCKR locus, showing a connection with vitamin A levels and its metabolic processes.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This SNP was newly associated with barium levels at the GIGYF2 locus, demonstrating its significance in trace element metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: At this locus, an association signal indicated potential effects on amino acid regulation.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This locus showcased its relevance to multiple metabolic pathways involving hormones.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: rs385076 was characterized as an intronic variant in NLRC4, acting as a trans-pQTL for IL18 suggesting altered inflammasome activity.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: At rs13010492, CCL19 levels were positively associated with the variant, with a strong case for CTLA4 acting as a mediating gene.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The strongest signal was found with rs113851554, which was linked to multiple proxy phenotypes relating to sleep and circadian rhythms, including TLA 12am-2am and TLA 2am-4am. This SNP was previously associated with accelerometry-derived sleep duration, emphasizing its relevance in sleep-related phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The rs77136907 variant was identified as a novel locus specific to African ancestry and was associated significantly with primary open-angle glaucoma. Its identification enriches the understanding of genetic diversity in glaucoma risk among different ancestries.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs12476634 variant was found to be an African-specific novel locus associated with primary open-angle glaucoma, contributing to the understanding of the genetic basis of POAG risks within African ancestry.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs2947411 was identified on chromosome 2 in an intergenic region and presented a p value of 3.6e-19. It replicated previous findings associated with smoking (Smk) and served as an eQTL for the gene SH3YL1 in whole blood.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: The SNP rs1801701 (APOB polymorphism) was identified as an independent risk factor for early-onset coronary artery disease (CAD) in a Spanish cohort. This finding linked the genetic variant directly to CAD and established its significance within the context of genetic contributions to the disease.
title: Exploring associations between estrogen and gene candidates identified by coronary artery disease genome-wide association studies

finding: Identified in the analysis for unilateral clefts (UCL), this SNP reached a suggestive significance with a p-value of 1.06×10⁻⁷, indicating a potential risk factor specific to this subtype of clefts.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: This SNP, an intronic variant in GDF7, was associated with descending aortic distensibility and showed strong eQTL effects for both GDF7 and LDAH in the aorta.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The rs1260326 variant was significantly associated with higher levels of very low-density lipoproteins (VLDL) and triglycerides, indicating its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The SNP rs6757605 was associated with the eQTL regulating GPD2 expression, where suppression in animal models extended lifespan, indicating potential ramifications for human longevity.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs59642822 influenced GLS1 expression, and its inhibition in models was shown to ameliorate age-related pathologies, positioning it as a candidate for studies on human aging.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs7574865 was positively associated with autoimmune diseases (AIDs), particularly in the context of Type 1 diabetes (T1D) aggregation in offspring with parental AIDs. This finding suggests a genetic contribution from this polymorphism to the risk of T1D in children whose parents had AIDs.
title: Effect of parental autoimmune diseases on type 1 diabetes in offspring can be partially explained by HLA and non-HLA polymorphisms: a nationwide registry and biobank-based study in 7.2M Finns

finding: The SNP was found to be causally linked to a reduced risk of macular degeneration as a cis-associated sentinel SNP, passing the colocalisation test with significant effect sizes.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: Significant associations were also identified for rs3087243 (CTLA4) in ME/CFS patients, with successful detection of a target power of 80% for the allele association reported, particularly when the chance of misdiagnosis was low (<0.09).
title: Impact of imperfect diagnosis in ME/CFS association studies

finding: This SNP, part of the UGT1A complex, was associated with both total bilirubin levels (Tbil) and indirect bilirubin levels (Ibil), with p-values of 5.08E-14 and 1.51E-16 respectively, confirming previous findings from other studies.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The rs10201159 SNP was associated with various metabolites, including N2-acetyl,N6,N6-dimethyllysine. It was implicated in metabolic pathways influencing amino acid and fatty acid metabolism, suggesting its relevance in metabolic disorders.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: This SNP was associated with the odds of missingness of N-acetylkynurenine, linking it to the kynurenine pathway and suggesting its involvement in metabolic processes that could be affected by genetic variation.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The variant rs143080277 in the NCK2 gene demonstrated a genome-wide significant association with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) in stage 2 with a P-value of 2.69×10^-9 and was replicated in stage 3 with a P-value of 7.17×10^-13, indicating its significant role in the risk of LOAD.

The rs148950085 variant was identified as a paternally inherited variant adjacent to exon 144 of the NEB gene. It was reported to have conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity in ClinVar, being classified as pathogenic in four submissions and of uncertain significance in two others. The variant was predicted to cause donor loss, and it was linked to two individuals presenting with congenital myopathy. Additionally, this variant has been associated with being pathogenic when found in trans with a missense or truncating NEB variant, but not reported in homozygosity. The allele frequency was noted to be higher in East Asian populations, suggesting a potential common ancestry for the patients. Overall, this finding supported its association with nemaline myopathy, despite the unresolved mechanisms for disease.
title: Differential inclusion of NEB exons 143 and 144 provides insight into NEB-related myopathy variant interpretation and disease manifestation

finding: The study highlighted a sQTL at rs59909741 that colocalized with waist circumference, noted for its high frequency of 23.5% in 1000 Genomes Africans and a perfect colocalization probability of PP4 = 1.00.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The SNP rs934734, which is linked to the SPRED2 gene, was reported to confer increased protection against rheumatoid arthritis (RA) through its minor allele. This suggested a potential genetic factor that might mitigate the disease's severity.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs11676922, linked to AFF3, was recognized for increasing the risk of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) with its minor allele, thus illustrating its role as a risk factor within the context of RA subgroups.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs11571302, linked to the CTLA4 gene, was indicated to possess reduced protection against rheumatoid arthritis (RA) with its minor allele, reinforcing its potential influence on disease susceptibility.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs11677932, located at GRCh38, chr2:237315312 A/G, was associated with increased aortic expression of COL6A3. The G allele was linked to higher plasma levels of COL6A3 and a decreased risk for abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) with a posterior probability of colocalization of 0.84.
title: Plasma proteomics reveals the potential causal impact of extracellular matrix proteins on abdominal aortic aneurysm

finding: SNP rs4953148, associated with SIX3, was found to have a connection to lifetime smoking, reinforcing the genetic basis for smoking-related COPD risk.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs5831575, proximal to BCL11A, was linked to immune dysfunction, which is thought to play a significant role in COPD.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs79641866 was identified as a significant intronic variant associated with RPD in the study, reaching genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.3e-08, making it a unique finding for this phenotype.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study
