finding: In high LD with rs13412535, this variant was a pQTL associated with SERPINE2 and linked to the pathogenesis of hypertrophic scars.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The SNP rs12151621 exhibited a significant deQTL for GNLY, specifically in NK and CD8ET cells. This association was noted for its role in affecting GNLY's expression dispersion while being located at a CTCF binding site.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: This SNP was associated with enhancers in embryonic cell populations, supporting its influence in gene regulation and potential implications in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Single cell chromatin accessibility reveals regulatory elements and developmental trajectories in the embryonic forebrain

finding: The SNP rs1042031 in the apolipoprotein B gene was associated with an increased risk of breast cancer in a Chinese population. This finding confirmed the role of genetic variants in influencing susceptibility to breast cancer, particularly within specific ethnic groups.
title: Identification of Key Genes Potentially Related to Triple Receptor Negative Breast Cancer by Microarray Analysis

finding: The findings indicated that the BIN1 risk polymorphism at rs744373 was associated with increased mRNA levels of BIN1. This association had implications for Alzheimer's disease (AD) as it related to poorer memory function in individuals with epilepsy. This suggests a potential role of rs744373 in influencing BIN1 expression and consequently, AD risk.
title: Loss of the Alzheimer’s-linked bridging integrator 1 (BIN1) protein affects synaptic structure and disrupts tau localisation and release

finding: The SNP rs13033745 was strongly linked to the <italic>MEIS1</italic> promoter region and was implicated in sleep regulation, particularly in the context of insomnia and restless leg syndrome.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: The SNP rs7587835 mapped to the DNER gene, which mediates neuron-glia interactions. It had a p-value of 0.02 in the GWAS, indicating an association with cognitive functions.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: For rs10187424, the risk 'T' allele exhibited significantly increased transcriptional activity compared to the normal 'C' allele in PC-3 cells, suggesting a positive regulatory role.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The SNP rs13415583 showed a discovery p-value of 1.913e-06 for rheumatoid arthritis. As a newly significant lead variant in the cFDR analysis, it demonstrated its strength in the validation cohort with a p-value of 4.764e-09, indicating improved significance over its initial report.
title: fcfdr: an R package to leverage continuous and binary functional genomic data in GWAS

finding: The SNP rs2584937 was located 40398 bp downstream of NCOA1, a gene previously associated with major depressive disorder (MDD). NCOA1 was linked to glucocorticoid receptor signaling impairments, which are implicated in MDD. The study noted that NCOA1 expression increased during pregnancy but was diminished in depressed individuals, suggesting a relationship between this SNP and depression.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The rs116558455 SNP in the FN1 gene was found in healthy elderly APOEε4 homozygous carriers in the EFIGA/WHICAP cohorts, showing a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.85%. Notably, this SNP was absent in all APOEε4 carriers with Alzheimer's disease, indicating a potential protective role for carriers of this variant against AD pathology.
title: Rare genetic variation in Fibronectin 1 (FN1) protects against APOEe4 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs140926439 SNP in the FN1 gene was also identified in healthy elderly APOEε4 homozygous carriers, with an MAF of 3.33%. In non-Hispanic whites, this variant was absent in homozygous APOEε4 AD patients but present in 1% of heterozygous patients, further suggesting its association with reduced risk of developing AD among APOEε4 carriers.
title: Rare genetic variation in Fibronectin 1 (FN1) protects against APOEe4 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs755264566 in the ZRANB3 locus was identified as a novel candidate for T2D, showing a significant association with a p-value of 2.831 x 10^-9 and was corroborated by evidence of direction consistency in further studies.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The SNP rs6733839, located near the BIN1 locus, was found to exhibit a high population attributable risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Its risk allele had an approximate allele frequency of 40% in the population and a significant effect size, with an odds ratio of 1.20 (95% confidence interval: 1.17–1.23). This finding highlighted that rs6733839 contributed to the increased risk of developing AD.
title: Alzheimer’s disease risk gene BIN1 induces Tau-dependent network hyperexcitability

finding: The rs744373 SNP, also associated with BIN1, was found to correlate with increased levels of Tau-PET in Alzheimer's disease patients. This SNP was linked to reduced functional connectivity and impaired memory performance. The association established rs744373's role in the pathophysiology of AD, suggesting that it potentially modulated Tau-related neuronal activity.
title: Alzheimer’s disease risk gene BIN1 induces Tau-dependent network hyperexcitability

finding: The rs930263 SNP was associated with KCNA5, an important gene for neuronal excitability, indicating therapeutic implications for MS.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs6742078, an intron variant of UTG1A4, was associated with a high hazard ratio of 13.167 when analyzing the PHS. The UTG1A4 gene encodes an enzyme responsible for transforming lipophilic molecules such as bilirubin, indicating a potential impact on metabolic pathways related to disease.
title: Fast Lasso method for Large-scale and Ultrahigh-dimensional Cox Model with applications to UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11692435, associated with CT1, had a significance level of p=1.17×10−12. It belonged to the ACTR1B gene and was noted to be related to schizophrenia.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SNP rs7570830 associated with SA5 has previous links to subcortical volumes, underlining its role in neuroanatomical traits and cognitive functions.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The genetic variant rs11884632, associated with the ferroportin gene (SLC40A1), revealed voxel-wise associations in the pallidum and other brain regions. It was related to iron transport and homeostasis, and mutations in this gene were previously linked to hemochromatosis.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs9332964 C>T in SRD5A2 was associated with 5-alpha reductase deficiency, an autosomal recessive disorder affecting male sexual development. This SNP had not been reported previously in the KHV call set and was noted to be rare globally and in East Asian populations, but more common in the Vietnamese population with an allele frequency of 2.90%.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs4988235 was identified as the strongest signal of selection at the well-characterized LCT locus, which is associated with lactase persistence. This SNP's derived allele linked to the ability to digest lactose into adulthood showed an estimated selection coefficient of 0.080, consistent with earlier literature. The analysis indicated that the recent strong selective pressure may have been influenced by historical factors, including famines where being able to digest lactose proved advantageous. Furthermore, while most other SNPs in the LCT region displayed additive selection, rs4988235 was classified as having indeterminate selection dynamics, suggesting its evolution was influenced by a mix of additive and dominant mechanisms.
title: A novel expectation-maximization approach to infer general diploid selection from time-series genetic data

finding: The SNP rs6717613 (G->A) was found to significantly impact the binding strength of transcription factor ATF2, as indicated by its Delta-MOP score of 0.45, which reflected the differences between the major and minor allele MOP scores (0.29 for the G allele and 0.74 for the A allele). This finding demonstrated that this variant could potentially influence drug sensitivity in lymphoblastoid cell lines by altering ATF2's ability to bind to the DNA.
title: Genome-wide non-coding variant interpretation improves discovery of transcriptional regulators of drug response

finding: The SNP rs4507142 was identified as an outlier and had implications for causal relationships with GM-BAG, alongside other metabolic traits and conditions.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs11689011, associated with HIF2A, presented a suggestive association with basal metabolic rate. This highlighted a connection between hypoxia-inducible factors and metabolic regulation.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The rs55703767 missense mutation in COL4A3 was identified in a GWAS as a risk locus for ESKD in T1DM, indicating a strong association with enhanced risk of kidney disease in these individuals.
title: Assessment of differentially methylated loci in individuals with end-stage kidney disease attributed to diabetic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs7583877 was noted as significantly associated with ESKD, specifically located in the AFF3 gene. The study revealed increased methylation levels that could potentially lead to decreased gene expression in T1DM-ESKD individuals.
title: Assessment of differentially methylated loci in individuals with end-stage kidney disease attributed to diabetic kidney disease

finding: SIA detected a strong signal of selection at this SNP, which has been associated with lactase persistence. It inferred a sweep probability close to 1 and a selection coefficient greater than 0.01, indicating it was one of the strongest signals of selection in the human genome.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The rs4988235(T) allele, located upstream of the LCT gene, was associated with adult lactase persistence in Western Eurasia. Its frequency across populations varied from 5% to nearly 100%, placing its selection coefficient among the highest in human populations. Ancient DNA evidence indicated that this allele was rare in Europe during the Neolithic but became common in Northern Europe post-Iron Age, suggesting a rise in frequency potentially facilitated by gene flow from areas where the allele was more prevalent.
title: Modelling the spatiotemporal spread of beneficial alleles using ancient genomes

finding: The rs1990760 variant was associated with increased susceptibility to Type 1 diabetes (T1D) as it resulted in the IFIH1<sup>A946T</sup> mutation, which conferred a risk for multiple autoimmune diseases. In experiments using <italic>Ifih1<sup>R</sup></italic> knock-in mice, evidence indicated a modest increase in diabetes incidence and insulitis compared to non-risk mice, confirming its role in T1D pathogenesis.
title: The IFIH1-A946T risk variant promotes diabetes in a sex-dependent manner

finding: The finding related to rs34111570 indicated that it was a lead eVar found within the primary eQTL locus of the MCFD2 gene. This locus was shown to overlap with the gene body, situated in a region of extensive linkage disequilibrium (LD). It was significant because all eVars reported by the GTEx consortium were included within this LD block.
title: TreeMap: A Structured Approach to Fine Mapping of eQTL Variants

finding: For rs7574514, the analysis revealed it was a linked eVar that co-located with the primary eVar rs34111570 within the MCFD2 gene's primary eQTL locus. Like rs34111570, it was identified within an area of extensive LD, indicating potential regulatory interactions contributing to gene modulation. Both variants were crucial in the understanding of the genetic architecture regulating the MCFD2 gene.
title: TreeMap: A Structured Approach to Fine Mapping of eQTL Variants

finding: The study indicated that the rs3749171 variant of GPR35, which results in a T108M substitution, was associated with the pathogenesis of ulcerative colitis (UC), supporting the hypothesis that GPR35 plays a crucial role in epithelial barrier integrity.
title: Epithelial GPR35 protects from Citrobacter rodentium infection by preserving goblet cells and mucosal barrier integrity

finding: The SNP rs4988235 related to lactose intolerance was also present in all analyzed individuals from the TK period. This consistent presence demonstrated that lactose intolerance was already established in the population long before the modern era, indicating continuity in genetic traits over time.
title: Diverse northern Asian and Jomon-related genetic structure discovered among socially complex Three Kingdoms period Gaya region Koreans

finding: The EDAR variant rs3827760, linked to hair straightness and thickness, was homozygous in six out of eight individuals, including the female sample AKG_10207, who exhibited a more Jomon-like phenotype. This SNP's prevalence among the TK individuals confirmed its long-standing presence in the lineage leading to modern Koreans.
title: Diverse northern Asian and Jomon-related genetic structure discovered among socially complex Three Kingdoms period Gaya region Koreans

finding: The risk allele rs7556897 was located 10.3kb from the CCL20 gene and associated with inflammatory skin disease, specifically psoriasis. It exhibited a high variant-to-gene (V2G) score and had implications for CCL20 expression based on eQTL and pQTL mapping studies.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: This SNP was identified in previous studies as being associated with elevated systolic blood pressure (SBP) or diastolic blood pressure (DBP). The analysis revealed it alongside its correlated partner SNP rs1898841.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: This SNP was recurrently associated with elevated SBP/DBP, showing significant correlation with rs1374264. This pair demonstrated a correlation coefficient (r) of 0.59.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The study found that rs12616641 was significantly associated with the strength of the somatomotor network and also showed significance for the strength of the limbic network. This SNP was located in an intergenic region near the PAX8 gene on chromosome 2. The findings suggested a nuanced role of this genetic variant in functional brain network integrity, as these measures were linked to traits such as sleep duration and insomnia.
title: Novel genetic variants associated with brain functional networks in 18,445 adults from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4124874 (UGT1A1*60 T>G) was identified as a minor allele that decreased the transcriptional activity of the UGT1A1 promoter, affecting drug-induced gene expression.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs3771341 was associated with bilirubin levels and was found to significantly influence the expression of UGT1A1 in liver according to eQTL data.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: Similar to rs3771341, SNP rs4148325 was also linked to circulating bilirubin levels and demonstrated a significant association with UGT1A1 expression.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: This SNP was identified in the proximal region of UGT1A1 and was significantly associated with UGT1A1 expression levels in the liver.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs4148324 was associated with the expression of UGT1A1 in liver tissues, highlighting its role in regulating UGT1A1 levels.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: The variant rs41380347, associated with lactase persistence in Arabian populations, showed evidence for strong selection with a selection coefficient of s = 0.011 in Saudis. It was present at a frequency of approximately 50% in Saudis and Emiratis, but only 4% in the Levant and Iraq. The variant was not found in Eurasian or African populations, indicating a recent origin within the Middle East.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs6749207 was found in the EDAR gene, which is linked to hair structure, teeth, and sweat gland development. This SNP was under positive selection in East Asian and Native American populations, contributing to the adaptation related to increased hair thickness.
title: A fast linkage disequilibrium-based statistical test for Genome-Wide Epistatic Selection Scans in structured populations

finding: The G189S mutation, represented by rs587779507, was classified as deleterious by analysis using Variant Effect Predictor software. This classification supported the causality of the mutation in relation to Vascular Ehlers Danlos Syndrome (vEDS), a disorder caused by mutations in the COL3A1 gene that adversely impacts collagen folding and stability.
title: The chemical chaperone 4-phenylbutyric acid rescues molecular cell defects of COL3A1 mutations that cause vascular Ehlers Danlos Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2972156 demonstrated a significant difference in allele effect sizes between genders, with a p value of 2.49×10^-12. The male and female p values were 1.30×10^-46 and 4.20×10^-7 respectively, indicating its relevance to lean body mass variation.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: The SNP rs11691869, associated with the gene AFF3, was linked to schizophrenia (SCZ) and intellectual disability. It was identified as one of the eight lead SNPs related to gene expression in brain tissue and emphasized the SNP's contributions to understanding the genetic underpinnings of psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: The SNP rs1653301, near the gene FTCDNL1, was reported to relate to schizophrenia (SCZ). As an eQTL, it was one of the eight lead SNPs that led to substantial insights on the genetic connections between creativity and psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: The SNP rs13020230 was identified in a study that focused on genetic variations associated with glioblastoma. It was reported to correlate with tumor characteristics and the presence of tumor-specific neutrophils (TSNs) that were linked to immunosuppression in the tumor microenvironment. This SNP finding provided new insights into the genetic underpinnings of glioma aggressiveness and suggested a potential target for improving therapeutic approaches.
title: Tumor-specific neutrophils originating from meninges promote glioblastoma

finding: The ATG16L1 SNP rs2241880 was found to have a significant frequency in CD-PDOs compared to healthy controls, demonstrating its potential role in Crohn's disease genetics, particularly in the context of the organoid models used in this study.
title: A Living Organoid Biobank of Crohn’s Disease Patients Reveals Molecular Subtypes for Personalized Therapeutics

finding: The SNP rs7604640 was identified as having significant open chromatin activity in D1 and D2 medium spiny neurons (MSNs) and is located approximately 46kb upstream of the SIX3 gene on chromosome 2. This SNP overlaps with human orthologs of mouse open chromatin regions and was part of the SmokingInitiation GWAS with a P-value of 3.04 x 10^-12. It was also recognized as a cis-eQTL for the antisense SIX3-AS1 gene in striatal regions according to the GTEX project, indicating its potential role in regulating gene expression relevant to addiction.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: SNP rs76182733 had the strongest association with the reproductive subtype within the 2q37.3 locus, showing a genome-wide significant P-value of 2.76×10^-9 and an odds ratio of 5.68, although it was only genotyped in Stage 1.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs55762028 showed significant association with the metabolic subtype of PCOS, having a meta-analysis P-value of 1.03×10^-8, located intergenic between FIGN and KCNH7.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The variant rs6546231 near MEIS1 was associated with increased Forearm:Height. Mouse models exhibiting MEIS1 disruption displayed specifically abnormal forelimb development, indicating a direct correlation between this SNP and skeletal trait impact.
title: The genetic architecture of the human skeletal form

finding: For the gene ARL4C, the rs1464264 reQTL indicated subtle effects during the IAV experiment, showing independent contributions from interaction terms that adjusted the total eQTL effect.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The rs10194534 reQTL for SESTD1 during the IAV perturbation displayed significant interaction terms, confirming its relevance in a cell-perturbation setting.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: SNP rs13404184 was found to disrupt the binding of transcription factor SPI1, which regulates the gene INPP5D in the hippocampus and lateral temporal lobe. This disruption relates to the understanding of Alzheimer's disease (AD) phenotypes.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs61068452 similarly interrupted the binding of transcription factor SPI1 on regulatory elements, affecting the gene INPP5D in the same brain regions, reinforcing its linkage to Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs71350303 disrupted RELA regulation of TNFAIP6 in the hippocampus, associating with key inflammatory pathways in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs56967129 was associated with luciferase induction activity in the hECE18<sup>FragA</sup> context, indicating its influence on enhancer activity related to the regulation of the <italic>EN1</italic> gene in keratinocytes.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: The SNP rs146778681 contributed to fold change in luciferase activity relative to control in assays performed in cultured human keratinocytes, suggesting its role in modulating the expression of <italic>EN1</italic>.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: The variation at SNP rs769072620 was identified as having a significant impact on the enhancer activity of hECE18<sup>FragA</sup>, thereby potentially affecting the development and density of eccrine sweat glands by influencing <italic>EN1</italic> expression.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: SNP rs529226880 was shown to influence the enhancer activity of hECE18<sup>FragA</sup>, playing a role in the upregulation of the <italic>EN1</italic> gene during kernel assays conducted in keratinocytes.
title: An Engrailed1 enhancer underlies human thermoregulatory evolution

finding: The variant rs114050631 regulated the CXCR2 gene and was shown to influence levels of relevant immune cell types significantly, evidenced by PCHi-C analyses.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs13030469 was associated with the CXCL12 pathway's role in breast cancer metastasis. Specifically, it suggested a link between genetic variations at this locus and the behavior of cancer stem cells within their niche, which plays a role in promoting metastasis.
title: Intratumoral CXCL12 Gradients Contextualize Tumor Cell Invasion, Migration and Immune Suppression in Breast Cancer

finding: The rs1344706 polymorphism in ZNF804A was associated with schizophrenia (SZ) and was the first SNP to show a genome-wide significant association for psychosis. This finding was replicated in subsequent genome-wide association studies (GWAS). In a study focusing on healthy participants, the AA genotype showed increased variability in motor sequence task (MST) performance, while the CC genotype exhibited augmented coupling of slow-wave activity during sleep after learning. The differences in sleep neurophysiology, such as slow-wave and spindle amplitudes, between the genotype groups suggested that rs1344706 impacted local and distributed neural network activity relevant for information processing during sleep.
title: Schizophrenia-associated variation at ZNF804A correlates with altered experience-dependent dynamics of sleep slow-waves and spindles in healthy young adults

finding: The rs10166942[C] allele was associated with reduced migraine risk, indicating that homozygous individuals for this allele expressed less TRPM8 and were less sensitive to cold compared to those with a T at this position. This SNP was located 5' of the TRPM8 start codon and was linked to a lower predisposition for migraine occurrence.
title: The neurotrophin artemin and its receptor GFRα3 mediate migraine-like pain via the ion channel TRPM8

finding: The SNP rs35349669 was associated with increased INPP5D levels, which were linked to an increased risk for developing late-onset sporadic Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). This association was highlighted through multiple genetic studies, suggesting a significant role of INPP5D in the pathology of Alzheimer's disease.
title: INPP5D limits plaque formation and glial reactivity in the APP/PS1 mouse model of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10175462 was identified as the first genome-wide significant cervical cancer risk SNP outside of the HLA region in a European ancestry population. It was located in the PAX8 locus at 2q13, showcasing a new genetic risk factor for cervical cancer.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The allele frequency spectrum (AFS) analysis revealed that rs1550623-A, located in the intron region of CDCA7, was fixed at 1 in HM and other East Asians. This SNP was reported as the strongest risk allele for breast cancer in European populations, which had a frequency of 0.8469. The finding indicated significant differences in risk allele frequencies between HM populations and other East Asian and continental populations, emphasizing the clinical utility of this SNP in cancer susceptibility studies.
title: Differentiated genomic footprints and connections inferred from 440 Hmong-Mien genomes suggest their isolation and long-distance migration

finding: The analysis identified rs3827760 (A>G) within EDARV370A as an East Asian-specific adaptive coding variant, with the highest derived allele frequency in HM people. This variant was modeled in knockin mice, demonstrating its control over hair thickness and the number of mammary and eccrine glands. This finding suggested a connection to phenotypic diversity related to adaptations in East Asian living conditions.
title: Differentiated genomic footprints and connections inferred from 440 Hmong-Mien genomes suggest their isolation and long-distance migration

finding: The SNP rs72825667 was characterized as a microglia-specific eQTL for MERTK, a gene involved in macrophage clearance and other processes. It was located in its cis-regulatory element region. This finding emphasized the capability of EPIC-unmix to uncover significant eQTLs that possess biological relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type specific inference from bulk RNA-sequencing data by integrating single cell reference profiles via EPIC-unmix

finding: The SNP rs1367117 associated with the ApoB variant peptide TSQC[T/I]LK was observed, although no significant pQTL was detected at the protein level. This SNP had strong associations with LDL cholesterol levels, indicating distinct signals affecting lipoprotein composition, with one signal linked to structural changes in ApoB and the other to protein level changes.
title: Nanoparticle Enrichment Mass-Spectrometry Proteomics Identifies Protein Altering Variants for Precise pQTL Mapping

finding: The SNP rs41380347, located upstream of the LCT gene, was found to indicate that sample syr013 was heterozygous for this SNP, with five reads being the derived allele (C) and four reads the ancestral allele (A). This heterozygosity suggests that syr013 exhibited lactose tolerance, which relates to the trait of lactase persistence seen in various populations.
title: Bioarchaeological analysis of one of the earliest Islamic burials in the Levant

finding: SNP rs17481869 located at 2p22.3 was found to be an ATAC-QTL that correlated with chromatin accessibility associated with B-ALL risk. The study provided functional validation of differential allele-specific activity for this SNP in various B-ALL cell lines, underscoring its significant role in B-ALL susceptibility and chromatin modifications.
title: Epigenomic mapping in B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia identifies transcriptional regulators and noncoding variants promoting distinct chromatin architectures

finding: The study indicated that the INSIG2 gene rs7566605 polymorphism was associated with severe obesity in Japanese populations. It was noted that metabolism and body size traits are influenced by GxE interactions, further connecting this SNP to adaptations related to diet, especially high-fat diets, in various environmental contexts.
title: Gene-by-environment interactions and adaptive body size variation in mice from the Americas

finding: In the context of EPAS1, the rs13419896/G allele was associated with significant downregulation of mRNA expression of EPAS1 in Sherpa highlanders, with mRNA levels at 22.1% of those seen in non-Sherpa lowlanders. This finding suggested a contribution to the blunted hypoxic EPO response in Sherpas.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs4953354/A allele in EPAS1 showed downregulation of mRNA expression in Sherpa highlanders at 62.9% of the levels in non-Sherpa lowlanders. This downregulation indicated an adaptive mechanism to high-altitude hypoxia, moderating EPO production.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs34290285 SNP was associated with an asthma-related GWAS signal and functioned as a u-sQTL in the D2HGDH gene, where the protective allele produced an unproductive isoform with a premature termination codon (PTC). This resulted in the downregulation of D2HGDH expression levels, illustrating a characteristic consistent with AS-NMD.
title: Global impact of aberrant splicing on human gene expression levels

finding: The rs71430382 SNP was identified as a significant eQTL signal in the D2HGDH gene, showing a strong association with GWAS signals for traits related to asthma. This SNP's effects were contrasted with those of rs34290285, particularly in thyroid tissue, where rs34290285 had a stronger effect on D2HGDH expression levels.
title: Global impact of aberrant splicing on human gene expression levels

finding: The SNP rs10196867 in the CTNNA2 gene was identified as genome-wide significant (P=4.67×10^-8), being associated with opioid and stimulant dependence. The findings replicated in the independent cohort, suggesting a potential role in modulating addiction phenotypes although also linked with a low MAF.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: rs4577244 was reported to have weak associations with luminal A-like disease and a higher risk of TN disease. It had an OR of 0.90 for luminal A-like and was associated with TN disease with an OR of 1.27.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: rs12710696 showed associations without evidence for HR-negative subsets and was part of the study's findings.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Showed associations primarily in HR-negative disease from past analyses.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP acted as a fetal cortex eQTL for TBR1, with significant associations (P-value of 3.4 x 10^-9 and replicated with 8.1 x 10^-12). TBR1 is critical in neurodevelopment, particularly in postmitotic projection neurons.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: This SNP was noted as a missense variant (p.A143V) impacting the ACTR1B protein function. It was also an eQTL for ACTR1B in fetal cortex (P-value of 3.2 x 10^-10, replicated as 4.5 x 10^-10), suggesting involvement in neuronal migration.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The study reported that individuals with the GG genotype at rs4988235, which is associated with lactase non-persistence, had a greater relative abundance of the genus Bifidobacterium in their gut microbiomes compared to individuals with AA/AG genotypes who are lactase persistent. The findings indicated that this greater abundance was observed across multiple Bifidobacterium species, supporting a model where higher Bifidobacterium levels in lactase non-persistent individuals resulted from a general increase at the genus level rather than differences in species composition. This relationship demonstrated the influence of the lactase gene variant on gut microbiome composition.
title: Strain-level analysis of Bifidobacterium spp. from gut microbiomes of adults of differing lactase persistence genotypes

finding: The SNP rs9678851 was identified in gene SLC4A1AP, which was found associated with systolic blood pressure (SBP) in a meta-analysis. This association indicated that SLC4A1AP plays a role in blood pressure regulation, which is linked to cardiovascular diseases.
title: Powerful statistical method to detect disease associated genes using publicly available GWAS summary data

finding: The SNP rs780094 in the GCKR gene was identified as a quantitative trait locus associated with plasma triglyceride concentration. It lies within a region of linkage disequilibrium, suggesting its relevance to lipid metabolism and traits.
title: Powerful statistical method to detect disease associated genes using publicly available GWAS summary data

finding: The variant rs12712928, located near the SIX3 gene, was associated with FG and demonstrated significant allelic differences in transcriptional activity and transcription factor binding, along with associations to gene expression levels, providing robust evidence for its involvement in glycaemic traits.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The SNP rs4988235 is known as the derived allele associated with lactase persistence in Europeans. This finding was detailed in the context of an ancestral 4.0 kbp insertion within the first intron of the LCT gene that was previously reported based on fosmid sequencing from European samples. It was determined that this insertion, which contains 11 predicted transcription factor binding sites, is ancestral, and the human reference genome carries the derived deleted allele. Notably, the derived allele at rs4988235 is in complete linkage disequilibrium with the reference allele of this SV, indicating a strong association between these two mutations and lactase persistence, a trait that underwent adaptive evolution in European populations.
title: De novo assembly of 64 haplotype-resolved human genomes of diverse ancestry and integrated analysis of structural variation

finding: The rs4374383 polymorphism in the MERTK gene was identified as a predictor for the progression of liver fibrosis in patients infected with the Hepatitis C virus, demonstrating its relevance in liver disease pathology. Furthermore, this SNP was linked to the severity of fibrosis in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, emphasizing its role across different liver conditions. Additional research also suggested that this variant was predictive of incident non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and diabetes, highlighting the complex interactions between mononuclear cell activation, adipokine responses, and dietary fat intake.
title: Differential TAM receptor regulation of hepatic physiology and injury

finding: The rs17831251 SNP was linked to a human-specific regulatory region associated with podocyte-specific expression of the PLA2R1 gene. This relationship was contextualized within the framework of kidney disease, where the SNP's association facilitated understanding of chromatin accessibility patterns that were specifically relevant to kidney-related traits. Additionally, the regulatory activity surrounding this SNP was supported by binding predictions for the MAFB transcription factor near this locus.
title: Comparative single-cell analyses identify shared and divergent features of human and mouse kidney development

finding: The SNP rs3771180 was highlighted as a significant eQTL in the GTEx dataset and was associated with asthma, indicating its regulatory role in inflammatory responses as it is located upstream of the Interleukin Receptor 1 gene.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: The SNP rs2241880, causing the T300A substitution in the ATG16L1 gene, was identified as a significant genetic risk factor for Crohn's Disease (CD). Analysis showed that heterozygosity for this allele correlated with enhanced protection against lethal Salmonella enterica Typhimurium infection in mice. The finding indicated that one copy of the T300A variant was sufficient to promote cytokine production through inflammasome activation, while homozygosity led to impaired autophagy-related processes, thereby increasing susceptibility to infections. Additionally, human donors with the T300A variant exhibited heightened inflammasome activation, which aligns with the benefits seen in heterozygous carriers.
title: Heterozygosity for Crohn’s Disease Risk Allele of ATG16L1 Protects against Bacterial Infection

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead finding for a novel locus at PAX3 associated with adult BMI in Hispanic/Latino samples and validated in Stage 2.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The rs11575194 variant was significantly associated with IGFBP-5 levels and birth weight, but not with height or sitting height ratio (SHR). This variant's association with IGFBP-5 levels was a novel finding as previous associations were not reported, marking it as an important genetic marker in the regulation of birth weight.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The variant rs62107263 in the ALKAL2 gene was identified as having G×E effects on BMI, and it had been previously associated with obesity and body fat distribution, lung function, and smoking status.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The variant rs62107261 was associated with obesity and body fat distribution. It was in D′ with rs62107263, further supporting its role in G×E interactions related to BMI.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The variant rs74676797 in the TMEM18 gene showed G×E effects on BMI and was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs13021737, which had previously been linked to obesity.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The variant rs13021737 was previously shown to associate with BMI and obesity, and it was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs74676797, which was implicated in G×E effects on BMI.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: The rs1049359-tagged CRE was shown to regulate the expression of the distal target genes RNF181 and TMSB10, with RT-qPCR results affirming the regulatory influence of the variant in a complex genetic association.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs1143634 was linked to lower expression levels of IL1B in MDM at certain time points following LPS treatment. The minor allele was associated with reduced expression, implicating rs1143634 in the gene expression variability observed in inflammatory response related to IBD.
title: The association between transcriptional regulation of macrophage differentiation and activation and genetic susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The association between the rs2975760 SNP of Calpain 10 (CAPN10) and Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (GDM) was established, indicating that this genetic variation contributed to the risk of developing GDM.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs3792267 SNP of CAPN10 was found to be associated with Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (GDM), suggesting its role as a genetic contributor to the condition.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The C/T SNP rs1143634 in IL1B was associated with blood lipid levels, including low-density lipoprotein (LDL) and total cholesterol (TC), and was noted for its potential impact on myocardial infarction (MI) risk.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs13020182 was highlighted as relevant in the context of a study investigating the anti-cancer properties of taurine. The research demonstrated that taurine, when supplemented above levels found in ovarian carcinoma (OC) ascites, led to growth suppression of OC cell cultures. This suppression was linked to modulation of p53 protein binding and the induction of p21 and TIGAR expression, implicating rs13020182 in the potential therapeutic implications for growth suppression in OC.
title: Taurine supplementation activates growth suppression mechanisms in ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs232230 (C->G) in the IGKC gene was identified as a nonsynonymous variant (V->L) that significantly increased risk factors for gastric cancer and breast cancer, with odds ratios of 1.64 and 1.94, respectively. It was also linked to Helicobacter pylori infection in gastric cancer and age in breast cancer. This allele was present in 1,066 haplotypes of the G1K samples and showed an even distribution across various populations, with a median of 38 haplotypes, thus indicating its widespread presence.
title: Population matched (PM) germline allelic variants of immunoglobulin (IG) loci: New pmIG database to better understand IG repertoire and selection processes in disease and vaccination

finding: The study found that the homozygosity of the minor C allele of synonymous SNV rs6759814 located in KCNH7 was associated with branch chain amino acid valine, underscoring the gene's involvement in metabolic processes linked to T2DM.
title: Recessive genetic effects on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a consanguineous population

finding: This rare variant located in TBR1 was reported to cluster among individuals with obesity or T2DM, illustrating its potential significance in metabolic disorders.
title: Recessive genetic effects on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a consanguineous population

finding: The caQTL and clQTL rs2692224 at the FN1 locus located about 40kb downstream of the transcription start site demonstrated higher chromatin accessibility for allele C compared to allele A, with significant chromosomal interactions observed between this variant and the FN1 TSS.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The SNP rs1344706 was previously identified as a psychosis risk variant associated with the expression of the ZNF804A gene in human brain studies. Its relevance was explored in connection to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder, with findings indicating that this SNP regulated the fetal expression of ZNF804A. As such, alterations in this gene's expression due to this SNP were implicated in the development of these psychiatric disorders.
title: Schizophrenia Risk Proteins ZNF804A and NT5C2 Interact at Synapses

finding: The LPIN1 rs13412852 polymorphism was linked to pediatric nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. The association indicated that genetic variations at this locus could influence the risk and expression of NAFLD in children.
title: Comparative Analysis of Global Hepatic Gene Expression in Adolescents and Adults with Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs13035725 was identified as a risk locus for inflammatory bowel disease and ulcerative colitis. It was significantly associated with expression of several neutrophil-related genes, which implied its potential role in mediating disease risk through neutrophil biology.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs9712275 co-localized with Crohn's disease and demonstrated significant associations with active histone marks as well as being an eQTL for the PLCL1 gene, indicating a possible role in inflammatory responses and receptor signaling.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The rs1250229-T variant in the fibronectin (FN1) gene was associated with a decreased risk of coronary artery disease in familial hypercholesterolaemia, suggesting its protective role in cardiovascular conditions.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs117888248 was identified as the most strongly associated SNP with severe COVID-19. It was shown to have an odds ratio of 1.84, indicating a significant increase in risk for hospitalization, and an increased risk of approximately 109% for requiring mechanical ventilation, demonstrating its critical association with COVID-19 severity.
title: The MERS-CoV receptor gene is among COVID-19 risk factors inherited from Neandertals

finding: The SNP rs744373 was associated with the gene BIN1. This variant showed relevance in a study which suggested that it was related to faster amyloid-beta (Abeta)-associated tau accumulation and cognitive decline in Alzheimer’s disease, demonstrating its potential impact on LOAD pathogenesis.
title: Integrative single-nucleus multi-omics analysis prioritizes candidate cis and trans regulatory networks and their target genes in Alzheimer’s disease brains

finding: The SNP rs6717413 was identified as important in the context of schizophrenia (SCZ) through the DeepGWAS method, which enhanced GWAS results by approximately 3X when applied to the largest European GWAS dataset. The significance of this SNP was underscored by its involvement in a chromatin loop with the KLF7 promoter region, suggesting a role in neuropsychiatric disorders. Furthermore, additional findings from the DeepGWAS process indicated it could be effectively transferred to other disorders, further validating the importance of this SNP in genetic analyses.
title: DeepGWAS: Enhance GWAS Signals for Neuropsychiatric Disorders via Deep Neural Network

finding: The G-allele of rs78349146 at 2q24.2 was associated with increased risk of major depression (MD) in the Hispanic/Latinx group, with an effect allele frequency (EAF) of 0.04. The finding had a beta of 0.15 and a standard error of 0.03, achieving a genome-wide significant P value of 9.32×10^-9. This variant is located downstream of the LINC01806 gene. Additionally, significant colocalisation was observed with eQTL genes DPP4, RBMS1, and TANK.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of major depression aids locus discovery, fine-mapping, gene prioritisation, and causal inference

finding: The SNP rs780094 was associated with diabetes and lipid metabolism, established through the observations in the UK Biobank data, which points to its significance in metabolic traits and pleiotropy.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: rs3754648 was associated with hemifacial microsomia, a condition affecting facial patterning and often related to dental phenotypes. This variant was located intronic to AGAP1, which was found in a human craniofacial superenhancer region. Although AGAP1 itself had not been directly implicated in dental disease, the association of this SNP with a craniofacial enhancer highlighted its potential regulatory role during tooth development.
title: “Integration of multimodal data in the developing tooth reveals candidate dental disease genes”

finding: At the MCM6/LCT locus, the SNP rs4988235 was positively associated with lactase persistence and demonstrated strong selection, increasing in frequency over approximately the past 7,000 years, continuing into modern times. This suggested notable adaptations related to dairy consumption following the transition to farming.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: Selection at the rs12465802 SNP was observed specifically within the WHG background, where it was found to have strong selective pressure over the last 2,000 years, indicating that lactase persistence adaptations varied significantly across different ancestral backgrounds.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The rs780094 SNP was linked to multiple clinical traits and diseases such as LDL cholesterol levels, triglycerides, and coronary artery disease, reflecting its role in metabolic regulation.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: This SNP served as the first top SNP in the genome-wide significant region 2q37.3, associated with smoking interactions. It is an intronic variant in the MLPH gene, contributing to smoking behavior and lung function.
title: Mixed-model admixture mapping identifies smoking-dependent loci of lung function in African Americans

finding: rs2280289 was identified as the second top SNP in locus 2q37.3 and was a missense variant in the RAB17 gene, which had previously been associated with smoking cessation success, highlighting its potential role in smoking-related phenotypes.
title: Mixed-model admixture mapping identifies smoking-dependent loci of lung function in African Americans

finding: The study demonstrated that the non-coding regulatory element carrying the CAD risk SNP rs880890 exhibited high enhancer activity, with the A allele showing 40% more activity than the G allele. The A allele was favored under shear stress, leading to increased expression of CALCRL in endothelial cells. This SNP was found to be associated with both coronary artery disease (CAD) and hypertension.
title: Coronary Artery Disease risk variant dampens the expression of CALCRL by reducing HSF binding to shear stress responsive enhancer in endothelial cells

finding: The variant rs6759626 was part of a set of lead SNPs in high linkage disequilibrium with rs10930089, which overlapped the TSS of a RAMPAGE-verified unannotated transcript expressing in neuronal and cardiac tissues. This indicated its potential functional role in influencing gene expression related to cognitive ability.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: Similar to rs6759626, rs9287826 was noted to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs10930089 and its functional implications were linked to a novel unannotated transcript in neuronal and cardiac cells, suggesting a role in cognitive traits.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: The SNP rs10930089 was an intergenic variant overlapping a TSS of a RAMPAGE-verified unannotated transcript that had high expression signal in SK-N-DZ cells and cardiac tissues. It was included in a set of variants associated with general cognitive abilities and demonstrated high chromatin accessibility in relevant tissues, implicating it in regulatory functions for the associated gene KCNH7.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: The rs1367117 (p.Thr98Ile) variant was identified in the APOB gene, which encodes the main protein component of low-density lipoprotein (LDL). It was associated with various lipid biomarkers in large-scale genome-wide association studies (GWAS) across multiple ancestries and exhibited a potential maternal-specific association with adiposity in family-based studies. This finding was significant in the context of Hispanic ancestry-specific GWAS and highlighted the shortcomings of previous estimations in SuSiE due to LD discrepancies.
title: Robust fine-mapping in the presence of linkage disequilibrium mismatch

finding: The rs1260326 (p.Leu446Pro) variant was identified in the GCKR gene during the fine-mapping of European ancestry-specific GWAS. It was located in a ChromHMM-predicted enhancer in the liver and was part of a promoter-interacting region in HepG2 cell lines. The findings suggested that this variant could regulate glucokinase activity and carbohydrate metabolism in the liver, supporting its causal effect. Previous estimations in SuSiE did not succeed for this locus, underscoring the importance of the RSparsePro method.
title: Robust fine-mapping in the presence of linkage disequilibrium mismatch

finding: A mutation in the ADCY3 gene (rs6545800) was identified in patients with inflammatory bowel diseases, specifically Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis. This finding highlighted a connection between mutations in ADCY genes and autoimmune disorders, providing evidence supporting the role of adenylate cyclase in immune system function.
title: A forskolin-mediated increase in cAMP promotes T helper cell differentiation into the Th1 and Th2 subsets rather than into the Th17 subset

finding: In the study, the SNP rs1402398 showed the strongest association within the French-Canadian epilepsy cohort. This SNP was located in the non-coding region surrounding the genes FANCL and BCL11A, which have previously been linked to epilepsies through association studies. However, the study noted that there was no functional or clinical evidence available to definitively clarify their roles in the disease.
title: Polygenic risk scores of several subtypes of epilepsies in a founder population

finding: The SNP rs4665630 was associated with a genomic region that does not contain any genes known to be associated with epilepsy. Despite this, the study successfully replicated the association for rs4665630, indicating its relevance in the context of the overall analysis of genetic factors contributing to epilepsy.
title: Polygenic risk scores of several subtypes of epilepsies in a founder population

finding: The SNP rs4452212 was identified as a strong candidate for differentiating the Middle Eastern cluster from European clusters. It is an intergenic variant close to UBBP1 and had previously been linked to telomere length variation between Europe and Africa.
title: Exploring ancestry inference of the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs6740960 at the 2p21 locus was found to influence normal-range variation in jaw shape while also being associated with an increased risk of non-syndromic orofacial clefting (nsCL/P). This SNP was shown to reside in a craniofacial enhancer that regulated the expression of the PKDCC gene, which plays a significant role in chondrogenesis and skeletal development. The study provided evidence that the T allele of this SNP was linked to specific facial phenotypes related to jaw protrusion and midface retrusion.
title: A common cis-regulatory variant impacts normal-range and disease-associated human facial shape through regulation of PKDCC during chondrogenesis

finding: This SNP in the CPS1 gene was linked to multiple amino acid and lipid metabolite levels, exhibiting a significant sexual dimorphism, with higher effects observed in females. Twelve associations were significant in females only, highlighting its role in metabolic regulation.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: Associated with 2-hydroxyglutarate through the D2HGDH gene, indicating its potential relevance in metabolic pathways.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: This SNP in ACADL was linked with nonanoylcarnitine metabolite suggesting involvement in fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: As a missense variant in APOB, rs13306206’s minor allele was shown to increase the risk of CAD development. There was a direct correlation between this allele and higher serum TC levels, solidifying its role as a risk factor.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: Located on GCKR, this SNP was linked to smoking cessation, pointing towards its importance in metabolic traits influencing smoking behavior.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs1506537 was associated with an increase in GATA4-DNA binding affinity compared to the reference allele. Functional validation demonstrated that its alternate allele significantly elevated GATA4-dependent transcriptional activity, indicated by a 1.3-fold increase in luciferase activity.
title: Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Disrupt GATA4-DNA Binding and Regulatory Functions

finding: The study established rs117701653 as a common non-coding variant located within the CD28/CTLA4/ICOS locus that contributed to the risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and type 1 diabetes (T1D). The risk allele A reduced binding affinity for the repressive chromatin regulator SMCHD1, which allowed increased expression of ICOS in CD4+ memory T cells. This resulted in a higher frequency of circulating T peripheral helper (Tph) cells and circulating plasmablasts in RA patients. This finding indicated a mechanistic pathway linking the SNP to immune dysregulation in autoimmunity.
title: Non-coding autoimmune risk variant accelerates T peripheral helper cell development via ICOS

finding: The SNP rs1344706 was identified as a psychosis risk variant that is associated with alterations in the expression of the ZNF804A gene in the human brain. This finding was relevant to psychiatric disorders, specifically schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder. The study highlighted that this transcript is regulated during fetal development and indicated a significant relationship between genetic variation at this locus and psychiatric vulnerabilities.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals the complex splicing profile of the psychiatric risk gene CACNA1C in human brain

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with both chromatin accessibility and expression of the <italic>FOXD4L1</italic> gene specifically in neurons, indicating a cell-type-specific mediation effect.
title: Inferring cell-type-specific causal gene regulatory networks during human neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs849563 was identified as having an association with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) susceptibility in an Iranian population. This finding was significant given the context of the Nrp2 locus, which plays critical roles in the development of brain circuits, synapse maturation, and GABAergic interneuron migration, indicating that variations at this SNP may contribute to the risk of ASD, further linking it to the behavioral deficits observed in Nrp2 deficient mice.
title: Reduced Hippocampal Inhibition and Enhanced Autism-Epilepsy Comorbidity in Mice Lacking Neuropilin 2

finding: The risk variant rs6733839 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was found to influence chromatin accessibility at a microglia-specific enhancer for the BIN1 gene. This enhancer's predicted functionality was supported by histone modification signals (H3K27ac) and previous validation experiments. Additionally, the mutation from C to T / C to G was predicted to increase accessibility, likely creating a new transcription factor binding motif for MEF2A or other transcription factors in microglia, potentially enhancing expression levels of the AD-risk gene BIN1.
title: A comparative atlas of single-cell chromatin accessibility in the human brain

finding: The E627* variant (rs35744605) was associated with protection from type 1 diabetes (T1D). This SNP is described as rare, and contributes to a complex interplay in autoinflammatory disease, affecting the functionality of MDA5 in response to viral dsRNA.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The R843H variant (rs3747517) was also associated with protection from T1D. Like E627*, this SNP is common and reflects the genetic complexity in MDA5's role relative to autoimmune diseases.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The I923V variant (rs35667974) demonstrated effects of reduced cellular interferon response to picornavirus infection and was correlated with protection from T1D. It was reported as rare but indicated ATPase hyperactivity, which could influence immune responses.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The T946A variant (rs1990760) resulted in a significant association with the protection from T1D. This common SNP was characterized by an A:T to G:C base pair substitution and was prevalent in different ethnic groups, indicating its relevance in understanding autoimmune disease risk.
title: Molecular basis of autoimmune disease protection by MDA5 variants

finding: The S105N variant (rs774930016) located in the GCKR gene was associated with significantly increased serum triglyceride (TG) levels in a population of Sikhs. This association was robust, showing a beta coefficient of 0.59 and p-value of 7 × 10−4 after adjusting for age, gender, and BMI, and remained significant in multiple cohorts. The study established that this variant explained approximately 38% of hypertriglyceridemia (HTG) genetic variance, highlighting its crucial role in dyslipidemia in this population.
title: Targeted sequencing of candidate genes of dyslipidemia in Punjabi Sikhs: Population-specific rare variants in GCKR promote ectopic fat deposition

finding: The R553W variant (rs755537970) also showed a marginally significant association with triglycerides in the combined samples, with a beta coefficient of 0.51 and p-value of 0.028. This variant contributed to the understanding of genetic variance for HTG in the Sikh population.
title: Targeted sequencing of candidate genes of dyslipidemia in Punjabi Sikhs: Population-specific rare variants in GCKR promote ectopic fat deposition

finding: The previously known variant rs1260326, linked with TG metabolism from Caucasian studies, was confirmed in Sikhs with a beta coefficient of 0.09 and p-value of 3.42 × 10−5. However, this variant explained less than 2% of genetic variance for TG in the Sikh population, contrasting with the substantial influence of the S105N variant.
title: Targeted sequencing of candidate genes of dyslipidemia in Punjabi Sikhs: Population-specific rare variants in GCKR promote ectopic fat deposition

finding: The SNP rs917997 served as both a significant <italic>cis</italic> pQTL and a methylation QTL affecting IL18R1 levels. Moreover, DNA methylation at this locus was causally linked to circulating IL18R1 levels, indicating a bidirectional relationship between methylation and protein expression.
title: Integrative omics approach to identify the molecular architecture of inflammatory protein levels in healthy older adults

finding: The SNP rs3827760 in the EDAR gene showed an extremely high allele frequency of 0.93 and strong positive selection signals among the Han Chinese populations, illustrating its role in local adaptation.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: The rs3087243 variant was associated with eQTL effects for CTLA4, showing the strongest eQTL effect in cytotoxic CD4+ T cells, despite this cell type having low levels of CTLA4 expression. This counterintuitive result highlighted that disease processes, such as those implicated in rheumatoid arthritis, can be driven by low-level gene expression in unexpected cell states.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: The rs11123923 variant was shown to be the lead eQTL for IL18R1, associated with inflammatory bowel disease, demonstrating strong effects in TH2 and TH17 cells but weaker effects in cytotoxic states.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: The SNP rs1250259 was identified as a central missense variant within the CAD associated region and was linked to lower pulse pressure and reduced coronary artery disease (CAD) risk. The study suggested that the protective allele (rs1250259-A) increased the secretion of FN1, providing new insights into the role of FN1 in CAD pathogenesis.
title: A common polymorphism that protects from cardiovascular disease increases fibronectin processing and secretion

finding: The strongest signal of transmission distortion (TD) was found for this SNP at the end of chromosome 2. It was part of a group of 7 SNPs that exhibited a transmission rate of 56.2% based on analysis of sperm sequencing data. This finding correlated well with the binomial expectations under balanced transmission.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: This SNP was included in the strongest signal of transmission distortion at the end of chromosome 2, indicating a significant transmission rate of 56.2%. It was contextually relevant due to its association with a group of SNPs found in closely linked regions.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: Identified as part of the strongest signal of transmission distortion for donor NC18, this SNP contributed to a 56.2% transmission rate. It was linked with several other SNPs in the studied region, showcasing a significant pattern in sperm transmission.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: This SNP was part of the same strongest signal of transmission distortion as others in a cluster at the end of chromosome 2, with a noted transmission rate of 56.2%. Its presence reinforced the findings of biased allele transmission.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: SNP rs2084684 was part of the group exhibiting the strongest transmission distortion signal with a 56.2% transmission rate in the analysis of sperm from donor NC18, highlighting its role in genetic transmission in this study.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: This SNP also contributed to the significant signal of transmission distortion at the end of chromosome 2, alongside a group of other SNPs, presenting a transmission rate of 56.2% in the sperm sequencing analysis.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: Included in the cluster of SNPs that demonstrated the strongest signal of transmission distortion, this SNP accounted for a 56.2% transmission rate, consistent with the findings derived from sperm sequencing data.
title: Strict adherence to Mendel’s First Law across a large sample of human sperm genomes

finding: The variant rs142787485 was identified as highly significant in relation to LDL-C levels, with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.92 indicating it is a likely causal variant located in a conserved region of the 3' UTR of RAB10. The minor allele of this SNP was associated with lower LDL-C levels among carriers, potentially due to its effect on increasing RAB10 transcript stability by disrupting microRNA binding sites. Experimental analysis showed that the expression of a GFP-RAB10 construct with the minor allele resulted in 9% higher protein levels compared to the major allele, emphasizing its role in regulating LDL uptake and cholesterol metabolism.
title: Systematic elucidation of genetic mechanisms underlying cholesterol uptake

finding: The SNP rs13030580 was associated with the metabolic mechanisms related to 5-Aminolevulinic Acid (5-ALA)-induced fluorescence in glioma cells, establishing its relevance in the context of glioblastoma therapeutic strategies that utilize sonodynamic therapy (SDT). This finding underscored the significance of metabolic pathways in the effectiveness of SDT and its potential to induce apoptotic cell death in glioma.
title: Development and Optimisation of in vitro Sonodynamic Therapy for Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs13384965 was associated with an intron variant in the gene CYTIP, which showed up-regulation in T2D islets. This finding was significant as CYTIP was linked to T2D at the genetic level, indicating its potential role in the disease pathogenesis.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes- and obesity-associated human β-cells using deep transfer learning

finding: The lincRNA AC105393.1 variant rs62106258 was found to be pleiotropic for BMI, smoking, and type-2 diabetes, highlighting its potential wide-ranging impact on metabolic traits.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs12478002 was a novel locus with a GWAS association of P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 3.6E-08, mapping to the gene RIMS1 in a TWAS analysis (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 2.1E-08). This finding contributed new insights into genetic associations with bone mineral density.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The rs4442975 variant was linked to breast cancer susceptibility and was located near a transcriptional enhancer affecting the promoter region of IGFBP5, where the g-allele downregulated IGFBP5 expression, thereby increasing breast cancer risk.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs721048 variant was found within the introns of the EHBP1 gene and was linked to enhanced prostate cancer susceptibility through interactions with an active enhancer affecting EHBP1 expression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs13010047 was associated with glioblastoma characteristics, particularly in relation to FGFR1. Findings indicated that variations at this locus linked to higher FGFR1 expression correlated with significantly poorer survival rates in glioblastoma patients, highlighting its role in cancer prognosis.
title: Spatial distribution and functional relevance of FGFR1 and FGFR2 expression for glioblastoma tumor invasion

finding: The common regulatory variant rs560887 was implicated in influencing expression of <italic>G6PC2</italic> splice variants and was associated with glycemic traits such as fasting glucose (FG) and glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c).
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The variant rs146779637 (p.R283X) was reported to influence glycemic traits, particularly through its role as a persistent allelic variant contributing to full-length isoform production in <italic>G6PC2</italic>.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The SNP rs4664308 was found to be associated with an increased risk of idiopathic membranous nephropathy, as established through a meta-analysis of multiple studies.
title: The timing of human adaptation from Neanderthal introgression

finding: The SNP rs3783513 was associated with endometriosis susceptibility through its role in regulating IL1A expression. This association was established using genome-wide association study (GWAS) data and further supported by expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) analyses. The functional studies indicated that manipulation of IL1 signaling significantly influenced epithelial differentiation in the context of endometriosis.
title: M2 Macrophages are Major Mediators of Germline Risk of Endometriosis and Explain Pleiotropy with Comorbid Traits

finding: The SNP rs10167914 was also implicated in endometriosis risk, functioning similarly to rs3783513 by being involved in the regulation of IL1A expression as shown through GWAS data. The identification of these SNPs highlighted the importance of IL1 signaling in endometriosis and suggested a potential therapeutic target for intervention.
title: M2 Macrophages are Major Mediators of Germline Risk of Endometriosis and Explain Pleiotropy with Comorbid Traits

finding: The rs11126300 variant was associated with the CM spanning the CD207 locus in Monocytes. It localized to an intergenic enhancer region affecting the epigenomic landscape and expression of both CD207 and CLEC4F.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The SNP rs10928560 was identified near the gene CXCR4 on chromosome 2 and showed significant association with OSA with a P-value of 2.8 x 10^-8, indicating a potential role of this locus in the genetic risk for OSA.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs13030376 was linked to cancer stem cell dynamics, particularly in the context of tumor relapse, as described in the study by Marzagalli et al. (2021). This finding emphasized the role of cancer stem cells in tumor progression, which is relevant to the mechanisms of breast cancer progression and could indicate a genetic predisposition that affects patient outcomes.
title: PDE4 inhibitor Rolipram represses hedgehog signaling via ubiquitin-mediated proteolysis of GLI transcription factors to regress breast cancer

finding: The CYP27A1 rs4674344 polymorphism was shown to be related to coronary artery disease in a Polish population, indicating its genetic relevance.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The STAT4 rs7574865 variant was shown to be associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus among Egyptian patients, indicating its importance in autoimmune-related diabetes.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs11678116 SNP was associated with migraine and was shown to affect the expression of the LDAH gene. Its presence created a GR binding motif, impacting enhancer activity in a genotype-dependent manner, particularly lowering LDAH expression after cortisol exposure in subjects with the T/T genotype.
title: Glucocorticoids Unmask Silent Non-Coding Genetic Risk Variants for Common Diseases

finding: The SNP rs17321999 at locus 2p23.1 was associated with systemic lupus erythematosus and varicose veins (VVs), indicating a genetic overlap with a P-value of 3.20×10^-14.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins
