finding: The SNP rs9967884 was linked with systemic lupus erythematosus and was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs17321999, showing a connection to varicose veins (VVs) with P-value of 1.40×10^-14.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs3791679, located in an enhancer region of the EFEMP1 gene, replicated the known association with varicose veins (VVs) with a P-value of 1.59×10^-13.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs2861819, located in an intergenic region upstream of PPP3R1, was associated with varicose veins (VVs) with a P-value of 2.65×10^-77.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The study found that the G>A variant of rs10804244 weakened a binding site for the IRF transcription factor. This was determined using the input x gradient method to score the importance of surrounding nucleotides and by scanning the sequence for transcription factor binding motifs.
title: gReLU: A comprehensive framework for DNA sequence modeling and design

finding: The SNP rs955738 was identified as the lead SNP for RVESV with a GWAS P-value of 4.3E-11, indicating a strong association with this phenotype. It was also noted to be linked in equilibrium with the LVESV lead SNP.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The SNP rs2562845 had a significant association with LVESV (GWAS P = 1.3E-23) and was among secondary signals for RVESV, suggesting its relevance in the genetic architecture of cardiac volume traits.
title: Genetic Analysis of Right Heart Structure and Function in 40,000 People

finding: The rs10496099 T>C variant in the EHBP1 gene was associated with decreased hepatic EHBP1 expression and augmented fibrosis in patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). Specifically, individuals carrying the C allele exhibited higher prevalence of steatosis, necroinflammation, and fibrosis, indicating a loss-of-function role of the rs10496099 variant, which was linked to increased NASH progression. Additionally, this association was corroborated in multivariate analyses that adjusted for various factors including sex and BMI.
title: Cholesterol-associated Locus EHBP1 Protects against NASH Fibrosis

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with taurine and hypotaurine metabolism in astrocytes, with a nominal p-value of 5.60×10^-4. The finding suggests that the AD-risk allele of rs10933431 might affect the metabolism of these compounds, which are linked to cognitive functioning.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: Identified in a 23andMe study, rs2042772 exhibited nominal significance for GxS interactions (p=0.037) in MDD and was included as a notable finding.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The peak eSNP rs3769821 was identified as an NK cell-specific eQTL for CASP8, which colocalised with risk loci for several malignancies including breast cancer and non-small cell lung cancer, indicating its relevance in cancer pathogenesis.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The peak eSNP rs1866140 was established as a NK cell-specific eQTL for GNLY, mediating a trans regulatory network that influenced the expression of multiple genes and suggesting its broader immunological implications.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The rs767802807 SNP is a heterozygous missense variant in the GLI2 gene (c.4661C>T; p.P1554L) identified in a family with diabetes. This variant was found to result in altered transcriptional activity of GLI2 and impaired differentiation of iPSCs into pancreatic beta-like cells, thereby implicating GLI2 as a novel variant associated with predisposition to diabetes.
title: Heterozygous missense variant in GLI2 impairs human endocrine pancreas development

finding: Rs62158211 associated with multiple traits related to functional connectivity, highlighting its importance in the regulatory network of brain activity.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Positive selection signals were detected for the non-risk allele of rs11693094 in the ZNF804A gene, with an operational duration of 17,143 years. It demonstrated a strong correlation (ρ = 0.92) with the PFS-26 of ST8SIA2, indicating its involvement in adaptations tied to psychosocial stress across populations.
title: Global adaptive evolution involved in neuroticism and educational behaviors through the spread of anatomically modern humans

finding: The SNP rs1344706 was associated with the expression of the ZNF804A gene in the human brain, indicating alterations linked to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder. This variant was identified as a psychosis risk variant, and its effects were noted to contribute to the understanding of how genetic risk factors manifest in various mental health diagnoses.
title: Deep transcriptome sequencing of subgenual anterior cingulate cortex reveals disorder-specific expression changes in major psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs6430538 was identified as having a significant effect on the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding emerged from integrating multi-omics data, demonstrating its relevance in biological pathways associated with AD pathophysiology, highlighting its potential role as a risk factor for the disease.
title: WIMOAD: Weighted Integration of Multi-Omics data for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) Diagnosis

finding: This SNP was associated with the ASE of BIN1, evidenced by combining data from both genotype-level and allelic expression, pointing towards its role in AD pathophysiology.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs13020261 was linked to the activation of the Unfolded Protein Response (UPR), which has been implicated in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) through its role in cell survival mechanisms. This association suggested that variations at this locus could influence the responsiveness of PDAC cells to combined treatments involving HBP inhibitors and ferroptosis inducers, potentially providing a novel pathway for therapeutic interventions.
title: PGM3 inhibition Shows cooperative Effects With Erastin inducing Pancreatic cancer cell death via activation of the Unfolded Protein Response

finding: The SNP rs1130319, located in the 3' UTR of ADI1, was linked to an unexpected effect where the polyadenylation interruption resulted in 3' UTR shortening due to elevated usage of an alternative proximal poly(A) site. This finding indicated a nuanced role of PAS SNPs in regulating gene expression by influencing 3' UTR length.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: This variant was found to reduce the risk of prostate cancer onset, particularly in Asian populations, and was part of the significant associations identified with prostate cancer risk within the specific chromosomal segment.
title: Archaic Adaptive Introgression in Modern Human Reproductive Genes

finding: The SNP rs6717024 was confirmed as genome-wide significant in the GWAS analysis conducted for diverticulitis. It was noted to replicate findings from previous studies, emphasizing its role in the genetic architecture of diverticular disease.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The SNP rs6736741 was confirmed in the PheWAS analyses as significantly associated with diverticular disease. It was noted for its genetic effect in the MA and EA cohorts.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: SNP rs10928187 displayed significant phenotypic expression with diverticular disease in both MA and EA PheWAS analyses, reinforcing its role in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: SNP rs6734367 was reported as one of the strongest loci associated with diverticular disease, showing increased odds ratios in the recent study compared to previous findings, thereby emphasizing its importance in the genetic predisposition to diverticular diseases.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The SNP rs7596872, located intronically in the EFEMP1 gene on chromosome 2p16.1, was previously reported and was found to be significantly associated with PVWMH in the study.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs72934583, located in an intron of the NBEAL1 gene at 2q33.2, was significantly associated with PVWMH and is characterized as an eQTL for several other genes.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs57242328 was associated with PVWMH, located in an intergenic region at 2p21, and was also noted as an eQTL for the OXER1 gene.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The intronic SNP rs78857879, associated with PVWMH, was linked to the EFEMP1 gene, being one of several previously reported SNPs that were significant for total WMH burden.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs72934505, located intronically in the NBEAL1 gene, was found to be significantly associated with PVWMH in the analysis.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs11679640 was previously associated with total WMH burden and was included in the analysis, with findings relevant for PVWMH.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: At the CALCRL/TFPI locus, rs62172376 was identified as a causal variant linked to the gene-environment interaction with ox-LDL exposure. The study illustrated that this SNP was associated with increased expression of TFPI, but not CALCRL, in human arteries. Ox-LDL exposure demonstrated allele-specific enhancer activity in endothelial cells, reinforcing the role of rs62172376 in coronary artery disease (CAD) risk.
title: Ox-LDL induces a non-inflammatory response enriched for coronary artery disease risk in human endothelial cells

finding: The variant rs840616 was also associated with CAD risks and was marked as a tagged variant linked to rs62172376, which displayed dynamic transcription factor binding changes upon ox-LDL treatment. Despite being in linkage disequilibrium with rs62172376, its specific role in endothelial response to ox-LDL was further supported by its positioning near TF binding sites.
title: Ox-LDL induces a non-inflammatory response enriched for coronary artery disease risk in human endothelial cells

finding: The SNP rs4500960 was associated with reduced educational attainment (EA). It is an intronic variant in the TBR1 gene, which plays a critical role in the differentiation and migration of neurons during development. This finding suggested potential underlying mechanisms linking genetic factors to alcohol use behaviors through their influence on EA.
title: Educational attainment impacts drinking behaviors and risk for alcohol dependence: results from a two-sample Mendelian randomization study with ~780 000 participants

finding: The rs6733839 variant was found to reside within a microglia-specific enhancer approximately 20 kb upstream of the <italic>BIN1</italic> gene. Deletion of this enhancer dramatically reduced <italic>BIN1</italic> expression specifically in microglia, while having no effect on expression in neurons or astrocytes, highlighting the variant's role in microglia-specific regulation in the context of AD.
title: Cell type-specific enhancer-promoter connectivity maps in the human brain and disease risk association

finding: The SNP rs2540334 was associated with basal cell carcinoma risk and shown to be an eQTL for the CASP8 gene, linked to altered IRF6 TF binding, where the risk allele resulted in decreased CASP8 expression and thus enhanced skin cancer risk.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: The SNP rs2349075, also an eQTL for CASP8, had associations with decreased transcriptional activity linked to basal cell carcinoma; it broke an AP-1 motif leading to reduced JUN binding and decreased CASP8 expression.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: The SNP rs966423 was found to have a strong association with the risk of DTCs, showing robust evidence across multiple studies.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs6759952 was mentioned as a germline variant associated with increased risk of DTCs based on findings from GWAS involving diverse populations.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs12990503 demonstrated one of the strongest effect sizes among variants linked to the risk of thyroid and breast cancers, highlighting its potential impact on cancer susceptibility.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs16857609 was included in the list of germline variants correlated with DTCs risk, supporting its relevance in thyroid cancer genetics.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs11693806 was identified as a risk variant for DTCs, contributing to the understanding of genetic predisposition to this cancer type.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs57481445 was identified in a fine-mapping analysis as a novel risk variant for DTCs, demonstrating its potential contribution to understanding thyroid cancer risk.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs3821098 was also classified as a novel risk variant for differentiated thyroid cancers, indicating its significance in the genetic landscape of this malignancy.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs7593114 located on chromosome 2 initially had a non-significant p-value, but after conditioning on rs11887827, its p-value improved significantly to 9.189 x 10^-11. This indicated a strong association after accounting for the influence of rs11887827.
title: BayesRB: a markov chain Monte Carlo-based polygenic genetic risk score algorithm for dichotomous traits

finding: Similar to rs7593114, rs6715049 also had a weak initial p-value but showed a significant drop to 7.188 x 10^-20 after conditioning on rs11887827, highlighting its potential importance in the phenotype once the confounding effect was removed.
title: BayesRB: a markov chain Monte Carlo-based polygenic genetic risk score algorithm for dichotomous traits

finding: rs11887827 was found to have a p-value of 1.701 x 10^-5 prior to any conditioning. Its significant association persisted, and its effect on neighboring SNPs showed how conditioning on it impacted their apparent significance.
title: BayesRB: a markov chain Monte Carlo-based polygenic genetic risk score algorithm for dichotomous traits

finding: The SNP rs10177996 was associated with the WNT10 gene involved in the Wnt signalling cascade, which has been recognized as critical in neurodegenerative diseases including Parkinson's disease. It exhibited a very strong association with a p-value of 2.2 × 10^-16.
title: CluStrat: a structure informed clustering strategy for population stratification

finding: In the longitudinal analysis of the DSST scores, rs6754826, located in an intergenic region on chromosome 2, was associated with a 26.6-point increase in DSST, indicating its positive effect on cognitive speed.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs13010032 was originally associated with social-ecological archetypes related to land degradation in the Nigerian Guinea Savannah, as described in the 2021 study by Adenle and Ifejika Speranza. This study highlighted the relevance of archetype analysis for informing sustainable land management practices. The findings indicated a positive relationship between this SNP and specific socio-ecological variables, suggesting its utility in promoting understanding of ecosystem service delivery in the context of land conservation efforts.
title: Sensitivities in associating land-system archetypes with sustainability metrics: Insights from simulations

finding: The SNP rs4988235 also resided in the LCT region and showed significant enrichment in candidate SNPs due to its high CSS values. This indicates that it was likely influenced by strong selection pressures, which were correlated with its proximity to other selected variants in the region. The strength of the selection signal for rs4988235 was notable, reinforcing its role in adaptation related to dietary changes in certain human populations.
title: A genome-wide Approximate Bayesian Computation approach suggests only limited numbers of soft sweeps in humans over the last 100,000 years

finding: The neuron-specific edit QTL (edQTL) rs56320407 was colocalized with the GWAS locus for educational attainment, indicating a significant association. The T allele was associated with increased RNA-editing and decreased educational attainment, suggesting the possibility that genetic regulation via RNA-editing might affect cognitive function during brain development.
title: Genetics of cell-type-specific post-transcriptional gene regulation during human neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs2232328 was linked to increased G6PC2 expression in human alpha-cells. It was identified in allele-specific expression analyses where the alternate allele (G) correlated with higher fasting glucose levels. This finding demonstrated a significant allelic imbalance favoring the G allele in two European ancestry donors, supporting G6PC2's role in glucagon secretion and glycemic control.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: The SNP rs573225 was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP rs560887 associated with fasting glucose levels. This variant was part of an open chromatin region affecting FOXA binding motifs and altered G6PC2 promoter activity in transfection assays, highlighting its potential functional role in glycemic control.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: The SNP rs560887 was established as a lead variant associated with fasting glucose levels due to its high linkage disequilibrium with rs573225. It was contextualized within the G6PC2 promoter regions that are active in both alpha and beta-cells, emphasizing its importance in glucose regulation.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: The SNP rs2232316 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with the exonic variant rs2232328, and both SNPs were correlated with variations in fasted and fed blood glucose. The involvement of rs2232316 in altering G6PC2 promoter activity suggests a functional role in glucose metabolism.
title: G6PC2 controls glucagon secretion by defining the setpoint for glucose in pancreatic α-cells

finding: The SNP rs387906763 in the STAT1 gene was initially predicted to be benign based on reference annotations. Upon analysis with a custom transcriptome, it was found to result in a start-loss variant which had severe implications for translation. The affected transcript was actively expressed in conditions related to chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis, illustrating its association with immune response deficiencies to C. albicans. The most probable ORF exhibited a nearly perfect coding probability, bolstering the evidence of its pathogenic nature.
title: SUsPECT: A pipeline for variant effect prediction based on custom long-read transcriptomes for improved clinical variant annotation

finding: The SNP rs4663105 was noted for its role in the BIN1 risk haplotype for Alzheimer’s, showing evidence of colocalization with eQTL and specifically driving BIN1 expression in microglia, highlighting its relevance in Alzheimer's pathogenesis.
title: Cell-subtype specific effects of genetic variation in the aging and Alzheimer cortex

finding: The study demonstrated that the GCKR rs1260326 (P446L) variant affected the chronic efficacy of glucokinase activators (GKAs) like AZD1656. Specifically, in the Gckr-P446L mouse model, while blood glucose-lowering efficacy was initially similar between the LL and wild-type genotypes, by 19 weeks, efficacy was maintained in the wild-type but significantly declined in the LL genotype. This decline correlated with increased hepatic glucokinase activity, highlighting the role of GKRP deficiency associated with this variant in diminishing the long-term effectiveness of GKA treatment, in contrast to findings from wild-type mice where such efficacy remained stable.
title: Compromised chronic efficacy of a Glucokinase Activator AZD1656 in mouse models for common human GCKR variants

finding: The PROC SNP rs116169054 was predicted to generate a 35 codons uORF by creating a new upstream AUG in the 5'UTR of the transcript NM_000312.4. Preliminary experimental data suggested that this variant was associated with decreased levels of protein C, a known risk factor for venous thrombosis (VT), indicating its potential role in VT risk.
title: MORFEE: a new tool for detecting and annotating single nucleotide variants creating premature ATG codons from VCF files

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with monocyte counts, further supporting ACKR2's involvement in monocyte regulation.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The rs17561 SNP, associated with the IL-1alpha gene, was found to be linked to the incidence of Tourette syndrome in the studied population. This finding provided insight into the genetic contributors to neuropsychiatric disorders, potentially due to the SNP's influence on inflammation-related pathways.
title: Distinct Th17 effector cytokines differentially promote microglial and blood-brain barrier inflammatory responses during post-infectious encephalitis

finding: The rs315952 SNP, related to the IL-1 RN gene, demonstrated a significant association with Tourette syndrome. This result further underscored the role of interleukin-1 family cytokines in neuropsychiatric sequelae, suggesting a genetic basis for the susceptibility to such disorders.
title: Distinct Th17 effector cytokines differentially promote microglial and blood-brain barrier inflammatory responses during post-infectious encephalitis

finding: The SNP rs4672495 was linked to disease activity in rheumatoid arthritis, suggesting its relevance in the severity or progression of the condition among patients.
title: Structural and mechanistic insights into disease-associated endolysosomal exonucleases PLD3 and PLD4

finding: The lactase persistence allele (rs4988235) was shown to have a strong selection estimate of 8.1% with selection onset around 6,102 years ago, indicating its relevance in lactose metabolism in European populations.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The rs3771180 variant was identified as having undergone positive selection and associated with a lower risk of asthma, correlating with changes in transcription factor binding.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: IL1B allele rs189235692 (A/G) showed significant correlation with phages affiliated to Escherichia and Shigella, implicating its role in inflammatory responses as IL1B encodes the interleukin 1 beta, a key immunological component.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The SNP rs2234675, located in the PAX3 gene, was a significant finding related to cerebellar volume. It was associated with a missense mutation leading to a threonine to lysine change, where each effect allele accounted for a decrease in cerebellar volume of 0.17 SD. PAX3 is known for its role in neural tube and neural crest development.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: Associated with kidney stones and history of gout, indicating its potential role in nephrolithiasis.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: This SNP was associated with atrial fibrillation in the CEP68 locus and displayed moderate linkage disequilibrium with the previously identified variant rs2723064.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: It exhibited the highest posterior probability for atrial fibrillation associated with the cardiac muscle-eQTL for CEP68, indicating a significant role in cardiac trait regulation.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs11688682 was linked to the T2D GWAS signal at the GLI2 locus and showed significant colocalization with caQTL in endothelial cells. This SNP indicated enhanced chromatin interactions with the INHBB gene TSS, highlighting its functional relevance.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The variant rs34075781, found in the MOGS gene (NM_006302: c.1484G>A, p.R495Q), was linked to inborn errors of glycosylation affecting immune system function. This variant was identified as homozygous across all archaic genomes and associated with challenges in glycoprotein processing that could predetermine susceptibility to infections. Its absence in modern humans suggested potential detrimental effects upon exposure to pathogens.
title: Did variants in inborn errors of immunity genes contribute to the extinction of Neanderthals?

finding: The rs12989701 SNP was associated with CTCF binding sites for the BIN1 gene, which is also recognized as a risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was identified as being part of the enhancer regulatory elements for the BIN1 gene, indicating its significance in Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs6431219 SNP was associated with histone modifications for the BIN1 gene, further demonstrating the gene's relevance in AD.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was linked to both histone modifications and promoter flanking regions of the BIN1 gene, making it notable in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with histone modification evidence for BIN1, linking it to the genetic risk factors for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs6733839 SNP was linked to open chromatin regulation for BIN1, crucial for understanding its risk associations for AD.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with open chromatin regulation for the INPP5D gene, further evidencing its role as an AD risk factor.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1260326 was significant in three ancestry cohorts (European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American) for its association with C-reactive protein levels, indicating its relevance across different ancestries.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs780094 was significant in the same three ancestry cohorts (European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American) as rs1260326, suggesting its role in influencing C-reactive protein levels.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs6734238 was statistically significant in three ancestry cohorts (African-American (PAGE), European, and South Asian) and has previously been associated with C-reactive protein levels in other ancestries.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: Lead SNP rs1367228 was associated with facial variation around the eye sockets and upper cheekbones. It showed preferential activity in fetal osteoblast cell lines and MSC-derived chondrocytes, indicating its role in embryonic facial development.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: Lead SNP rs1370926 was associated with multiple facial traits across segments, including the morphology of the nose, upper lip, forehead, and eyes, indicating its broad influence on facial structure.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: The missense variant rs6431625 was found to be significantly associated with direct bilirubin levels in the Korea4K study, showing a very strong association with a p-value of 1.41 x 10^-23. This variant was previously reported to be associated with circulating bilirubin levels, indicating its relevance in phenotypic expression related to bilirubin metabolism.
title: Korea4K: whole genome sequences of 4,157 Koreans with 107 phenotypes derived from extensive health check-ups

finding: The SNP rs4988235, located in the LCT region, was associated with lactase persistence (LP). The analysis highlighted that this polymorphism, along with others in the region, exhibited strong positive selection in Middle Eastern, European, and African populations due to the demographic processes influencing genetic variation.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The SNP rs41525747 was also linked to lactase persistence (LP) as one of the significant polymorphisms in the LCT region. Historical studies indicated that this SNP was maintained in populations due to recent selection pressures, reflecting the trait's adaptive significance in terms of dietary lactose tolerance.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The SNP rs41380347 was identified as a common polymorphism associated with lactase persistence (LP). The presence of this SNP in various populations was associated with adaptation to lactose consumption, showing that it was under strong negative selection prior to recent dietary changes.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The SNP rs869051967 was noted as a common variant within the LCT region tied to lactase persistence (LP). This SNP contributed to the recurrent adaptive evolution in human populations that consumed dairy products, supporting its role in lactase enzyme production.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The SNP rs145946881 was associated with the lactase persistence (LP) trait. Its existence in the LCT region pointed to ongoing positive selection across different global populations, emphasizing the evolutionary benefits derived from dairy consumption.
title: AncestryGrapher toolkit: Python command-line pipelines to visualize global– and local– ancestry inferences from the RFMix2 software

finding: The rs77375846 variant located in the IL18RAP gene was associated with average event desaturation and minimum SpO2 in a multiple-population analysis, showing a combined p-value of 1.57 × 10^-9, confirming previous findings related to sleep-disordered breathing traits.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs847147, positioned 350bp upstream of the HOXD11 promoter, was targeted in the CRISPRi screen. However, potential complications were noted as CRISPRi-induced effects could influence HOXD11 expression regardless of its intrinsic association with rs847147.
title: GWAS-informed data integration and non-coding CRISPRi screen illuminate genetic etiology of bone mineral density

finding: The lactase persistence dominant allele rs4988235/T was found to have a much lower frequency in modern Ashkenazi Jews (MAJ) compared to Europeans (10.0% vs 60.1%). In unrelated Eastern Ashkenazi Jews (EAJ), the T allele frequency was observed at 11.7%, which was similar to the frequency in MAJ, indicating a reduced prevalence of lactase persistence in these populations.
title: Genome-wide data from medieval German Jews show that the Ashkenazi founder event pre-dated the 14th century

finding: There was strong evidence for selection on rs4988235 in the MCM6 gene, with a selection coefficient (s) of 0.0161 and a log likelihood ratio (log LR) of 131.82. This SNP was known to affect the lactase persistence trait in Europeans and was observed to segregate at approximately 72% in the 1000 Genomes Phase 3 reference panel.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs3827760 in the EDAR gene showed evidence of undergoing selection with a selection coefficient (s) estimated at 0.0047. The allele age was calculated to be roughly 45,000 years and is associated with traits such as tooth shape and hair straightness in various populations.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The rs3812718 SNP, located at chr2:166,053,034 and identified as IVS5N+5G>A, was previously associated with epilepsy, seizures, and response to anti-epileptics. However, in this study, the association did not demonstrate genome-wide significance. Prior research indicated that the homozygous variant allele (TT in DNA, AA in cDNA) was linked to reduced utilization of exon 5N in the adult human temporal cortex, but this study did not find a similar relationship in either the prenatal or postnatal prefrontal cortex. Furthermore, this SNP was not identified as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) in GTEx and was not predicted to influence splicing behavior by the SpliceAI algorithm. Despite these results, it's noted that the TT genotype was associated with increased expression of SCN1A in the adult human basal ganglia with statistical significance.
title: Developmental dynamics of voltage-gated sodium channel isoform expression in the human and mouse neocortex

finding: rs3748971 was associated with an increased expression of ALPPL2 with a P-value of 0.002. This finding demonstrated a potential genetic influence on the expression of this gene, which was relevant in the context of lung cancer research.
title: Appraising the causal relevance of DNA methylation for risk of lung cancer

finding: rs878481 was also identified as being associated with increased expression of ALPPL2, showing a statistically significant P-value of 0.0001. Similar to rs3748971, this SNP was crucial in elucidating the genetic mechanisms related to lung cancer.
title: Appraising the causal relevance of DNA methylation for risk of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs58516622 was identified as having a significant effect on EGR1 binding by altering 5 overlapping binding sites. This finding was crucial for understanding how certain noncoding variants influence gene expression and the potential implications for limb malformation processes.
title: Overlapping binding sites underlie TF genomic occupancy

finding: The SNP BIN1-rs6733839 displayed statistically significant replication evidence in the context of LOAD, confirming its previously established association with Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The SNP rs711244 was found to be exonic nonsynonymous and located in exon 1 of AC007382.1. It was associated with visual network-SC, and its p-value was 1.42×10^-12, indicating a strong statistical significance. The gene AC007382.1 had previously been linked to amygdala volume, suggesting its potential relevance to cognitive functions tied to visual processing.
title: Specificity and overlap in the genetic architectures of functional and structural connectivity within cerebral resting-state networks

finding: The SNP rs4988235 (C/T(-13910)) was linked to lactose resistance, where the T allele was very frequent (83%) in chromosome allele 1, while almost absent (<1%) in chromosome allele 2. This finding was part of the validation of the <italic>recombClust</italic> method that revealed two chromosome subpopulations (A/B) in the <italic>LCT</italic> locus, indicating the presence of selection in the allele frequencies.
title: Historical recombination variability contributes to deciphering the genetic basis of phenotypic traits

finding: The SNP rs267607155, which corresponds to the missense mutation Trp976Arg in the titin gene (TTN), was confirmed to cause dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) in humans. This confirmation was significant, as it established a direct link between this missense variant and the disease after previous anecdotal evidence. The mutation was shown to be evolutionary conserved across 35 species, indicating its importance in stabilizing the immunoglobulin domain of titin, thereby impacting cardiomyocyte contraction and contributing to the pathophysiology of DCM.
title: Conserved cysteines in titin sustain the mechanical function of cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs13003198 SNP, positioned approximately 6kb upstream of DGKD, was correlated with increased 24-hour urinary calcium excretion in male stone formers, indicating its influence on CaSR-signal transduction and highlighting its role in nephrolithiasis.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The rs838717 SNP was found to associate with increased 24-hour urinary calcium excretion, reinforcing its role in CaSR signaling and kidney stone disease, especially in male subjects.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs3827760 in EDAR was identified as being under local adaptive forces, with associations related to hair and dental traits particularly common in East Asian populations.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: Located in LCT, rs4988235 was recognized as having been influenced by natural selection due to its relevance in lactose tolerance among certain populations.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The SNP rs4988235 (C/T-13910) showed strong evidence of positive selection associated with adult lactase persistence in Europeans. Direct evidence indicated that this allele was rare or absent in the Neolithic and did not achieve substantial frequency until the Bronze Age, starting around 5000BP. A selection coefficient was estimated at approximately 0.018 using ancient DNA data across Europe.
title: Estimating time-varying selection coefficients from time series data of allele frequencies

finding: The SNP rs28445040 was found to be associated with Crohn's disease (CD) risk. This finding related to SP140 mutations that played a critical immune role in the context of microbiome interaction and inflammatory pathways relevant to IBD.
title: Immune chromatin reader SP140 regulates microbiota and risk for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs6716753 was also determined to correlate with increased risk for Crohn's disease (CD). Similar to rs28445040, this SNP linked back to the SP140 mutations which were significant in maintaining immune homeostasis and preventing dysbiosis in the gut.
title: Immune chromatin reader SP140 regulates microbiota and risk for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The study indicated a potential regulatory mechanism involving miR-181a-5p, which could interact with estrogen receptor signaling pathways. This finding suggested that the expression changes of this miRNA might be influenced by estrogen levels during variations in physiological states, such as estropause, thus highlighting the role of this SNP in modulating transcriptional responses related to liver function and hormonal influence.
title: EXOSOMES FROM CYCLIC MICE MODULATE LIVER TRANSCRIPTOME IN ESTROUPAUSE MICE INDEPENDENT OF AGE

finding: This low-frequency splice donor variant in IFIH1 (C>T) was classified as protective with an odds ratio of 0.63, representing significant interest in regards to T1D.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: Another protective splice donor variant in IFIH1 (C>G) showed an odds ratio of 0.61, further emphasizing the relevance of IFIH1 in T1D.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The missense variant rs231775 (A>G) in CTLA4 was associated with an odds ratio of 1.20, indicating its role in relation to T1D susceptibility.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNV rs3730150 was identified within the GNAQP locus and was marked as a common SNP, implicating potential misalignment issues with the sequencing data related to somatic mutations in NKTCL.
title: Correspondence: Recurrent GNAQ mutation encoding T96S in natural killer/T cell lymphoma

finding: The SNV rs3730153, like rs3730150 and rs3730148, was located within the GNAQP locus, reinforcing the conclusions regarding high frequencies of polymorphic mismatches leading to sequencing errors in somatic variant detection.
title: Correspondence: Recurrent GNAQ mutation encoding T96S in natural killer/T cell lymphoma

finding: The SNP rs79716587:A->G demonstrated a high Grad-CAM score that placed it in the top 0.5% of positions analyzed. It was strongly associated with WBC (p=2.4e-13) and was noted as the top-ranked GWAS SNP in its region, disrupting a RUNX motif while situated within the core promoter of ARHGAP15, which has relevance in neutrophil function regulation in mice.
title: Deep neural networks identify context-specific determinants of transcription factor binding affinity

finding: The SNP rs1464264 was identified as being associated with the expression of the gene ARL4C. Increased levels of histone modification (H3K27ac) at enhancers containing the A allele of this SNP correlated with upregulated ARL4C expression in multiple gastric cancer cell lines as well as in a validation set of primary gastric cancer patients. This relationship suggested that the A allele could potentially enhance the expression of ARL4C, indicating its involvement in gastric cancer susceptibility and outcomes.
title: Integrative Epigenomic and High-Throughput Functional Enhancer Profiling Reveals Determinants of Enhancer Heterogeneity in Gastric Cancer

finding: The rs267608094 variant was identified as a germline nonsense mutation in the MSH6 gene in two patients as part of the BCAC cohort. Like the rs63750451 variant, there was no evidence of dMMR in the tumours of these patients, again indicating that while the variant may be pathogenic, it did not correlate with a high mutation burden in the tumours examined.
title: Activation of Wnt/β-catenin signalling by mutually exclusive FBXW11 and CTNNB1 hotspot mutations drives salivary gland basal cell adenoma

finding: The study identified rs7608180, located downstream of rs9630991, as a variant producing an allele effect (AE) with the reference G allele, with a fold change (FC) of 0.57 and a false discovery rate (FDR) q-value of 0.002, indicating its potential role in modulating gene expression related to SLE.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: The SNP rs1260326 in GCKR increased in significance for both AUD and AUDIT-C after correction for BMI, indicating its key role in alcohol consumption behaviors.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Alcohol Consumption and Use Disorder in Multiple Populations (N = 274,424)

finding: The rs2345457 SNP was associated with open chromatin peaks in the primitive foregut-like epithelial clusters during developmental stages. It was predicted to create potential repressor binding sites affecting transcription regulation, indicating its role in the susceptibility to Barrett's oesophagus.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs1179500, located in the CRIM1 gene, was determined to have a significant p-value of 3.6×10^-17 in relation to the FEV1/FVC ratio. This finding was novel and supported the involvement of the tumor growth factor beta (TGF-β) signaling pathway in lung function and cancer susceptibility.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12466981 was found to be associated with the EML4 gene and had a significant effect on the FEV1/FVC ratio (p=2.7×10^-14). This was noted as a novel finding, linking genetic variants implicated in lung function to those mutated in lung cancer.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs7566315 was identified as having both a metabolite quantitative trait locus (mQTL) effect on N-Acetylaspartate (NAA) concentrations and an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effect on the expression levels of the gene ALMS1. This association indicated that variations in the rs7566315 genotype correlated with changes in both NAA levels and ALMS1 gene expression, thereby establishing a causal link between the gene and its associated metabolite.
title: Untargeted metabolome- and transcriptome-wide association study identifies causal genes modulating metabolite concentrations in urine

finding: The SNP rs13030507 was positively associated with bone metastatic cancer research through its implication in the applications of 3D engineered models and bioprinted scaffolds to replicate the bone-tumor niche. This association highlighted the relevance of this SNP in investigating the genetic factors contributing to tumor interactions within the bone microenvironment.
title: Enhancing Precision in Bioprinting Utilizing Fuzzy Systems

finding: The SNP rs13020170 was linked to the role of the cellular prion protein in promoting stemness and differentiation in cancer, as demonstrated in a study by Ryskalin et al. in 2021. This finding highlighted the molecular mechanisms by which the prion protein was involved in tumorigenesis and cellular behavior, indicating its potential relevance in both prionopathies and cancer.
title: Involvement of the cellular prion protein in seeding and spreading of sarkosyl-derived fractions of Alzheimer’s disease in Prnp mutant mice and in the P301S transgenic tauopathy mice model

finding: A 200-bp inversion at 10q22.2 was shown to be in strong LD (r2=0.953) with rs648078, which, along with other inversions, was associated with atrial fibrillation (P=6×10−27). This finding highlighted the role of the SV in relation to cardiac health.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: The variant rs2867112 was identified as a pleiotropic variant for the causal association between lifetime smoking and waist-hip ratio adjusted for body mass index (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>). This suggests that individuals with this genetic variant may experience a stronger correlation between smoking traits and abdominal adiposity outcomes.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs13030515 was associated with T cell factor 1 (TCF1) expression in CD8+ T cells, which was found to be critical in promoting anti-tumor immunity. Specifically, the study outlined that the presence of this SNP contributed to the efficacy of chemotherapies like CarboTaxol in enhancing the immune response against tumors by expanding stem-like TCF1+CD8+ T cells, which are pivotal for sustaining effective anti-tumor responses.
title: Chemotherapy synergizes with cancer vaccines and expands stem-like TCF1+CD8+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs13020227 was identified in a context where it contributed to predicting therapeutic responses and resistance in colorectal cancer models. The original finding pointed out that this SNP played a significant role in determining how well colorectal cancer models responded to different treatment regimes, including potential resistance mechanisms.
title: Ultrasound-mediated drug diffusion, uptake, and cytotoxicity in glioblastoma 3D tumour sphere model

finding: All individuals with enough coverage for rs4988235 carried the G-allele, which tagged an ancestral haplotype associated with lactose intolerance, suggesting the Niedertiefenbach population could not digest dairy products.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: This SNP was associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) susceptibility, particularly noted in Asian women, indicating that the minor allele increased the risk of PCOS.
title: Unique genetic features of the naked mole-rat’s THADA gene

finding: This SNP was associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS). It was included in studies assessing genetic factors contributing to PCOS.
title: Unique genetic features of the naked mole-rat’s THADA gene

finding: The SNP rs11126784 located at the gene body of DPYSL5 was strongly associated with patterns of neurodevelopment (ND), with a p-value of 2e-54. This association was significantly stronger than its association with neurotypical functioning (N0). Previous reports had already associated this SNP with cortical surface measurements, but the current analyses highlighted a stronger connection to cortico-striatum circuitries, suggesting it played a crucial role in brain microstructure and neuropsychiatric outcomes. DPYSL5, a member of the CRMP family, was linked to axonal growth through various studies.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association studies on the tissue compartments of human brain identify novel loci underpinning brain development and neuropsychiatric outcomes

finding: The ZNF804A rs1344706 polymorphism demonstrated an association with schizophrenia risk in research.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: rs1427407 was linked to HBG2 in trans, previously associated with fetal hemoglobin levels, indicating its role in blood cell regulation and possibly neurological implications related to brain diseases.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs3827760, which encodes a valine to alanine substitution at position 370 of EDAR, displayed clear evidence of positive selection, particularly noted in northern East Asian and Native American populations where its derived allele was present at frequencies up to 90%. Functional studies indicated that the EDAR370A variant increased signaling, which was associated with hair characteristics such as thicker and straighter hair, as well as morphological traits including shoveling of incisors, altered ear and chin shape, and increased density of fingertip sweat glands.
title: Characterisation of a second gain of function EDAR variant, encoding EDAR380R, in East Asia

finding: The SNP rs7422195 was identified as being independently associated with the risk of developing multiple sclerosis (MS). It displayed discordant associations based on the individual's HLA-DRB1*15:01 status, where it conferred increased risk for MS in individuals without the allele, but showed a protective effect in those who were homozygous for HLA-DRB1*15:01. Furthermore, fine-mapping revealed that this SNP operated in trans with the HLA-DRB1 locus, leading to higher expression of MerTK in monocytes of MS patients. This finding highlighted the complex interplay between MerTK expression, phagocytosis, and antigen presentation in the context of MS.
title: Vitamin D regulates MerTK-dependent phagocytosis in human myeloid cells

finding: The SNP rs13020214 was associated with a significant immune response when studied in the context of immune checkpoint inhibitors in B-cell lymphoma. It was noted that this SNP contributed to the efficacy of combined therapies involving PD-1 blockade and the silencing of STAT3, enhancing T-cell activation and overall antitumor effects.
title: Local CpG-Stat3 siRNA treatment improves antitumor effects of immune checkpoint inhibitors

finding: The allele variations of rs2605039 showed significant differences in expression in both cellular contexts, and it acted as an eQTL in the DLPFC, confirming its functional impact.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: SNP rs7582536 was found to exhibit significant allelic differences in expression in both K562 and SH-SY5Y and was identified as an eQTL for specific genes in the DLPFC.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The SNP rs1658810 indicated significant allelic differences in both cell lines and was confirmed as an eQTL for certain genes in the DLPFC, reinforcing its role in gene regulation.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The SNP rs309134 was characterized as an eQTL associated with left ventricular mass (LV mass) found within an intron of the DARS-AS1 gene on Chromosome 2. It displayed substantial effects on gene expression in the left ventricle and aorta.
title: Transcriptional Variabilities in Human hiPSC-derived Cardiomyocytes: All Genes Are Not Equal and Their Robustness May Foretell Donor’s Disease Susceptibility

finding: The study referenced by the SNP rs13030499 discussed the important role of tumor hypoxia as a barrier to effective cancer therapy. It highlighted how microvascular parameters, including density and morphology, significantly influenced hypoxia-related treatment resistance. This aligns with the findings that insufficient vascular density or regularity could decrease the success of photon-based radiation therapy.
title: Microvascular morphology affects radiotherapy outcomes: a computational study

finding: This SNP was associated with whole brainstem volume and had a CADD score indicating deleterious protein effects. It thus supports its relevance in studies regarding genetic underpinnings of brainstem structures.
title: The genetic architecture of human brainstem structures and their involvement in common brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs6422701, with the T allele being overrepresented in the T1D cohort, was significantly associated with decreased PDCD1 mRNA expression in whole blood. This finding indicated that the T allele correlated with significantly decreased PD-1 expression on CD4 Tem and CD4 Temra T cell subsets in both controls and AAb-REL participants, supporting the hypothesis that decreased PD-1 expression on memory T cells may contribute to T1D pathogenesis.
title: Human immune phenotyping reveals accelerated aging in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs13020167 was associated with the regulatory activities of IL-27 in the context of HIV infection. The study highlighted that IL-27 differentiates monocytes into HIV-resistant dendritic cells (DC), leading to a significant inhibitory effect on HIV infection compared to immature DC (iDC). This finding was original as it demonstrated the unique role of IL-27 in modulating the immune response against HIV, distinctly from its effects on macrophages and T cells.
title: Interleukin-27-induced HIV-resistant dendritic cells suppress reveres transcription following virus entry in an SPTBN1, Autophagy, and YB-1 independent manner

finding: The SNP rs117701653 was identified in exhaustive searches for both rheumatoid arthritis and T1D, showing a protective effect and thus was recognized as a significant finding.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs76676160 was identified as having protective effects across multiple diseases, particularly in connection to cellular and molecular pheno types.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: A significant association was identified between the NAT8 SNP (rs13538) and the ratio of N-acetyl-4-Cl-KYN relative to 4-Cl-KYN in plasma. The study indicated an additive effect where individuals with the 'G' allele had higher ratios of these metabolites. The SNP resulted in a non-synonymous variant (Phe143Ser) that altered amino acid interaction in the NAT8 protein, which was suggested to influence substrate metabolism. This finding pointed towards a potential pharmacogenetics application in stratifying patients based on their genetic background.
title: Role of transporters and enzymes in metabolism and distribution of 4 chlorokynurenine and metabolites

finding: The SNP rs182549-T in the lactase gene (LCT) was identified as an example where allele frequencies correlate with phenotype prevalence. It conferred lactase persistence (LP) and exhibited a high frequency in populations of northern and western European ancestry who consume cow’s milk constantly, while it had a low frequency in populations that do not consume cow's milk and are predominantly non-LP.
title: Detection of complex genetic architecture using two-locus population differentiation: modeling epistasis

finding: This novel SNP was found to be associated with the gene AC068490.2, representing a significant discovery for understanding psychiatric genetic risks.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The study reported that the minor allele of SNP rs114518452, which is prevalent in individuals of African descent, resulted in the creation of an NGG PAM sequence that facilitated an off-target site with 3 mismatches for CRISPR editing. It was demonstrated that using a high fidelity SpCas9 variant (R691A, aka HiFi) significantly reduced off-target indels in the heterozygous rs114518452-G/C donor CD34+ HSPCs from 4.8% ± 0.5% to 0.1% ± 0.1%, while on-target editing was maintained at a high level of 82.3% ± 1.6%. This was regarded as a significant finding, supporting the use of 3xNLS-HiFi-SpCas9 in future studies to improve editing precision.
title: Gene editing without ex vivo culture evades genotoxicity in human hematopoietic stem cells

finding: The SNP rs35667974, which led to an isoleucine to valine substitution at position 923 (I923V), was associated with ulcerative colitis (UC) risk with over 95% certainty, thus confirming IFIH1 as the most likely causal gene in the identified IBD risk locus reported from a meta-analysis of GWAS.
title: Functional screen of Inflammatory bowel disease genes reveals key epithelial functions

finding: The SNP rs35337543 was found at the splice donor site position +1 in intron 8 which predicted the skipping of exon 8. This variant was associated with an increased risk to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1% and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.3, and a significant p-value of 0.003.
title: Functional screen of Inflammatory bowel disease genes reveals key epithelial functions

finding: The SNP rs35732034 was located at the splice donor site position +1 in intron 14 and was linked to a predicted skipping of exon 14, resulting in a premature termination and truncation of the C-terminal domain (CTD) that recognizes viral RNA. It had a MAF of 0.8% and an OR of 1.3, along with a p-value of 0.002, supporting its association with increased risk of IBD.
title: Functional screen of Inflammatory bowel disease genes reveals key epithelial functions

finding: The SNP rs13030474 was associated with lipid metabolism variations relevant to oncology, as reported by Matsushita et al. in their analysis of its effects on lipid profiles in cancer research. This finding highlighted the importance of lipid metabolism in the context of tumor biology and treatment strategies.
title: Flexibility of a mammalian lipidome — insights from mouse lipidomics

finding: The majority allele and genotype of rs6436132, located near MIR153-1, were associated with higher ADAS13 scores, indicating a potential impact on cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients. This association was moderated by sex, with females displaying lower ADAS13 scores.
title: Human microRNA-153-3p targets specific neuronal genes and is associated with the risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study indicated a correlation between the SNP rs13010019 and the effectiveness of immunotherapy targeting M-MDSCs in glioblastoma models. It was linked to variations in immune response modulation, particularly how dendrimers were endocytosed by M-MDSCs, impacting the therapeutic delivery in immunocompetent mouse models.
title: Systemically targeting monocytic MDSCs using dendrimers and their cell-level biodistribution kinetics

finding: The SNP rs13032049, related to the gene WDPCP, was linked to various dietary intakes such as fresh fruit, salt, and coffee, in addition to being associated with adiposity, angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, and depression. This indicates a broader influence of the SNP on health outcomes beyond alcohol consumption.
title: Evidence for Involvement of WDPCP Gene in Alcohol Consumption, Lipid Metabolism, and Liver Cirrhosis

finding: The SNP rs2178197, associated with the gene GPN1, was linked to hypertension, hematologic traits, and body impedance. This SNP further demonstrated associations with disorders of lipoprotein metabolism and other lipidaemias, underscoring its potential relevance in metabolic diseases linked to alcohol consumption.
title: Evidence for Involvement of WDPCP Gene in Alcohol Consumption, Lipid Metabolism, and Liver Cirrhosis

finding: At the rs7563201 locus, there was strong evidence for colocalization with expression of ZFP36L2, highlighting its potential role in PCOS pathophysiology. Disruptions in ZFP36L2 were shown to affect oocyte maturation and ovulation, linking this SNP to reproductive health.
title: Colocalization highlights genes in hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis as potentially mediating polycystic ovary syndrome risk

finding: The SNP rs35349669 in the INPP5D gene was found to confer an increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD) with an odds ratio of 1.08. This association suggests that this genetic variant plays a significant role in the pathogenesis of LOAD, particularly in relation to microglial activity and inflammation.
title: INPP5D expression is associated with risk for Alzheimer’s disease and induced by plaque-associated microglia

finding: The intronic SNP rs61068452 in the INPP5D gene was associated with a reduced cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) t-tau/Aβ1-42 ratio, indicating a protective role against late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD) with a significance level of p=1.48E-07. This finding implies that this variant may modulate the pathophysiological processes inherent to AD.
title: INPP5D expression is associated with risk for Alzheimer’s disease and induced by plaque-associated microglia

finding: The SNP rs145777339 was also identified as a low frequency variant significant in the meta-analysis, associated with individuals from the African ancestral group. This finding highlighted its relevance to the varied genetic backgrounds represented in the analyzed cohorts.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The SNP rs13030369 was identified in the context of studying the nexus between PI3K/AKT and estrogen receptor signaling in relation to breast cancer. It was found to play a significant role in mediating estrogen receptor-driven activities, which relate to the mechanisms discussed in the provided context about the interaction of the ASD-risk gene Pten and sex-dependent brain function. This implicates rs13030369 in pathways that could affect hyperexcitability and signaling in female brains, linking it to broader implications in ASD and related behavioral conditions.
title: Female specific dysfunction of sensory neocortical circuits in a mouse model of autism mediated by mGluR5 and Estrogen Receptor α

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with body height and was linked to the gene FXYD6, which is known to be involved in regulating ion transport.
title: pCMLM: Genome Wide Association Study of Body Size Traits in Multiple Regions of Yak Based on the Provided Compressed Mixed Linear Model

finding: The SNP rs13398147, located in the EPHA4 gene, was associated with decreased expression of EPHA4 in esophagus and colon tissues. In an East Asian GWAS cohort comprising 6,449 adolescent IS patients, this variant indicated significant enrichment of common SNPs in EPHA4 in IS patients compared to controls (P=0.023), highlighting a pivotal role of EPHA4 in the pathogenesis of idiopathic scoliosis.
title: Impaired central pattern generators due to abnormal EPHA4 signaling leads to idiopathic scoliosis

finding: Rs10495545 was identified as a cis-eQTL specifically in IAV-infected cells, associated with the long non-coding RNA NRIR, which was induced significantly during IAV infection.
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: The SNP rs12692386 was identified as a lead promoter usage quantitative trait locus (puQTL) affecting the gene ADAM17 (ENSG00000151694). The analysis demonstrated that this variant was significantly associated with shifts in promoter usage as measured by the Cap Analysis of Gene Expression (CAGE) method, which indicated a strong genotype-dependent effect. In contrast, the txrevise analysis did not indicate a significant relationship with promoter usage related to rs12692386 for ADAM17, highlighting a discrepancy between the techniques.
title: Improved detection of genetic effects on promoter usage with augmented transcript annotations

finding: Altered methylation at the BIN1 locus associated with the rs744373 variant was found to relate to the presence of neuritic amyloid plaques and a pathological AD diagnosis. However, this methylation change was independent of the rs744373 variant's effects, indicating an epigenetic influence on AD risk.
title: BIN1 protein isoforms are differentially expressed in astrocytes, neurons, and microglia: neuronal and astrocyte BIN1 implicated in Tau pathology

finding: The SNP rs7561572 was identified as the strongest locus for total area, mapped to the STRN gene, with a beta of -4.13 (EAF: 0.532, p = 1.98 × 10^-18).
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: Association of rs12991836 with ZEB2 was noted, where the transcription start site (TSS) of ZEB2 is located 137 kb from the variant. ZEB2 was recognized for its role in long-range regulation; mutations in ZEB2 relate to Mowat-Wilson syndrome, associated with brain abnormalities and intellectual disability.
title: Unveiling causal regulatory mechanisms through cell-state parallax

finding: The SNP rs13010046, linked to the KEAP1-NRF2 system, was associated with cancer treatment response. The study indicated that alterations in this pathway could impact tumor progression and therapy resistance, highlighting Nrf2's role in stabilizing hybrid E/M cell phenotypes during cancer migration.
title: Nrf2 modulates the hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal phenotype and Notch signaling during collective cancer migration

finding: This SNP was found to be associated in a breast cancer genome-wide association meta-analysis and correlated with rs66686620; it signified a new association in the 2p13.3 region.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: Found in the gene desert of 2p24.3, this SNP was associated with multiple cancers, implicating the MYCN gene in cancer susceptibility.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs13020332 was associated with hormone receptor positive breast cancer, as indicated in the study on CDK4/6 inhibitor treatments. The analysis suggested that this SNP may influence the response to treatments in patients with advanced breast cancer, potentially affecting estrogen signaling pathways.
title: Facilitation drives estrogen receptor positive (ER+) breast cancer growth and survival under drug pressure

finding: The SNP rs58117425 was noted to have a significant association with number of children ever born (NEB) specifically in men. This locus was highlighted as one of two independent signals found in the male GWAS, serving as a key factor in the genetic architecture of NEB.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The female-specific SNP rs7580304 within the PPP3R1 gene was identified as an independent signal for childlessness. Its association underscored the differences in reproductive traits analyzed separately in men and women.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The non-coding SNP rs6542814 in intron 1 of SH3RF3/POSH2 was found to significantly delay the age of onset of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) by approximately 9.2 years in carriers of the PSEN1 G206A mutation, which is sufficient to cause early-onset AD. This SNP was associated with lower expression in fibroblasts, as indicated by Genotype-Tissue Expression Portal (GTEx) data.
title: Reduced SH3RF3 may protect against Alzheimer’s disease by lowering microglial pro-inflammatory responses via modulation of JNK and NFkB signaling

finding: The SNP rs6739165, located in the COL4A3 gene, showed differential activity in SuRE assays based on the allele present, with higher SuRE signal observed in K562 cells homozygous for the C allele compared to those homozygous for the A allele.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: This variant was significantly associated with GGT, total cholesterol, and LDL cholesterol levels in the WDPCP gene, indicating its influence on metabolic phenotypes.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The rs116520905 variant in the DYNC2LI1 locus was significantly associated with A1c, creatinine, and ALT levels, adding new insights into its role in metabolic and renal functions.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: This variant within the DYNC2LI1 gene was linked to ALT levels, contributing to the understanding of this gene's broader implications in ciliopathies and metabolism.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs6431262 exhibited a strong association with inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), with an association signal of 2.023e-12. The study highlighted that this SNP was part of the Group 3 long-range allele-specific footprint observed in GM12878 cells, indicating its role in modulating gene expression related to IBD.
title: GTAGMe-seq: joint profiling of genetic variants, DNA methylation, GpC methyltransferase footprints, and 3D genome in the same DNA molecules

finding: rs573982927 was associated with long sleep duration and was located at MYO3B, previously associated with obesity traits, indicating its relevance to sleep duration.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: rs144874087 was near LINC01935 and associated with the strength of 1-day periodicity, with a p-value of 1.9×10^-8.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: rs181820530 was also near LINC01935 and found to be associated with the strength of 1-day periodicity, having a p-value of 4.5×10^-8.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The study identified rs114518452, a variant with a minor allele frequency of 4.5% in African-ancestry populations, as the top predicted off-target site for gene editing targeting the BCL11A enhancer. The alternative allele (C) resulted in a de novo PTM for SpCas9, increasing potential off-target cleavage, which was validated in edited CD34+ hematopoietic stem/progenitor cells by detecting indels and inversions.
title: Human genetic diversity modifies therapeutic gene editing off-target potential

finding: The SNP rs1420101, which is a strong eQTL and pQTL for IL-1RL1, was demonstrated to associate with heightened IL-33-induced transcriptional responses in Th2 cells from asthma patients. The presence of the T allele of rs1420101 correlated with lower serum IL-1RL1-a levels and increased blood eosinophil counts, suggesting its role in heightened sensitivity to IL-33 in asthmatic conditions.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: The non-synonymous coding SNP rs4988956 was part of the defined asthma risk haplotype impacting IL-33 mediated signaling. Carriers of this SNP exhibited an augmented gene transcription response to IL-33, establishing an additive effect when combined with asthma status, reflecting its role in facilitating IL-33 responsiveness in Th2 cells.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: Alongside rs4988956, the SNP rs10192036 was implicated in the asthma risk haplotype influencing Th2 cells' responses to IL-33. This SNP, being in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs4988956, contributed to the non-synonymous coding alterations in the IL-1RL1 receptor, enhancing signaling capabilities in Th2 cell activation.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: SNP rs10192157, also part of the risk haplotype, played a significant role in modifying the Th2 cell reaction to IL-33. The presence of this SNP resulted in increased signaling through the IL-1RL1 receptor, suggesting its involvement in the potentiation of IL-33-driven gene expression in asthma patients.
title: IL-33 induced gene expression in activated Th2 effector cells is dependent on IL-1RL1 haplotype and disease status

finding: The exonic polymorphism rs315952 (Ser133Ser) in IL1RN was related to overweight and obesity in individuals with hypertension, illustrating its role in metabolic and cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: Association of the rs780094 polymorphism of glucokinase regulatory protein was established with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, signifying its potential role as a genetic factor influencing NAFLD.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data
