finding: This SNP was identified in the 2p13.3 region as a novel finding associated with cancer risk. It was over 1 Mb from previously identified risk loci and exhibited a distinct association pattern across cancers.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs560887 was found to be significantly associated with elevated fasting plasma glucose and increased insulin release after oral and intravenous glucose loads. This finding highlighted a genetic effect on the combination of insulin traits, as the univariate tests showed no significant p-values for related phenotypes.
title: JASS: Command Line and Web interface for the joint analysis of GWAS results

finding: The minor allele frequency for rs1109037 was 0.4963, making it one of the SNPs with the highest frequency in the study, reflecting its relevance in the population.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The strongly selected coding variant of EDAR (EDARV370A, rs3827760) was reported to have pleiotropic effects on EDA-dependent ectodermal appendage traits, explicitly including effects on mammary gland branching. This indicated that variations at this SNP were evolutionarily significant and contributed to phenotypic differences related to mammary gland traits among modern human populations.
title: Ectodysplasin signaling via Xedar is required for mammary gland morphogenesis

finding: The rs1379621278 SNP was identified as critical for antigen binding in the context of IL1β:gevokizumab complex, which supports its role in therapeutic strategies targeting IL1β activity.
title: CytoSIP: An annotated structural atlas for interactions involving cytokine or cytokine receptor

finding: In the context of ankylosing spondylitis, rs6759298 exhibited the most significant expression-modulating effect at its locus in stimulated T cells, which positioned this SNP as a likely causal variant affecting the disease biology.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: This SNP was identified in a large-scale meta-analysis as an eQTL for ZEB2 in skeletal muscle, reclassifying it to Tier 1 from its previous annotation.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs2013278 was investigated in the context of multiple immunological traits, particularly associated with the costimulatory receptor CD28. It was found to regulate the production of non-functional splicing isoforms, suggesting a role in immune response modulation. This finding highlighted the importance of this SNP in understanding the genetic risk factors related to immune and inflammatory diseases.
title: Alternative paths to immune activation: the role of costimulatory risk genes for polygenic inflammatory disease in T helper cells

finding: The SNP rs4988235 in the lactase gene (LCT) was found to be associated with body mass index (BMI) in European-ancestry populations. However, the associations with height and low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol were confirmed to be false positives after adjustment for both genome-wide and locus-specific ancestry. This indicated that previous notions of the association of rs4988235 with height and LDL were likely spurious, primarily due to uncorrected stratification effects in genetic studies.
title: Unappreciated Subcontinental Admixture in Europeans and European Americans: Implications for Genetic Epidemiology Studies

finding: SNP rs3771501 was associated with decreased expression of the gene TGFA in PBS-treated chondrocytes. This variant colocalized with an All OA GWAS signal, suggesting its significant role in OA risk.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: SNP rs3755381 was identified as an eQTL for PAPPA in both PBS and FN-f conditions. Its association with the Total Hip Replacement GWAS signal corroborated its role in OA.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The rs922452 SNP was identified in the EDAR gene on chromosome 2, which showed strong signals of natural selection. It was associated with physical traits such as hair straightness and skin tone in East Asians. The significant selective pressure represented by this SNP indicated its relevance to adaptation among the Bouyei population.
title: Malaria resistance-related biological adaptation and complex evolutionary footprints of Tai-Kadai people inferred from 796 genomes

finding: The rs780094 polymorphism was found to be associated with elevated fasting serum triacylglycerol levels, reduced fasting and OGTT-related insulinaemia, and a reduced risk of type 2 diabetes. This finding was significant as it related to metabolic dysfunctions in the context of type 2 diabetes.
title: A haplotype-resolved genome assembly of the Nile rat facilitates exploration of the genetic basis of diabetes

finding: The variant rs72844419 (2_85501572_A_T) was identified as an eQTL for MAT2A, exhibiting a sub-cell-type effect that was in the opposite direction compared to that of rs2072449, indicating a nuanced regulatory role at single-cell resolution.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The variant rs7559150 (2_200889340_T_C) was recognized for reducing NIF3L1 expression in memory T cells after stimulation, positioned within a dual promoter. It was predicted to have a negative effect during CD4 T cell activation, particularly more pronounced in non-activated T cells and showing a bivalent effect during T cell development.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The variant rs7562391 (2_200871443_A_C) was located 17,635 bp from the TSS of PPIL3. It was identified to negatively impact expression in T cells with notable effects in the activation phase, correlating with the disruption of HOX binding motifs and an enhancement of FOXP1 binding. These findings indicated a complex interaction involving transcription factors during T cell development.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The SNP rs10153620 was associated with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). The chromatin loop analysis predicted the target neuronal gene NRP2, which is related to known brain functions, while brain eQTLs predicted the gene PARD3B, which had unclear brain functions. This case highlighted how chromatin loops were more effective in identifying functionally relevant genes compared to eQTL predictions.
title: Robust Hi-C chromatin loop maps in human neurogenesis and brain tissues at high-resolution

finding: In the analysis of the intronic region of MEIS1, rs113851554 was found to have a strong association with restless legs syndrome (RLS) as demonstrated in a metaGWAS study, where it exhibited a highly significant p-value of 1.1 × 10^-180 and an odds ratio of 2. This indicated the potential role of this intronic variant in influencing sleep-related phenotypes, particularly in the context of RLS. The findings suggested that this noncoding region plays a prominent regulatory role in the expression of MEIS1, which may be crucial for the pathogenesis of insomnia and RLS.
title: Intronic elements associated with insomnia and restless legs syndrome exhibit cell type-specific epigenetic features contributing to MEIS1 regulation

finding: The SNP rs35744605 in IFIH1 was recognized as a notable variant linked to Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) risk. This SNP was part of ongoing explorations into rare genetic variants that contribute to the pathogenesis of T1D and demonstrated the potential importance of specific genetic markers in the regulation of disease pathways.
title: Use of Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells to Build Isogenic Systems and Investigate Type 1 Diabetes

finding: In this study, rs13025717 was confirmed to disrupt binding of the transcription factor KLF4 and was associated with decreased expression of the AD risk gene BIN1 after targeted excision in SH-SY5Y cells.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The SNP rs1509820 was associated with the metabolite L-citrulline, showing a very strong association with a p-value of 1 × 10^-25. This finding highlighted the role of CPS1 in the urea cycle, indicating a biologically relevant relationship that was characterized by an SRD value of 1, although it did not reach the stringent p-value cut-offs of the TK study.
title: Gene-metabolite annotation with shortest reactional distance enhances metabolite genome-wide association studies results

finding: The SNP rs975530777 also exhibited a strong association with L-citrulline with a p-value of 1 × 10^-14. Similar to rs1509820, this finding underlined the connection between CPS1 and L-citrulline, confirming the biological significance of the gene-metabolite interaction, despite not being significant in the TK study.
title: Gene-metabolite annotation with shortest reactional distance enhances metabolite genome-wide association studies results

finding: The C allele of rs3771239 was found to enhance SDC1 expression and local chromatin accessibility, indicating its role as a causal eQTL variant regulating gene expression and potentially influencing osteoarthritis.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The G allele of rs12471240 was associated with higher NGEF expression and increased chromatin accessibility, suggesting a regulatory role in gene expression relevant to osteoarthritis.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The study identified rs6733839 as a genome-wide significant AD variant associated with BIN1, a well-established risk gene for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This variant was noted to enhance microglia-specific activity, linking it crucially to AD pathobiology.
title: Multimodal single-cell/nucleus RNA-sequencing data analysis uncovers molecular networks between disease-associated microglia and astrocytes with implications for drug repurposing in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Functional evidence indicated that rs13385499 was validated in STARR-seq at all time points and was associated with diminished p65 binding and transcript expression levels of LDAH in HAECs, confirming its role in Aortic Aneurysm.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: The SNP rs13382862 was validated in STARR-seq and associated with multiple motif mutations impacting p65 binding and expression of LDAH in HAECs, supporting its functional relevance in relation to Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: rs11682175 was identified as a top fine-mapped SNP at rs75575209 and rs7596038 independent schizophrenia-associated loci. It was significantly associated with major depression, neuroticism, and schizophrenia. Despite having high posterior inclusion probabilities (PIPs) in both loci (0.999 and 0.864), it did not intersect with any open chromatin regions (OCRs) in the studied cell populations.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: This lead SNP in a composite locus achieved a high PIP and intersected with OCRs from numerous schizophrenia-enriched cell populations, indicating a strong potential link to the disease mechanism.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: As a prime candidate located in the promoter of NGEF, rs181813160 intersected with numerous OCRs and was predicted to disrupt transcription factor binding sites, linking it to synaptic dysfunctions seen in schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: The rs3738919 SNP, specifically the C allele, was associated with rheumatoid arthritis in the European Caucasian population. This finding was relevant in the context of studying pathotypes in early rheumatoid arthritis patients, which highlighted the interaction of genetic factors with disease susceptibility and response to treatment.
title: Harnessing gene-gene interactions via an RNA-Sequencing network analysis framework improves precision medicine prediction in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs7561317 was associated with CpG site cg06162668, linked to obesity and metabolic diseases, illustrating the genetic contributions to complex traits through meQTLs.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The variant rs2042477 was found in association with the KCNIP3 gene during rare variant burden testing, supporting its potential as a contributor to PD risk.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The nonsense mutation rs63750245 in the MSH2 gene was shown to cause microsatellite instability (MSI), which is recognized as a diagnostic biomarker for Lynch syndrome. This mutation contributed to the defective base mismatch repair machinery characteristic of this genetic disorder.
title: MecCog: A knowledge representation framework for genetic disease mechanism

finding: The SNP rs72823641 was recognized as the most significant SNP associated with the combined phenotype of asthma and/or hay fever and/or eczema, situated within IL1RL1 and previously linked with allergic diseases.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SERPINE2 locus featured rs6722871, which had a meta-P-value of 1.19 × 10-59. This SNP was confirmed to have associations with the cytokine network in the multivariate GWAS and was previously linked to multiple immune-related traits.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs13010134 was positively associated with the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibitors, as it was shown to be linked to key immune pathways like antigen processing and presentation. The finding indicated that individuals with specific genotypes of this SNP exhibited altered immunotherapy responses, suggesting that it could serve as a potential biomarker for predicting therapeutic outcomes in melanoma patients.
title: Unveiling the Gut Microbiome Network Fingerprint: A Deep Learning Approach to Predict Immunotherapy Response in Melanoma Patients

finding: The SNP rs1427407 was identified as impacting fetal hemoglobin (HbF) levels and was located within a DNAse hypersensitivity site (DHS) +62 relative to the TSS of the BCL11A gene. Its functional relevance was validated through genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and further experimental work using CRISPR-Cas9 technology.
title: CRISPR-Decryptr reveals cis-regulatory elements from noncoding perturbation screens

finding: The SNP rs7606173 was also found to influence fetal hemoglobin (HbF) levels, situated within a DHS +55 from the BCL11A gene's transcription start site (TSS). Like rs1427407, this SNP's effects were confirmed through GWAS and therapeutic interventions involving CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing.
title: CRISPR-Decryptr reveals cis-regulatory elements from noncoding perturbation screens

finding: This SNP was identified as a proxy to the SLE sentinel SNP rs11889341 and was shown to reside in a TFH open chromatin region, physically interacting with the STAT4 promoter from approximately 99 kb away.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: As a sentinel SNP for SLE, rs11889341's associated variant rs35593987 was confirmed to loop to interact with the STAT4 promoter, indicating its relevance in SLE pathogenesis.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Relating to SLE, this SNP is a proxy for rs11889341 and is involved in the interaction with the STAT4 promoter, illustrating its involvement in autoreactivity in SLE.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs34043159 was associated with sporadic Alzheimer's disease in the southern Han Chinese population, suggesting a potential role in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The autoimmune disease-associated SNP rs917997 of IL18RAP was shown to control IFN-γ production by peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC), highlighting its significance in immune response regulation.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The derived T allele of the rs182549 variant, associated with lactase persistence (LP), was estimated to be 688 generations old, translating to approximately 14,000 to 21,000 years ago. This SNP has a frequency of around 50% in European populations and was part of a haplotype linked to LP, with high confidence in age estimates from both the 1000 Genomes Project and Simons Genetic Diversity Project.
title: Dating genomic variants and shared ancestry in population-scale sequencing data

finding: The derived A allele of the rs4988235 variant, also strongly associated with lactase persistence, was estimated to be 693 generations old, approximately equaling 14,000 to 21,000 years ago. This variant is in near-perfect association with rs182549, and both variants were noted for having been rare prior to the adoption of dairy farming in Europe.
title: Dating genomic variants and shared ancestry in population-scale sequencing data

finding: The variant rs3827760, which causes the Val370Ala substitution in the EDAR gene related to sweat and morphological traits, was estimated to be 1,456 generations old, or approximately 29,000 to 44,000 years ago. High frequencies of the derived G allele were found in East Asian populations, with evidence suggesting a rapid rise in its frequency followed by strong positive selection.
title: Dating genomic variants and shared ancestry in population-scale sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs10210899 displayed allelic heterogeneity due to sex, similar to rs12740374, with a strong association observed in female cohorts for LDL cholesterol.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs4245791 exhibited joint heterogeneity driven by combined sex and body mass index (BMI), showing a nuanced interaction affecting LDL cholesterol.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs11884143 was associated with LDL cholesterol and demonstrated heterogeneity due to both ancestry and environmental effects, particularly urban status.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs1712248 was also noted for exhibiting ancestry-driven heterogeneity in the analysis of LDL cholesterol.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs13010134 was associated with cancer immunotherapy response, specifically related to the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICB). This finding was detailed in the study by Mpakali and Stratikos (2021), which highlighted the significance of antigen processing and presentation mechanisms in influencing the therapeutic outcomes of such treatments. In the context of melanoma, the presence of this SNP likely impacted the immune system's ability to recognize and combat tumor cells, thereby affecting the overall efficacy of immunotherapy.
title: Craters on the melanoma surface facilitate tumor-immune interactions and demonstrate pathologic response to checkpoint blockade in humans

finding: The SNP rs13030569 was investigated in relation to the MCT1 inhibitor AZD3965, showing preclinical safety which supports its potential application in treating breast cancer.
title: ME3BP-7 is a targeted cytotoxic agent that rapidly kills pancreatic cancer cells expressing high levels of monocarboxylate transporter MCT1

finding: The rs59335482 variant, an insertion allele, was associated with a higher risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was shown to increase transcriptional activity in luciferase assays conducted in HEK cells and SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells. Moreover, this SNP was linked to an increase in BIN1 mRNA expression in the brain.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factor BIN1 induces isoform-dependent neurotoxicity through early endosome defects

finding: The SNP rs7579014, identified as the top eQTL for the HiChIP target gene BCL11A, was located at the 2p16.1 risk locus. This finding provided further evidence supporting the association of this variant with the regulation of BCL11A in the context of endometrial cancer.
title: Analysis of promoter-associated chromatin interactions reveals biologically relevant candidate target genes at endometrial cancer risk loci

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of CCL20, a chemokine involved in attracting lymphocytes, and regulated the activity of a nearby enhancer. The functional impact was observed specifically in Tregs, underscoring its role in Treg-specific modulation.
title: Immune disease variants modulate gene expression in regulatory CD4+ T cells and inform drug targets

finding: The SNP rs13385731 was linked to increased expression of RASGRP3 in plasmacytoid dendritic cells (pDCs) among patients with the SLE risk allele. This connection was made clear through its identification as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) related to SLE.
title: Autotaxin may play a Critical Role between the Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of SLE in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: Showed a strong maternal association with standing height (maternal p-value = 5.5e-10) and is part of DNMT3A, a gene implicated in imprinting, suggesting a biological link between imprinting and height phenotypes.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs13425622 was identified as an eQTL that significantly impacted the expression levels of the gene MARCO in the studied populations. The finding indicated that all Korowai individuals in the dataset were fixed for the minor G allele, which was associated with lower expression of MARCO. In contrast, the majority of individuals from Mentawai and Sumba were found to be at least heterozygotes for the major T allele, which correlated with higher MARCO expression. This result was significant, with a p-value of 3.10 x 10^-14.
title: The whole blood microbiome of Indonesians reveals that environmental differences shape immune gene expression signatures

finding: The rs7596259 variant was noted as a sc-caQTL that increased accessibility of its residing master region and was associated with enhanced accessibility of three dependent regions in Rod. This variant also acted as a sc-eQTL for ITGA6 in Rod.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: This SNP was included in the FDA5 PRS and is downstream of the gene HPCAL1, associated with type 2 diabetes. Its presence correlated with significant findings related to weight gain in children.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: rs970797 was associated with nose (p = 2.15 × 10^-12) and eyes (p = 1.72 × 10^-8), indicating its role in controlling these facial features. Specifically, T alleles were related to a smaller and flatter nasal root, while also affecting the overall stereoscopic quality of the face.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: The study highlighted that the Gly972Arg polymorphism (also referred to as rs1801278) in the IRS1 gene was significantly associated with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in the subjects studied. Specifically, it was found that the Arg/Arg genotype frequency was higher in OSA and NAFLD subjects, and those with the Gly/Arg genotype exhibited higher risk factors including increased body mass index and fasting insulin levels.
title: Association of IRS1 (Gly972Arg) and IRS2 (Gly1057Asp) genes polymorphisms with OSA and NAFLD in Asian Indians

finding: The missense variant rs3754644 in IQCA1 was identified as associated with episodic memory, linking it to cognitive decay pathways found in Alzheimer’s study contexts.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The interaction involving rs77807661 and APOE variants indicated notable implications for processing speed.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs7578199 was found in the HDLBP gene, associated with chronic lymphoblastic leukemia. Like rs45461499, it was recognized as a clinically relevant genetic risk locus and demonstrated the presence of protein-RNA interaction sites, suggesting its significance in the pathology of leukemia.
title: Transcriptome-wide high-throughput mapping of protein-RNA occupancy profiles using POP-seq

finding: The SNP IL18R1:rs759382 was identified as both a bulk eQTL and an immune-mediated eQTL in the context of coeliac disease (CeD). It was previously reported as a blood eQTL. Although IL18R itself was not differentially expressed, its ligand IL18 was downregulated in untreated CeD samples (UCD). This downregulation is significant because IL18R and IL18 play critical roles in maintaining inflammation within the disease framework and are also involved in epithelial barrier function, highlighting the importance of genetic associations in mediating inflammatory responses in CeD.
title: Gene expression and eQTL analysis reflect the heterogeneity in the inflammatory status of the duodenal epithelial lining in coeliac disease

finding: The STAT4 gene variant rs7574865 was studied by Abdelmajed et al. in 2021 for its association with type 1 diabetes mellitus among Egyptian patients.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: A novel SNP, rs58194899 located in the TSSC1/EIPR1 gene, reached genome-wide significance concerning PSQ scores, indicating its relevance to altered pain sensitivity. This SNP had not been previously documented in ClinVar or GWAS databases.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: The CAD protective T allele of rs1250258, found to be strongly linked (R2 = 0.99) to rs1250259-A, was associated with increased circulating levels of FN1 and its fragments, suggesting it plays a cardioprotective role.
title: A common polymorphism that protects from cardiovascular disease increases fibronectin processing and secretion

finding: The SNP rs1058261 in the desmin gene was suggested to provide protection against combined cancer and cardiovascular death in a population study, indicating a protective genetic influence.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs1047891 SNP near the CPS1 gene was specified as having a stronger effect in females for cardiovascular diseases, suggesting a role in T2D susceptibility among different sexes.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: At the SIX3 locus, this SNP was linked to T2D risk with the variant associated with altered expression of SIX3 and higher fasting glucose levels.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The LHCGR gene variant rs2293275 had an effect on the clinical and biochemical profiles in patients with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating its potential influence on reproductive health.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The indel rs201654520, within the CACNB4 gene, was associated with a nearly twenty-fold increase in risk for cardiovascular disease (MAF=0.017, OR [CI 95%] = 19.0 [5.5 - 65.8], p = 4.3 × 10−8). This finding highlighted the variant's significant impact when analyzed using a recessive model, as higher sample sizes were required for detection under an additive model.
title: The impact of non-additive genetic associations on age-related complex diseases

finding: The rs4988235 SNP, which is associated with lactase persistence, showed significant increases in allele frequency in Scandinavia during the Iron Age and Viking Age, contrasting with its lower frequencies during the Bronze Age. The finding highlighted that this rise was linked to the dietary habits of Viking Age Scandinavians, who consumed various dairy products regularly, showcasing a direct correlation between lifestyle and the prevalence of this genetic trait.
title: Population genomics of the Viking world

finding: The SNP rs10173412 was an intronic variant of RBMS1 identified as a lead variant associated with lymphocyte counts in a multi-ancestry GWAS study. It was part of the primary credible set of RBMS1 eQTLs, indicating a potential regulatory link between this variant and the expression of the RBMS1 gene. This variant had a higher minor allele frequency (MAF) in African ancestry populations compared to European ancestry populations, with frequencies of 20.8% and 32.4%, respectively, suggesting its greater relevance in African demographics.
title: Gene Expression and Splicing QTL Analysis of Blood Cells in African American Participants from the Jackson Heart Study

finding: The intergenic SNP rs7556897 was found to modify the association between obesity and blood pressure in children but also indicated its broader implications in metabolic dysregulation.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs17771664 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus for the gene LANCL1, which was associated with the phenotype 'Number of Pain Sites.' It was located within a peak shared by dorsal horn neuron subtypes Exc-TAC3, Exc-SKOR2, and Exc-MAF. This SNP was considered among the most significant in its linkage disequilibrium block and belonged to a credible set of potentially causal SNPs as assessed by Bayesian fine-mapping.
title: Spatial, transcriptomic and epigenomic analyses link dorsal horn neurons to chronic pain genetic predisposition

finding: The rs1980422 SNP, located in the CD28 gene, was associated with seropositivity in rheumatoid arthritis patients in the study conducted by Vernerova et al. This finding indicates that the genetic variation at this locus may influence the immune response in RA, potentially impacting treatment strategies.
title: Utilizing a PTPN22 gene signature to predict response to targeted therapies in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs1968676 in SMPD4 exhibited lower expression in AUD subjects, yet higher expression post-ethanol exposure, indicating that this SNP was responsive to ethanol treatment, revealing a complex interaction between AUD and environmental factors.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: The SNP rs6546698 also served as a QTL impacting chromatin accessibility, along with H3K27ac, H3K4me1, and methylation. This suggested a coordinated role in regulating the epigenetic landscape associated with immune responses between individuals.
title: Epigenetic variation impacts ancestry-associated differences in the transcriptional response to influenza infection

finding: The SNP rs2113417 was found to associate with the methylation level of a 710-bp region near the KCNIP3 gene. The study reported an even stronger allele-specific chromatin accessibility in this region. Notably, of the three mQTLs associated with rs2113417, only the CpG site cg03595348 was located within the same DMR, highlighting its relevance in the context of prostate cancer epigenetics.
title: Fine Mapping Regulatory Variants by Characterizing Native CpG Methylation with Nanopore Long-Read Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs17396537 was found to be associated with in vivo chromatin accessibility in human islets. Islet donors with the GG genotype exhibited higher chromatin accessibility compared to those with GC or CC genotypes, and the G allele showed significantly higher MPRA activity than the C allele.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs13405776 was confirmed through MPRA to have relevant transcriptional modulation effects in the context of T2D.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs13026123 demonstrated significant transcriptional modulation in the MPRA assays, indicating its potential as a causal variant.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs2943656 was confirmed to have significant MPRA activity effects, reinforcing its association with T2D through regulatory effects.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs7571816 located in the DIS3L2 gene was found to be significantly associated with body height. This finding was documented in the GWAS catalog and indicated a reliable link to the phenotype of maternal height.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The missense mutation rs782572 in PNPT1 was associated with methylation levels at mt-RNR2 (position 2617), indicating a link of this gene to RNA modification processes in mitochondria.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The intronic SNP rs11684695, associated with transcript methylation levels in whole blood through the expression of TRMT61B, showed significant replication. TRMT61B is a mitochondrial methyltransferase responsible for methylation at position 2617 in mt-RNR2.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The SNP rs7589861 located in the EPAS1 gene exhibited high genetic differentiation between the Salar/Tu populations and southern East Asian ancestral groups, indicating adaptation to environmental stress related to hypoxia.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of ethnolinguistic diverse northwestern Chinese Hexi Corridor people from the 10K_CPGDP project suggested the differentiated East-West genetic admixture along the Silk Road and their biological adaptations

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs13420272 found in the EPAS1 gene revealed high levels of genetic differentiation in the context of adaptation to climatic factors among the Salar/Tu populations.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of ethnolinguistic diverse northwestern Chinese Hexi Corridor people from the 10K_CPGDP project suggested the differentiated East-West genetic admixture along the Silk Road and their biological adaptations

finding: The SNP rs3769823 was identified as a multi-cancer-associated functional variant located within a multi-cell-type cCRE associated with the CASP8 gene. It was shown to affect CASP8 protein activity, influencing apoptosis and proliferation in lung cancer cells, suggesting its crucial role in lung cancer pathogenesis and potential regulatory mechanisms specific to lung-related cell types.
title: Context-aware single-cell multiome approach identified cell-type specific lung cancer susceptibility genes

finding: The SNP rs6714660, tagged to the gene AGAP1, was identified as being involved in cardiac ATP production in the Krebs cycle. It showed a significant association with cardiac ATP metabolism scores, indicating that variations at this locus might influence myocardial function which is critical for proper cardiac operation.
title: Monopogen: single nucleotide variant calling from single cell sequencing

finding: The SNP rs146074994 was associated with increased systolic blood pressure, indicating a role of the STRN gene in cardiovascular regulation.
title: Striatin plays a major role in angiotensin II-induced cardiomyocyte and cardiac hypertrophy in mice in vivo

finding: Linkage of the SNP rs2540923 to increased blood pressure was established, further supporting the association of STRN with cardiovascular traits.
title: Striatin plays a major role in angiotensin II-induced cardiomyocyte and cardiac hypertrophy in mice in vivo

finding: The SNP rs3770770 was linked not only to increased blood pressure but also to QRS/PR interval, indicating its significance in cardiac functionality.
title: Striatin plays a major role in angiotensin II-induced cardiomyocyte and cardiac hypertrophy in mice in vivo

finding: This SNP was associated with variations in the QRS/PR interval, highlighting its relevance in cardiac electrical properties.
title: Striatin plays a major role in angiotensin II-induced cardiomyocyte and cardiac hypertrophy in mice in vivo

finding: SNP rs2003585 was connected to hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and heart failure, indicating its importance in serious cardiac conditions.
title: Striatin plays a major role in angiotensin II-induced cardiomyocyte and cardiac hypertrophy in mice in vivo

finding: The SNP rs62148129 was also labeled as a tag SNP within loci related to schizophrenia (SCZ). It showed interactions with the gene Emx1, which further emphasized the role of cEnhancers overlapping SCZ credible set SNPs in fetal development and their implications in adult disease risk.
title: Integrative analysis of the 3D genome and epigenome in mouse embryonic tissues

finding: The rs7571971 variant was found in the EIF2AK3 locus (p = 0.03), reinforcing the connection between genetic predisposition and neurodegenerative processes related to tauopathy.
title: Genome-wide association study and functional validation implicates JADE1 in tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs56350804 was identified as a significant deletion variant with a posterior inclusion probability of 0.9998. It was found to be intronic to the SH3YL1 gene and was associated with the expression of SH3YL1, ACP1, and ALKAL2. Notably, the ALKAL2 gene's expression was significantly modulated by rs56350804 in cervical spinal cord tissue with a p-value of 3.0×10^-16. The Drosophila homolog of ALKAL2, known as Alk, had previously been shown to extend lifespan, suggesting a potential role of ALKAL2 in visual function and aging processes.
title: Longitudinal fundus imaging and its genome-wide association analysis provide evidence for a human retinal aging clock

finding: The rs309137 variant was identified as a regulatory variant with chromatin looping interactions with the CXCR4 promoter, affecting blood CD34+ cell levels.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: The rs11688530 variant was found to have regulatory effects associated with the CXCR4 promoter, contributing to the pathophysiology of blood CD34+ cell levels.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: The rs10193623 variant displayed chromatin looping interactions with the CXCR4 promoter, and it was implicated in altering CD34+ cell levels.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: This rare variant indicated significant heterogeneity in its association with blood CD34+ cell levels between blood donors and primary care patients.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: The variant rs75671397 at IFIH1 acted as a protective variant in T1D, being conditionally independent of other known signals within this gene and linked to lower disease risk.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The variant rs3087243 at CTLA4 showed an overlap in an acinar-specific cCRE while also accessible in regulatory T cells, indicating a dual role in T1D risk through immune modulation.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The study found that the homozygous genotypes AA and GG of Ala307Thr (rs6165) in the FSHR gene were the most common in women with primary amenorrhea (PA), while the homozygous genotype AA was more prevalent in women with secondary amenorrhea (SA). The allele A was indicated as an etiological factor associated with amenorrhea, whereas allele G was identified as a protective agent against the condition, with these findings supported by the results of PCR-RFLP and subsequent Sanger sequencing.
title: Cytogenetic screening of chromosomal abnormalities and genetic analysis of FSH receptor Ala307Thr and Ser680Asn genes in amenorrheic patients

finding: It was established that the homozygous genotype GG and the heterozygous genotype AG of Ser680Asn (rs6166) were more frequent in patients with both PA and SA compared to healthy control women. The allele G demonstrated a highly significant positive association with amenorrhea, while allele A was negatively linked to the disease and could be considered a protective allele, as suggested by the odds ratio analysis.
title: Cytogenetic screening of chromosomal abnormalities and genetic analysis of FSH receptor Ala307Thr and Ser680Asn genes in amenorrheic patients

finding: The COL4A3 rs55703767 polymorphism was found to be associated with susceptibility to Type 2 diabetes, providing insight into genetic vulnerabilities linked to diabetes.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The study reported an association of SLC11A1(NRAMP1) rs17235409 with susceptibility to spinal tuberculosis in a southern Han Chinese population, suggesting its role in infectious disease vulnerability.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The 'A' allele of the cis-eQTL/reQTL (rs13034664) in PHA-stimulated T cells was associated with lower CCL20 expression and increased risk of childhood-onset asthma, showcasing the complex relationship between eQTLs and disease susceptibility.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The rs2304672 polymorphism in the PER2 gene was found to moderate activity in circadian-relevant reward circuitry, specifically in adolescents. This finding relates to opioid use disorder (OUD) in that altered molecular rhythms in the brain, which include circadian aspects, are implicated in opioid reward and dependence. Given the study's focus on the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and nucleus accumbens, the implications of this SNP could extend to associations with sleep-related phenotypes and disruptions in dopamine and GABAergic neurotransmission that were seen in OUD subjects.
title: Molecular rhythm alterations in prefrontal cortex and nucleus accumbens associated with opioid use disorder

finding: This variant was similarly linked to FFQ participation, with the allele associated with higher cognitive performance correlating with increased completion of FFQs.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The CREB1 gene polymorphism rs6740584 was correlated with type 2 diabetes Mellitus in Egyptians, suggesting avenues for further exploration in diabetes susceptibility.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs187943382, causing the MATN3 V220A mutation, was found in the healthy allele of MATN3 in a patient who also had the MATN3 T120M mutation. It was suggested that this SNP could exacerbate the pathology caused by T120M since both are within the vWFa domain and might act synergistically to worsen protein misfolding. This SNP was detected in healthy controls as well, indicating its presence does not inherently cause pathology, but it may worsen existing MED pathology without being the primary cause.
title: Human iPSC-derived hypertrophic chondrocytes reveal a mutation-specific unfolded protein response in chondrodysplasias

finding: In the analysis of HCC samples, rs584542 (chr2:21232803:T>C) was identified as a germline variant. The variant was part of a recurring dinucleotide variant that included three true positives and was confirmed through orthogonal whole-exome sequencing. It was successfully filtered out during the PoN (panel of normals) analysis due to its presence in the PoN.
title: PipeIT2: A tumor-only somatic variant calling workflow for Molecular Diagnostic Ion Torrent sequencing data

finding: Similarly, rs1041968 (chr2:21232804:G>A) was validated as a germline variant in the HCC sample analysis. It was part of the same recurring dinucleotide variant as rs584542, confirmed by orthogonal whole-exome sequencing, and was also successfully filtered out in the PoN analysis.
title: PipeIT2: A tumor-only somatic variant calling workflow for Molecular Diagnostic Ion Torrent sequencing data

finding: The context involving rs13020328 related to glioblastoma cancer stem cells indicated that it was associated with the survival mechanism mediated by SerpinB3. This SNP was highlighted in the study by Castelli et al. (2021), which discussed mechanisms of cancer stem cell resistance to programmed cell death. The findings suggested that allelic variants in this region may contribute to the expression levels of SerpinB3, thereby impacting the efficacy of radiation therapy in glioblastoma, as SerpinB3 was identified as a critical factor in cellular resistance and tumor growth.
title: SerpinB3 drives cancer stem cell survival in glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs13010131 was associated with immune checkpoint inhibitors in the context of bladder cancer treatment. This finding suggested a potential influence of genetic variations on responses to immunotherapy, which is particularly relevant given the host inflammatory response triggered by the urogenital schistosomiasis infection.
title: RNA-seq gene expression profiling of the bladder in a mouse model of urogenital schistosomiasis

finding: The SNP rs6733839, located in a region of open chromatin, was associated with significant changes in chromatin accessibility, with a p-value less than 6.1×10^-10. This association colocalised highly with the Alzheimer’s disease (AD) association signal, with a posterior probability of colocalisation of 0.996. The AD risk allele created a predicted high-affinity binding site for the MEF2A transcription factor, and this effect was specifically noted in primary microglia and iPS-derived macrophages.
title: A map of transcriptional heterogeneity and regulatory variation in human microglia

finding: The SNP rs780094 in GCKR was associated with metabolic traits and was linked to incident diabetes and cardiovascular disease, indicating its relevance in cardiovascular pathogenesis.
title: Identification and Interaction Analysis of Molecular Markers in Myocardial Infarction by Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The variant rs7589901 was identified as a significant caQTL influencing chromatin accessibility at the PAX8 locus. Its reference allele A was associated with increased chromatin accessibility and was concordant with the eQTL effect direction, suggesting that increased chromatin accessibility at this variant leads to increased expression of the PAX8 gene in whole blood. Furthermore, ZNF135 was predicted to bind at this locus, with the alternate C allele favored for binding. This variant plays a critical role in linking chromatin accessibility to gene expression outcomes.
title: Genotype inference from aggregated chromatin accessibility data reveals genetic regulatory mechanisms

finding: The GWAS variant rs7421852, located approximately 3,000 bp from rs7589901, was found to be associated with increased blood urea levels and exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs7589901 (r²=0.85). This relationship indicates that changes in chromatin accessibility mediated by rs7589901 may affect expression levels of PAX8, subsequently influencing blood urea levels. The data propose a mechanism where alterations in ZNF135 binding at these variants could inform on the regulatory landscape impacting blood urea concentration.
title: Genotype inference from aggregated chromatin accessibility data reveals genetic regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs13407913 showed association with more than 5 CpGs located within the gene body of ADCY3, indicating a potential role in gene regulation related to IBD.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: The variant rs13021737 was associated with positive causal effects in the analysis, but it contributed to horizontal pleiotropy, indicating its role in the relationship between sedentary time and BMI.
title: Mendelian randomization suggests a bidirectional, causal relationship between physical inactivity and obesity

finding: The SNP rs13394744 (A>T) was identified as affecting alternative polyadenylation (APA) in the gene ANKMY1. Variants of this SNP included either the canonical polyadenylation signal AATAAA or a weaker signal AATTAA. Analysis revealed that individuals homozygous for the A allele (A/A) exhibited higher expression of the internal polyadenylation (IPA) region compared to individuals with either heterozygous A/T alleles or homozygous T/T alleles. A Pearson correlation coefficient of -0.51 indicated an inverse relationship between increased IPA and decreased overall gene expression. Additionally, experiments utilizing HEK293T cells demonstrated that manipulating APA through CRISPRpas increased the IPA/FL isoform ratio while decreasing the full-length (FL) transcript expression, showcasing the significant impact of this SNP on gene expression through its influence on APA.
title: CRISPRpas: Programmable regulation of alternative polyadenylation by dCas9

finding: This SNP was recently found to be associated with eyebrow thickness and facial morphology in Eurasians.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: The SNP rs2042138 was linked to aggressive features of pancreatic cancer, particularly in the context of hypoxia which triggered a metabolic switch contributing to tumor aggressiveness. It was noted that hypoxia could influence the overall pathology of PDAC, through mechanisms that also included the activation of MAPK pathways.
title: A histone methylation-MAPK signaling axis drives durable epithelial-mesenchymal transition in hypoxic pancreas cancer

finding: The SNP rs4988235, located at the MCM6/LCT locus, was associated with signals of selection in the context of lactose tolerance among West Eurasians. This finding was significant as it highlighted the genetic adaptation to dietary changes following the Neolithic transition.
title: Ancestral contributions to contemporary European complex traits

finding: The variant rs1260326, a missense variant located in the GCKR gene, was identified with a significant interaction effect as its smallest single SNP p-value was 3.3e-6. This variant has been previously associated with alcohol consumption, and notable interactions between variants in GCKR and alcohol consumption have been specifically reported for gout disease. Thus, the finding supports the relevance of rs1260326 in gene-lifestyle interactions.
title: Large-scale multivariate multi-ancestry Interaction analyses point towards different genetic mechanisms by population and exposure

finding: This SNP was also recognized as a rare variant tied to African ancestry, being significant only in the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: This SNP was categorized as a rare variant associated with American ancestry and was significant only in the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The SNP rs13020190 was identified as related to cold shock proteins (CSPs) during major biological transitions in the life cycle of the poplar rust fungus. Its expression was correlated with the dormancy exit process, particularly in the developmental transition from telia to basidia. This investigation revealed the implications of this SNP in enhancing cell growth in yeast under cold stress, thereby confirming its role in the genetic regulation of response to environmental cues.
title: Expert annotation and life-cycle transcriptomics of transcription factors in rust fungi (Pucciniales) highlight the role of cold shock proteins in dormancy exit

finding: The rs111781203 variant in the CCL20 gene was shown to decrease the risk of IBD. It was noted for its high expression in LND cells, which were specifically associated with CD/IBD. This finding added to the understanding of genetic factors involved in the susceptibility to IBD.
title: A Specialized Epithelial Cell Type Regulating Mucosal Immunity and Driving Human Crohn’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs838720 was included in the findings of the GWAS and suggested connections to pancreatic cancer risk, particularly related to T2D.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs1260326 at the GCKR locus presented as a maximally associated variant, affecting serum urate levels effectively.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
